author: {'steamid': '76561198158454682', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2107, 'last_played': 1709233559}
review:
Buen rato el que me dio; es corto y falto de contenido, ademÃ¡s de tener muchos problemas tÃ©cnicos, pero es entretenido y te engancha con sus facetas de exploraciÃ³n y mecanicas de parkour (limitado pero satisfactorio), sobre todo las ESCALADAS, es muy divertido subir por entornos y altas montaÃ±as con simples mecÃ¡nicas, pero que cumplen con hacerte sentir esa sensaciÃ³n de vertigo y tensiÃ³n que es tan placentero (casi orgÃ¡smico ^^).

Su faceta de exploraciÃ³n muy interesante, te dan libertad en su gran mapa, te ponen de inicio en un punto y VE A DONDE QUIERAS, tÃº eliges por donde comenzar y que sendero seguir, a sabiendas que en cada punto del mapa puedes encontrar pistas sobre la trama y saber que esta pasando en la isla, o la necesidad de conseguir algun elemento (por lo general llave) para acceder a un lugar, que posiblemente se encuentre en otro punto alejado del mapa, todo con muchas microhistorias de anteriores habitantes de esos lugares. Vamos, es decir miel para un explorador. 

Los puntos negativos se comprenden al ser un INDIE que ha hecho lo que ha podido con su presupuesto y a pesar de eso se han esforzado por incluir muchas mecÃ¡nicas interesantes en diferentes facetas.

El diÃ¡logo postcrÃ©dito si conseguiste el final bueno, es muy revelador, gira y sazona la trama y nos deja en muy mala posiciÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007825954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1702209606}
review:
Alptraum in der Parkour-HÃ¶lle

In "Die Young" spielen Sie eine junge Frau, die sich, gejagt von mysteriÃ¶sen, blutrÃ¼nstigen HÃ¤schern, quer Ã¼ber eine Insel in der Ã„gÃ¤is schlagen muss, um einen rettenden KÃ¼stenstrand zu erreichen, von dem aus sie diesem Alptraum entkommen zu kÃ¶nnen hofft. Schwach und so gut wie wehrlos - was sich im Verlauf des Spiels aber Ã¤ndern soll - muss die junge Daphne allen Gefahren trotzen, die rÃ¤tselhaften Geschehnisse aufklÃ¤ren und dem Grauen die Stirn bieten.

SchÃ¶n garstige Idee, geheimnisvoll und bedrohlich, eingebettet in ein ungewÃ¶hliches Setting, umgesetzt noch dazu mit der tollen Optik einer lichtdurchfluteten, farbsatten mediterranen Insel, die wunderschÃ¶ne Aussichtspunkte bietet. 

Leider aber haben die Entwickler eine hammerharte Parkour-Mechanik eingefÃ¼hrt. Ab und an muss man Felsen erklimmen, sich an VorsprÃ¼ngen emporhangeln und vor allem Ã¼ber weite AbgrÃ¼nde springen. Das mÃ¼sste doch an sich fÃ¼r einen geÃ¼bten Assassins-Creed Spieler keinerlei Probleme bereiten, denkt man sich da. Aber weit gefehlt. Das Gameplay ist so unbarmherzig, dass jeder nicht haargenau auf die Millisekunde getimte Absprung zum Absturz fÃ¼hrt und somit fast immer zum Tod. Und natÃ¼rlich, Sie ahnen es, kann man nicht manuell speichern, sodass man ja nicht etwa vor einer Sprung-Partie, mit der man MÃ¼he bekundet, einen Speicherpunkt anlegen kann. Vielleicht bin ich ja in Sachen Geschicklichkeit tatsÃ¤chlich sehr schlecht aufgestellt, aber es wundert mich schon, dass dieses Game so gut bewertet wird, denn eine brutalere Parkour-Mechanik sah ich in meinem Gamerleben nie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137026460', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1627, 'last_played': 1699554654}
review:
[h1] [b] [i] A run-of-the-mill parkour survival game on the surface, an amalgamation of mastercrafted world-building bellow the tip of the iceberg [/i] [/b] [/h1]

[h1] [b] [i] â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜†â˜† [/i] [/b] [/h1]

Die Young offered me a rather unexpected experience. Looking over its description and subsequently playing a few hours made me believe that this was just a run-of-the-mill survival game with crafting elements with a skin-deep story to move it forward. I thought that it had nothing special, nothing that would set it apart from the plethora of other, similar titles that are funneled into Steam on a weekly basis. I realized I was wrong and the more I played, the surer I became.

[h1] [i] â€œToday, Iâ€™m giving you the opportunity to be reborn. Here, youâ€™ve been deprived of EVERYTHING, yet you still came this far, relying only on your own strengths. No shortcuts, not opportunism. You have learnt the hard way which things in life are indispensable.

Be honest â€“ youâ€™ve never felt as proud of yourself as you do now.â€ [/i] [/h1]

Letâ€™s get the main deterrent from actually finishing the game out of the way first â€“ the core gameplay loop you experience within the first 1-3 hours stays essentially the same throughout the entire 20- or so hour game. You only discover the occasional (but useful) piece of unique loot but you wonâ€™t get any new climbing or fighting abilities and you wonâ€™t be able to diversify your playstyle to any major extent. That alone may drive many people away finishing the game and most likely did, given the fact that only under 5% of players actually finished it.

However, if you decide to push through some less â€œexcitingâ€ parts, you will get an experience no other game will give you. Yes, Dying Light has vastly superior parkour, The Forest has much better combat and pretty much any other major survival game has deeper crafting system, BUT no other game weds these three aspects together and this is where Die Youngâ€™s uniqueness shines the most. What additionally bolsters the gameâ€™s feeling/atmosphere is its unusual setting â€“ a sunny, gorgeous little island just off the Turkish coast which initially lulls you into it feeling safe, until you start unraveling its brutality and harshness. I was always a fan of such contrasts and itâ€™s not an easy thing to pull of well but Indie Gala managed to do just that.

Lastly, I want to address the interesting take on the traditional â€œsurvive after being captured and escapeâ€ story. Whatâ€™s most atypical here is the motivations behind your adversaries â€“ they are not savages, cannibals or just a regular cult but rather a group of disillusioned socialistic extremists trying to denounce contemporary capitalistic society and create their own isolated utopia free from modern influences and vices. To that end, they are not afraid to kidnap foreigners and make them undergo series of deadly trials in an attempt to expunge all vestiges of modern civilization out of them so that they would take their place alongside them as â€œre-educatedâ€ members of the community. The more you unravel the gameâ€™s lore, the more f*cked up  it becomes but youâ€™ll also see, where the cult leadersâ€™ delusions originate from. I canâ€™t stress enough how much I love this conception of storytelling.

To conclude â€“ if you go into Die Young expecting deep crafting, parkour, combat and survival systems, you WILL be disappointed â€“ all of these are very surface-level and by themselves wonâ€™t keep you invested. However, if you manage to immerse yourself in its amazingly crafted world and narrative that binds it together, you will have experience like no other.

[h1] [b] [u] Positives & Negatives [/u] [/b] [/h1]

[table]
[tr]
	[th][b] [i] Positives [/i] [/b][/th]
	[th][b] [i] Negatives [/i] [/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Never-seen-before take on the usual "escape hostile territory" scenario with intersting narrative and storyline[/td]
	[td]+ The first big issue is the game's performance - it's superbly bad at times. The game runs smoothly for the most part but frequently and regularly stutters, no matter your PC specs, which is simply unacceptable after the years of polishing the devs did[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Great graphical style and direction, bolstered by great lighting[/td]
	[td]+ The gameplay can get stale after 10-15 hours of doing the same thing, parkour moves being the exact same and combat only getting invigorated by receiving the only ranged weapon crafting allowing for a few more tools  while the parkour stays virtually the same the entire time[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Combination of survival, fighting and parkour which is rare to see in survival games[/td]
	[td]+ The game is still quite buggy (luckily nothing game-breaking as far as I can tell)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Great deal of slowly unravelling content - this game is a lot of things but short or lacking in content is not one of them[/td]
	[td]+ Graphically, the game makes me split - on one hand, it looks absolutely gorgeous from the distance but up-close, everything looks somewhat washed out[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Exploration is well-made and rewarding with constant need to adapt to new situations[/td]
	[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Surprisingly decent voice-acting and character development of Daphne - I was wary of playing as some spoiled bratty chick but the way she becomes hardened through hardships she has been amazing to see[/td]
	[td]- Even though I praise Daphne's character, I have to point out her inconsistency in what she is terrified and shaken by and what leaves her unimpressed and even amused - it seems like the devs did not know how they want her to behave in certain parts of the story [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Developed lore of the world and the motivations behind the main antagonists[/td]
	[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ One of the best things on the game is without a doubt the soundtrack - using Synthwave as the artistic direction was amazing decision. Tracks like "Wrong Choice" or "Stone Pillars" immensely bolstered the game'S atmosphere and feel[/td]
	[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Well-thought-out endings[/td]
	[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

review: O jogo Ã© bom mas Ã© uma mistura de far cry com tomb raider, entÃ£o se vocÃª quer uma sobrevivencia melhor, jogue far cry e se vocÃª quer parkour jogue tomb raider. mas se vocÃª nÃ£o pode jogar nenhum dos dois, jogue Die Young que Ã© legalzinho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165325875', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1699110607}
review: Ein gutes Horror-Survival Game, weder ist es low noch high, wÃ¼rde es als Mid beschreiben, wobei die Story bei dem hier einen echt gut fesseln kann. Finde das Setting auf einer Insel mit vielen Gefahren als auch gefÃ¤hrlichen Kult Mitgliedern sehr interessant und auch gut umgesetzt. Finde das Spiel vom Gameplay her ganz okay. Es wird viel geklettert und die Insel in der Geschichte ist perfekt dafÃ¼r. Das einzige was ich in dem Spiel so richtig vermisst habe sind gewisse Stealth Elemente die man aus anderen Spielen kennt, sowas wie Takedowns oder beseitigen von Leichen. Das KÃ¤mpfen geht recht langsam zu, also was das dodgen, hauen und stechen angeht. Es gibt nichts dynamisches an dem Spiel, keine krassen Animation, nichts was einen so richtig Ã¼berraschen wÃ¼rde. Das Spiel hat eine solide Grafik, die Beleuchtung und die Schatten sind echt schÃ¶n,  manche Orte lassen sich wirklich sehen. Die Story und die kletter Einheiten sind die Parts in dem Spiel die mich echt gefesselt haben. Kann ich empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970212056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1696449889}
review:
I must say, that even though the game is a bit chunky, it is a well designed and exciting experience!!
The parkour elements are brilliant, the story is solid, and there are plenty of hours in the game.
The start is a bit dull, but it quickly gets more tense, and as you move along, you can find many ways to complete the game.
Give it a few hours, it will grow on you!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121927012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 3907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3907, 'last_played': 1694024116}
review:
Die Young is a pretty cool survival horror indie game. You definitely have to use stealth and your wits in order to survive this horrific island. You have to craft items, hide in grass/bushes, run away, fight back, etc in order to survive. You play as a young woman named Daphne who randomly wakes up from the bottom of a water-less well and finds out she's on a island filled with cult-controlled crazies. She must do her best to stay alive and survive while trying to find her friends. 

This survival horror indie game was pretty good and pretty big. It is semi open-world but luckily there's an option to fast travel to different areas once you find the hidden fast travel stone shelters. Overall I kind of liked playing this and it was quite fun.

I highly recommend getting this game when it's heavily discounted and then try this game out.

> Hear about this game called Die Young ðŸï¸
> "Sounds like my chances of survival in real life," I joke to myself ðŸ˜…
> Decide to give it a shot anyway ðŸ’ª
> Boot up the game, expecting to die within the first five minutes â³
> Character wakes up on a beautiful Mediterranean island ðŸŒ…
> "Wow, this place is nicer than my apartment," I think ðŸ¤”
> Start exploring, find some cliffs and caves ðŸžï¸

> Begin to contemplate how nice it would be if this island had Wi-Fi ðŸ“¶
> Suddenly remember I'm here to survive, not to check Instagram ðŸš«ðŸ“±
> Gather some sticks and stones, feeling like a discount Bear Grylls ðŸ»
> Encounter my first enemy, a creepy dude with a machete ðŸ”ª
> Wonder if I can convince him to join me for a nice picnic instead of trying to stab me ðŸ§º
> He declines and tries to stab me anyway ðŸ™„
> Panic and try to remember if I've seen enough horror movies to survive this ðŸŽ¬
> Wish I had paid more attention to the survival tips on the loading screen ðŸ¤”ðŸ’¡

> Try to channel my inner Lara Croft and start practicing parkour to escape ðŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸
> Climb cliffs, leap over gaps, and tumble down hills like a clumsy gymnast ðŸ¤¸â€â™‚ï¸
> Feel like an action hero, despite the fact that I trip over my own feet every five minutes ðŸ¤£
> Despite the lack of jump scares, the game's immersive, psychological horror keeps me on edge ðŸ˜±

> It's official, I'm losing my mind on this island ðŸ¤ª

[b] Title: Harley Quinn and Pals Get Game Crazy with Die Young

[The scene opens in Harley Quinn's hideout, with Harley, Mr. Freeze, Poison Ivy, and Catwoman lounging on bean bags, surrounded by snacks and gaming controllers. A big screen illuminates the room with the Die Young logo.]

Harley: Alright, puddin's! Game night's in session, and we're diving into Die Young! 

Mr. Freeze: Let's hope this game is as chilling as my puns. 

Poison Ivy: As long as I can rescue some plants, I'm game.

Catwoman: I'm only here for the treasure. 

[They start the game, and the screen lights up with the vibrant island setting of Die Young.]

Harley: Whoa, look at this place! It's like a tropical nightmare!

Mr. Freeze: These graphics are colder than a polar bear's toenails.

Poison Ivy: Ah, the lush foliage! Makes me want to sprout a few vines.

Catwoman: Let's hope the loot's as good as the scenery.

[As they navigate through the game, they encounter traps, enemies, and hidden treasures.]

Harley: Watch out for those traps, darlings! They're nastier than the Joker on a bad hair day.

Mr. Freeze: These enemies are as annoying as a malfunctioning freeze ray.

Poison Ivy: Oh, look, a hidden grove! It's like finding an oasis in a desert.

Catwoman: Ah, the thrill of the hunt! Reminds me of a good heist.

[As they progress, they encounter challenging puzzles.]

Harley: Riddles, puzzles... reminds me of the Riddler. Less annoying though.

Mr. Freeze: The key to this puzzle seems to be patience. Something I have in short supply.

Poison Ivy: Patience is a virtue, Freeze. Just like tending to delicate flowers.

Catwoman: Puzzles, puzzles... reminds me of cracking a high-security vault. Good times.

[As they play, there's banter and playful flirting between the women.]

Harley: Hey Ivy, if you were a plant, you'd be a cute-umber!

Poison Ivy: Oh Harley, you always know how to make my leaves blush.

Catwoman: (smirking) Careful, ladies, don't want to make Mr. Freeze feel left out. 

Mr. Freeze: Oh, I'm used to the cold shoulder, Catwoman.

[As they near the end of the game, they share their final thoughts.]

Harley: So, what's the verdict, gang? Did Die Young leave us dying for more?

Mr. Freeze: It was chillingly good. A definite win for me.

Poison Ivy: I loved the environmental themes. A green thumbs up from me.

Catwoman: The loot was purrfect, and the challenges kept me clawing for more. Two paws up!

Harley: There you have it, folks! Die Young gets the Harley Quinn stamp of approval! Until next time, puddin's! 

[They share a laugh, and the screen fades to black as they prepare for their next gaming adventure.] [/b]

On an island, where sunbeams play,

author: {'steamid': '76561197970177160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1692745988}
review:
Definitely worth the time.

PRO's
1. Good time killer.
2. Move at your own pace.
3. Engaging.
4. Interesting story involving the real world.
5. Music is catchy and decent to listen to.
6. Has some cursing and swearing but is not over kill.
7. Diverse methods to handle situations.
8. Environment is with a semi-open world.

CON's
1. Takes a little bit of time getting use to controls without a guide.
2. Enemies are highly repetitive and lack diversity.
3. extremely limited inventory for a while in the game.
4. A lot of back tracking to different points due to lack of larger scale content.
5. The prisoner in the tower hangs himself so there is no point in rescuing him.
6. You cannot save Dave, even though i enjoyed burning him. (lol)
7. Clothing / attire is quite limited and could use more options.
8. Sometimes while climbing... problems occur and you fall to your death which could have been avoided with better placement of climbing sections.

There were no bugs which prevented me from completing the game however there was a bug in which the side quests sub tasks/goals were not registering at all.  Reloading the game to a previous save did not fix it either, I had to find another method and surpass the quest and move on to other things.

This title deserves a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010334196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1474, 'last_played': 1684605482}
review:
At first, I had to get use of the movement mechanics, since I expected something similar to mirrors edge and similar games. Die Young takes a something different approach on that, but If you get a hang on it, you certainly could have your joy parkouring over tricky terrain and breathtaking heights. Speaking of them- the environment looks gorgious and rewards the expolation-friendly player for the most of the time.

The story isn't the most innovative, but it works, even though I don't get the maincharacters over the time growing black humor, mocking over corpses and whatnot.

All in all a nice short game, even though I quite dislike the approach for the ending sequence (without spoiling too much).

Also a nice short dlc, giving more of the endgameelements in a compressed sidestory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198443310722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1618, 'last_played': 1643218651}
review:
Die Young, es de esos tÃ­tulos que ni has oÃ­do hablar, ya que no tienen los recursos o publicidad para darse a conocer.
El juego puede, en sÃ­, parecerte pausado, pobre, con poca credibilidad, puesto que se nota en ese aspecto segÃºn lo juegas. Pero si intentamos meternos en nuestro personaje, quizÃ¡s ese sentimiento pobre, desolado, cobre mÃ¡s fuerza, pues estÃ¡s en un lugar desconocido, sin saber donde ir, y si le aÃ±adimos el modo Survival, coge mÃ¡s fuerza.
Las implementaciones de Parkour estÃ¡n bastante bien conseguidas, aunque a veces son algo tediosas, bÃ¡sicamente porque te caes o crees que pulsaste el botÃ³n de saltar y no salta, algo tÃ­pico.
NarraciÃ³n hay poca, LOGROS fÃ¡ciles de obtener, retos no es que sean retorcidos sus puzzles, pero al menos te invita a que pienses. Sus combates podrÃ­an estar mejor elaborados, pero su escasa acciÃ³n compensa en que aquÃ­ no somos Rambo.
GrÃ¡ficamente, estÃ¡ muy bien, su sistema de crafteo puede ser pobre, sÃ­, los diÃ¡logos muy Americanizados.
Pero si buscas un juego con toques de suspense, sangre, parkour y supervivencia, Die Young ofrece un entretenimiento bÃ¡sico, que a un mÃ³dico precio, es de agradecer el poder disfrutar de este tÃ­tulo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011086924', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 436, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1681265030}
review:
So after beating the game, I can say it is impressive through and through. It has a few bugs like any game but it is more polished than 99% of AAA games you'll play. Voice acting did falter later in the game and in the cutscenes when you rest but most of the time it is high quality otherwise. This is a hidden gem for sure!

Previous First Impression Review: Usually I beat the whole game before leaving a review but I don't need to finish this one beforehand because it is GOLD! So much polish, tight controls, intuitive maneuvering, rock solid level design, an actual intriguing story, great voice acting, gorgeous graphics... the list goes on! This blows ALL of the Tomb Raider games out of the water! Those games are sub par already but this is what they aim to be and don't come CLOSE! Thank you devs for this true work of passion and not an insult to the industry like 95% of AAA games coming out today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053940839', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 730, 'playtime_forever': 1814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1814, 'last_played': 1680039407}
review: Bevor man sich Die Young zu GemÃ¼te fÃ¼hrt, sollte man sich einmal die eigentliche Vorgeschichte anschauen. Das ist hier auf Steam ein eigenstÃ¤ndiges Spiel mit dem Namen Die Young: Prologue. Und das ist richtig gut: Als Gefangene auf der Flucht, muss man von einer tÃ¼rkischen Mittelmeerinsel entkommen. Eine groÃŸe Anzahl von Gegnern sind uns auf den Fersen und es geht ums nackte Ãœberleben. Man kann die Gegner direkt angreifen, sie mit Giftpfeilen tÃ¶ten, oder sich einfach vorbeischleichen um sie hinterrÃ¼cks zu erledigen. Was sich im Prolog als extrem spannend und unterhaltsam darstellt, mutiert im eigentlichen Spiel zu einem langweiligem Such und Find. Man wird quer durch die Botanik gescheucht um langweilige Quests zu erledigen und um ein paar Wildtiere zu tÃ¶ten. Erst zum Ende hin nimmt das Spiel wieder richtig an Fahrt auf. Es wird spannend und die KÃ¤mpfe machen endlich wieder SpaÃŸ. Die Grafik ist durchgehend auf einem guten Niveau. Man findet Ã¼berall liebevoll gestaltete Insellandschaften. Die Young ist eher kein klassisches Survial-Spiel. Hier geht es mehr darum zu erkunden und zu erforschen und in einer extrem feindlichen Welt mit sehr begrenzten Mittel zu Ã¼berleben. Das macht zwar streckenweise richtig SpaÃŸ, raubt einem manchmal aber auch den letzten Nerv.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046075710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3445, 'last_played': 1705783907}
review:
Tried the game without knowing anything prior to it. Highly recommend to start it that way, so it will bring you surprise after surprise. Try explore everything, that way you will find most what is needed to complete the game.

Highly immersive with its gruesome story setting. I completed all achievements and all three endings. Bought on a low price, played 57 hours, it is really an indie gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561199017021483', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1688917633}
review:
Wirklich tolles Spiel mit Suchtpotential!

Speichert lieber einmal zu viel als ne Stunde gespielt zu haben, nur um dann zu sterben^^

Die Entwickler haben echt gute Arbeit geleistet und ich hoffe auf einen zweiten Teil! Beziehungsweise auf eine Fortsetzung mit Daphne.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993172532', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1674155433}
review: The game is well done but i cant recommend it. The way you traverse the world is a pain in the butt and kills any sense of freedom the parcour system should offer you. Without guidance online you are often clueless where to go next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020267341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1675467444}
review:
It's a really fun game. The story line is intriguing, the survival and crafting systems are what you would anticipate from a survival game. Saving the game is limited which is both a blessing and a curse. If you're pressed for time and have to log out, you've lost a lot of what you've achieved. If you find that sweet save point, you know where to return before you log out next time. Don't start this if you're on a time-crunch and want to keep your progress (unless you are willing to die and repeat).


The only major flaw, which isn't really that much of a flaw, is that the voice acting in the majority of the cut-scenes is absolutely robotic and devoid of any emotion. It really detached me from my character. Furthermore, it seems to have zero bearing on the story in which I'm currently engaged. I'm in a fight for my life. I don't care if my past relationship ended on a bad note. Still, make me believe it, don't just read the weather to me.

But apart from that, I've thoroughly enjoyed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 2065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2065, 'last_played': 1668714561}
review:
Ein exzellentes Open-World-Horror-Adventure mit Jump&Run-Aspekten.

Das Spiel hat mich im positiven Sinne Ã¼berrascht und in seinen Bann gezogen. Kurz gesagt ist es ein Mix aus The Forest und Mirror's Edge.

Zu dem Spiel gibt es einen [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/973000/]Prolog[/url], den man aber vielleicht eher hinterher spielt.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2889841515
[b]Geschichte[/b]

Schauplatz ist eine (fiktive) Insel im griechisch-tÃ¼rkischen Grenzgebiet abseits jeder Ã¶ffentlichen Bekanntheit.

Eine Gruppe junger, abenteuerlustiger Leute will hier abhÃ¤ngen. Doch es wird etwas anders als erwartet.

Wir spielen Daphne, ein Mitglied dieser Gruppe. Sie erwacht am Boden eines trockenen Brunnen, ohne recht zu wissen, was mit ihr oder ihren Freunden geschah. Dank ihrer Freeclimbing-Fertigkeiten kann sie aus dem Brunnen entkommen und macht sich auf die Suche nach ihren Begleitern und einer MÃ¶glichkeit, die Insel zu verlassen.

Zu dem Zweck erforscht sie die Insel, lernt nach und nach deren Bewohner, Besucher und Geheimnisse kennen und muss ihre Fertigkeiten zum Ãœberleben nutzen.

Die Geschichte ist relativ bald zwar im groÃŸen Bogen zu erahnen, bleibt aber sehr interessant gestaltet, mit ausfÃ¼hrlicher Hintergrundgeschichte und Einzelschicksalen. Die Gesamtgeschichte ist weitaus umfangreicher, als es mir am Anfang erschien. Zudem ist sie cool gemacht.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2889449461
[b]Gameplay[/b]

Das Gameplay besteht aus mehreren Aspekten.

Erkunden. Wir befinden uns auf einer Insel und die ist quasi frei zugÃ¤nglich. Aber nicht sofort gÃ¤nzlich. Zudem sind die Wege oft verschlungen und bilden auch mal Sackgassen oder EinbahnstraÃŸen. Das Erkunden der Umgebung ist wichtig und machte SpaÃŸ) und lÃ¤sst Daphne viele Geheimnisse entdecken. Teils werden wir auch durch die Haupt- und Nebenquests dazu animiert. Ich habe es geliebt, die Insel zu erkunden. Oft ist es gar nicht einfach zu erkennen, wie man wo hinkommt und ich war vielfach Ã¼berrascht, was sich da alles an Arealen, Klettersteigen und Wegen findet und ob man wieder etwas Interessantes entdeckt.

Die Insel ist unglaublich groÃŸ. Man wird da anfangs etwas getÃ¤uscht. Als ich dachte, dem Ende Nahe zu sein, ging es erst so richtig los. Die durch die Quests vorgegebene Richtung macht das Spiel zwar linearer, aber nicht immer. Zudem sind wir frei, die Quests auch spÃ¤ter zu erledigen oder aus anderen GrÃ¼nden nochmal andere Gegenden zu besuchen.

Jump&Run. Daphne ist Freeclimberin und ist darin weltklasse. Sie klettert senkrechte WÃ¤nde hoch, Ã¼berspringt AbgrÃ¼nde und hÃ¼pft von Dach zu Dach. Das erinnert sehr an Mirror's Edge, ist allerdings zum GlÃ¼ck nicht ganz so schwer. Beim Klettern zeigt der Cursor, ob man beim nÃ¤chsten Schritt sicheren Halt hat. Man muss den Weg aber finden und das ist manchmal nicht ganz einfach, zumal die Ausdauer zur Neige gehen kann. Kleiner Tipp: Die richtigen Handschuhe zum Klettern verwenden, sobald man sie gefunden hat (die anderen Handschuhe verringern die Ausdauer).

Schwieriger, ja ggf. frustrierend sind da manche SprÃ¼nge, da sie eben nicht "sicher" sind, sondern gutes Timing erfordern. Eine Zehntelsekunde zu frÃ¼h oder zu spÃ¤t und mancher Sprung (etwa ab der zweiten HÃ¤lfte des Spieles) endet mit einer blutigen Schramme (oder Tod) und einem neuen Versuch, der oft viele Minuten kosten kann.

Ich bin eigentlich kein Junp&Run-Fan. Aber die Schwierigkeit hier war gerade so, dass ich es letztlich immer schaffte (ggf. nach ein paar Versuchen), aber mich doch sehr gefordert fÃ¼hlte, besonders bei lÃ¤ngeren Abschnitten.

Survival. Nicht sonderlich schwer, aber hÃ¤lt einen beschÃ¤ftigt. Man muss nur Durst und Gesundheit im Auge behalten. Hunger gibt es so nicht, nu wird durch Essen (ebenso wie Medizin) Gesundheit aufgefÃ¼llt. Zudem muss man andere Objekte und Resourcen sammeln und weitere Objekte herstellen, die sich auch wieder abnutzen kÃ¶nnen oder verbraucht werden. Das ist alles relativ einfach. Dass ich etwas gebraucht habe, das auf etwa fÃ¼nf Bereiche verteilte Inventar zu verstehen, muss einen nicht abschrecken. Einmal verstanden, war es total simpel.

KÃ¤mpfe. Es gibt sowohl Nahkampf wie Fernkampf. Entsprechend bewaffnet sind wir und/oder unsere Gegner. Neben menschlichen Gegnern gibt es auch Hunde und andere Vierbeiner. Anfangs mÃ¼ssen wir noch fast jeden Gegner fÃ¼rchten und setzen mehr auf Vermeiden, spÃ¤ter sind wir m.M.n. sogar overpowered (bis wir zum Endboss kommen ...). Viele starke Gegner kann man relativ leicht austricksen, die KI ist da nicht sehr helle.

Es kÃ¶nnte sein, dass man auf die meisten KÃ¤mpfe sogar verzichten kann, aber das habe ich noch nicht ausprobiert.

Gespeichert werden kann an jedem Lagerfeuer. Solchen, die man finden muss und notfalls solchen, die man selbst herstellt. Zudem gibt es noch andere automatische Speicherpunkte (z.B. an einem Tunneleingang). Insgesamt wird aber nicht alle Nase lang gespeichert.

Es gibt zwei Schwierigkeitsgrade, die sich leider aber nicht sonderlich unterscheiden (ich glaube, nur die selbstgemachten Lagerfeuer sind beim einfacheren von anfang an verfÃ¼gbar). An sich ist der Schwierigkeitsgrad des Spieles (auch im Vergleich zum Prolog) fÃ¼r mich etwas zu einfach. Wie The Forest macht aber leider auch Die Young denselben Fehler, dass der Endgegner auch im einfachen Schwierigkeitsgrad sehr viel schwerer ist als alles vorher.

Besonders gefallen hat mir das Erkunden der Insel mit ihren Geheimnissen und auch die Kletterpartien waren grandios.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2889839164
[b]Technik[/b]

Das Spiel lief hervorragend. Die gesamte Insel ist ohne Ladebildschirm komplett begehbar. Neue Bereiche werden im Hintergrund geladen und fÃ¼hren nur selten zu kleinen VerzÃ¶gerungen.

Ich hatte wohl drei AbstÃ¼rze im ganzen Spielverlauf und ab und an kuriose Situationen wie schwebende Objekte oder so. Dennoch fand ich insgesamt das Spiel technisch auf einen sehr hohen Stand, es kann mit den groÃŸen Produktionen mithalten.

Die Grafik ist klasse. Die Insel sieht super aus. Oft hat man eine unglaubliche Fernsicht. Aber auch aus der NÃ¤he sehen die Dinge gut aus. Bei dem riesigen Areal der Insel gibt es gewisse Schemata, wie beispielsweise Sprungpassagen aussehen, aber man hat doch unglaublich viele verschiedene Gebiete und individuelle Details. Ganz klasse gemacht.

Der Sound ist gut. Es gibt ab und an passende Musik. Die Dialoge sind auf Englisch und auch die Texte, Dialoge und Quests sind auf Englisch. Daphne wird ganz gut gesprochen. Manchmal auch witzig.

Die Steuerung funktioniert sowhl mi Controller wie mit Tastatur/Maus sehr gut. Diesmal schien mir meistens sogar Tastatur/Maus besser, gerade bei kritischen Kletterpartien und KÃ¤mpfen. Die Tasten lassen sich aber nicht (gut) umbelegen und so spielte ich mit den vorgegeben Tasten (WASD, etc.), was fÃ¼r die meisten Spieler ja problemlos ist.

[b]Sonstiges[/b]

Ich habe Ã¼ber 30h fÃ¼r einen Durchgang benÃ¶tigt, habe mir dabei auch fast alles angeschaut und gemÃ¤chlich gespielt. Ich denke, man kÃ¶nnte, wenn man wollte, es gut auch in 20h schaffen.

Es gibt viele Errungenschaften, viele optional, nicht all zu schwer.

[code][b]In Zahlen fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 10/10.[/b][/code]

Ein exzellentes Open-World-Horror-Adventure, besonders durch viele zu erkundende Geheimnisse und aufwendigen Jump&Run-Passagen.

Etwas mehr guter Durchschnitt sind die KÃ¤mpfe und der Survival-Aspekt.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. FÃ¼r meine Wertung zÃ¤hlt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhÃ¤ngig davon, ob ich es einem Ã¤hnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

Eine Ã¤hnliche Sicht auf das Spiel findet man beispielsweise [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198000313700/recommended/433170/]hier[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198047294389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1662271748}
review:
Great game but has some caveats. A game that relies on precise timing for certain jumps and dodges shouldn't have such JANKY controls. The "first" boss fight is pure bull**** and I would dismiss/thumbs down the game entirely based on that except there's lots of another fun exploration to be done up to that point.

Oh, and the distribution of save points is also pure bull****, even though you can "craft" save points, but since you don't know where the actual save points are you don't craft them much until you've been climbing for half an hour and then JANK controls let you fall to your death so you can do it all over again.

It's the closest I've gotten to the pure joy of running around the island in Far Cry 3, which was the peak of those games, so it still gets a thumbs up from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138732204', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1661348965}
review: El juego es como si Far Cry tuviera un hijo con un survival al estilo The Forest. La historia estÃ¡ interesante y para ser un juego Indie es bastante largo. La falta de variedad en los enemigos termina haciendo un poco monotona la aventura pero tiene unas mecanicas divertidas como para terminar el juego antes de aburrirte. Si estas buscando un juego muy enfocado a lo survival, lamento decirte que no es tu juego. El juego tiene un sistema de hambre, que es basicamente la vida, por lo que cada vez que comeremos serÃ¡ cuando nos lastimen y de sed. El problema es que literalmente ni 1 vez fueron un problema los recursos. Siempre hay de donde tomar agua o de donde comer, por lo que simplemente destaca en su aventura e historia. De igual manera, me divertÃ­ el tiempo que durÃ³. Para los completistas, el juego es muy sencillo, con hacer todas las secundarias y sacar los 3 finales tenemos el 100% de los logros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101046856', 'num_games_owned': 1049, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1659726202}
review:
A great mesh of the Forest and Far Cry!

First things first: don't get scared by the prologue. It makes you believe that stealth/combat are the main focus of the game, which would be horrible, because it is very clunky, but no. Whilst you can ramp the difficulty up, even on normal mode the main focus lies in the survival, and exploration of the open world, with a heavy dose of climbing/parcour. And I love it.

As already stated, the gameplay (especially the combat) can be very clunky at times as well as slow in terms of responsiveness. But you can avoid all of that and try a no kill run pretty easily. If you don't want to engage at all, there is only one bossfight that is unavoidable (2 if you want the "good" ending), and that has its very own mechanic, which is fine.

The meat of the game is the exploration. This game is filled to the brim with interesting locations and environmental storytelling. Whilst you have a whole island at your hands here, it feels more like a guided, Tomb Raider like open world, with fast travel points that you unlock and and a general set of paths that you can take and can't deviate from. I always like this, especially with this heavy focus on exploration, because you never really feel lost.I also love the parts where you need to climb mountains and other structures, because there is a great sense of verticality in the game, and the pathdesign is top notch, because you constantly have viewpoints where you can tell how far you have come.

Also, this game is great for achievementhunters, I got all of them, and I usually don't care about this stuff, and you can get all of them on low difficulty as well. In general finishing all sidequests and finding all important items was mostly possible without help, but there is a map in the workshop that locates everything of importance.

I don't really know what to point out as being negative. The game crashed a couple of times but it was probably my rig. Some of the scripted scenes and story events could be better written, but the game knows what it wants to tell and largely delivers on that. If anything, this game just leaves you wanting a sequel, because even though everything is already pretty good for a game at this pricetag, the parcour is obviously not on Far Cry Level, Combat can be improved, some locations could be improved in design, and it just leaves you wondering what could be if the team had more time and money to realize this game, and I want it!

Verdict: Check it out if you want a story driven open world game with light survival elements, and loved the general vibe and presentation of The Forrest. Would even recommend at full price, you get a lot for it!

Edit: Just played Far Cry 6, the climbing is way better in this game here, I am so sorry about my earlier comment, f*** Ubisoft...

author: {'steamid': '76561198035820408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1660206020}
review:
So I'm torn on this one. It was fun. It was on sale when I bought it and I had a good time, so yeah I would recommend it, BUT you need to know what you are getting.

Pros
Great scenery. I loved the fact that the enemies are not stereotypical. The world is fun to explore (with flaws). Climbing can be kinda fun at times.

Cons
Buggy still. Water glitches are really bad. Climbing can feel like a chore. Voice acting is meh. The world is very empty feeling at times and you have to run miles to get to hidden fast travel points. No base building. No way points or indications for big stuff in the game. Just OK story and ending. Combat is meh.

This is a good indie game. It's just not that great and there is almost no reason you would want to come back to it. If you want a solid survival/indie experience, then pick it up on sale. Otherwise, you can live without this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989425257', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1669598213}
review:
This game is absolutely fantastic !!!

+ Beautiful hand-crafted Open World with many exciting places to discover
+ Immersive First Person View (you can see your full body, important for climbing, etc.)
+ Crafting not too complex, but very useful to stay alive and keep the story going
+ Two Different Game-Modes: "Story" and "Survival"
+ Absolutely amazing graphics engine
+ Melee Combat is fun
+ Very good hit impact feeling when using Crossbow

review:
This is a really fine game, I've had a LOT of fun with it.

Not that often can we see now a kind of a game that has everything in it that was promised, but this one does that - I came here to get some stealth, parkour and cool story, and I got all of that and a little more.

I tried to play it a few years ago, got a pirate edition of the early acces, but wasn't quite lucky to understand it and thought that it's very bad, glad that I gave it another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317599499', 'num_games_owned': 1544, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1657646499}
review:
Here are some ProÂ´s and ConÂ´s (Spoilers are Endgame related things):

PROÂ´S:
+ Pretty and Big Map, with a few secrets to discover
+ Good Jump and Run Parcours
+ Nice and simple Crafting and Inventory Mechanics 
+ Interesting Story Line
+ [spoiler] Multiple Endings [/spoiler] 

CON`S:
- easy to get lost on this big Map, and especially in the forest/mountain (might just be me :) )
- Jump and Run Parcours can sometimes be very frustrating
- Fight mechanics are okay, but not that good 
- [spoiler] Endboss has way too much Health in my Opinion [/spoiler] 

Overall a nice Survival Game.
Approximately I spend ~ 15 Hours in this game (getting all the Achievements).

P.S:
If you care about Achievements you have to play this game in English. It is a known Issue that some Achievements (mainly those who are unlocked after completing a Task) are bugged. I played in German and had problems, but after switching to English I unlocked them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424203808', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1657573532}
review:
ITA/ENG - Ãˆ una vira di mezzo tra The Forest e Tomb Raider, la protagonista non Ã¨ la solita ragazza impaurita dei film o giochi horror, Ã¨ coraggiosa, avventurosa, sa combattere, arrampicarsi ed Ã¨ agile nella fuga. Tuttavia il gioco riesce a metterti in difficoltÃ  anche con queste caratteristiche e capacitÃ , perchÃ© il combattimento non Ã¨ mai la scelta migliore. La storia Ã¨ degna da film o giochi per adolescenti del genere Men of Medan: un gruppo di ragazzi che si caccia nei guai e come nella migliore delle tradizioni, non tutti ne usciranno vivi. Non Ã¨ un gioco facile ma non Ã¨ nemmeno troppo dispersivo e non capita spesso di trovarsi bloccati o senza sapere cosa fare. Consigliato se ti piace l'avventura, il genere thriller e survival.
---------------------------------------------
It is a cross between The Forest and Tomb Raider, the protagonist is not the usual girl afraid of horror films or games, she is courageous, adventurous, knows how to fight, climb and is agile in escaping. However, the game manages to get you in trouble even with these characteristics and abilities, because combat is never the best choice. The story is worthy of movies or games for teenagers of the Men of Medan genre: a group of kids who get into trouble and as in the best of traditions, not all of them will make it out alive. It is not an easy game but it is not too distracting and it is not often that you find yourself stuck or without knowing what to do. Recommended if you like adventure, thriller and survival genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989334886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1657409382}
review: For an Indie developed game it's an actual complete game, more complete than most AAA studios are able to accomplish with 2 years worth of time and effort. Now don't get me wrong this game has its ups and downs along the way and by no means is it "Perfect" but I was able to overlook a few minor hiccups (none of which were game breaking) while playing. Now the story was interesting and it developed just as I expected it to and it gives you a sense of dread and fear while exploring and navigating the island. That fear and dread were soon replaced with a sense of power once you find an actual ranged weapon and you're able to "Pick" the enemies off with relative ease. All in all I recommend this game if you're looking for something outside your normal gaming lineup.

review:
Die Young ist einer meiner absoluten Favoriten. Es wird oft als Survival beschrieben, dabei wird hier nur rudimentÃ¤r im Rucksack gecraftet. Es ist eher ein Stealth-RPG mit viel Parcours und RÃ¤tseln wie es weitergeht. Die Landschaft ist absolut gelungen und abwechslungsreich.

Keine Ahnung wie IndieGala das hingekriegt hat, Die Young ist fantastisch, alle anderen Spiele von denen sind Trash. Zum zweitenmal habe ich es nun durchgespielt und dabei wird es wohl nicht bleiben.

Wer mehr vom Spiel sehen will oder Hilfestellung beim Vorankommen braucht dem sei die YouTube Playlist von 'Wild Jester' empfohlen.

Ja, lieber Leser und so wurde die Vorgeschichte einer vÃ¶llig leblosen, leer gefegten Insel geschrieben. 
Was Du natÃ¼rlich nicht hinbekommst, Dir fehlt JeanneÂ´s bestechender Charme und ihre Klopp-Fertigkeit.

Du darfst auf der einsamen Gruselinsel voller Irrer MÃ¶rder und wilder, wilder Wildtierchen gerne um Dein Leben rennen. 
Und zwar mit tollen und echt sauschweren HÃ¼pfeinlagen, ist das nicht toll?

Ich weiÃŸ, das hat mir das Spiel wirklich fast vergellt, dieses sinnlose Parkour Gehopse auf den Millimeter genau ist echt kaum auszuhalten. Nervt in jedem anderen Game auch und hier ists sogar ein Kernelement.

Aber beiÃŸ Dich durch, die Story ist zu spannend, das Setting zu erfrischend, hell (nicht Green Hell) und freundlich sommerlich und das restliche Gameplay zu befriedigend, um es nicht zu tun.

Bisschen Crafting, ein immervolles Inventar und leichte Kampf-Mechaniken gibts nÃ¤mlich auch noch. Die Erkundung der wirklich wunderschÃ¶nen Insel (Und ja, ich werd auch noch drei weitere Male erwÃ¤hnen, wie umwerfend hÃ¼bsch die Szenerie ist.) macht SpaÃŸ und Hunger und Durst im Zaum zu halten ist angenehm Survival fordernd und fÃ¶rdernd.

Und ist ja auch mal ein schicker neuer Ansatz, das blanke Ãœberleben in einem Survival Spiel in den Vordergrund zu stellen. Blanke Ironie, dass es sonst eigentlich fast immer nur um Crafting geht, haha.

Aber hier hat Kampf selten einen Sinn, verbarrikadieren kannst Du Dich schonmal gar nicht und viel Zeit bleibt Dir auch nicht. 
Also lauf, spring, renn und stolpere in die Freiheit oder eben in den Tod. Hauptsache Du bleibst in Bewegung. Dadurch ergibt sich ein Ã¤uÃŸerst gehetztes GrundgefÃ¼hl, die Panik sitzt Dir im Nacken, wenn fiese MÃ¶rderbanden Dich ins Visier genommen haben und nebenbei erzeugt das ganze auch nette Teenie-Slasher-Vibes. 

Also zieh Deine besten Laufschuhe an, gewÃ¶hn Dich gefÃ¤lligst an nervige pixelgenaue HÃ¼pfeinlagen und flieh um Dein Leben und dabei wÃ¼nsch ich Dir wie immer...

... viel SpaÃŸ  ;-)




Klopper Jeanne Teil 6




Und hey, wennÂ´s Dir gefallen hat, ne Runde von mir zu lesen, dann klick hier
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41622336/
und da gibts mehr von mir auf meiner Curator Seite. SchmÃ¶kern for free: Also stell Dir nen Tee bereit und viel SpaÃŸ beim lesen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198082419386', 'num_games_owned': 3652, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1654534981}
review:
Die Young is a survival FPS, where you play as a girl called Daphne, and you go to a not well known island around Turkey, with your friends, however the trip takes a dark turn and you get kidnapped and have to survive against nature and crazy islanders and leave this place at any cost.

The game looks pretty good in my opinion, especially the light and dark effects, however it's a bit un-optimzed (or maybe a 1050Ti is not enough for this game). Some of the music in the game is pretty good, adds to the action, however the game chooses the tracks randomly, sometimes even cut the tracks, which results a weird explains, but not too bad. The controls were all right, it was a bit hard to get used too, but nothing to serious. The play area is quite big, there are lot of routes to go on and secrets to find, Die Young can deliver that. You also got multiple endings for the game, too. The survival mechanisms are simple: you have to watch out for your health and to not get dehydrated, so you will have to hunt animals, loot house, make your own medicines and weapons, also use the inhabitants tools against them. This all adds a lot of fun factor to the game altogether. The mood of the game is pretty cool, at the beginning it is indeed scary to go against the human enemies and the nature, also the whole environment looks great too. Not even mentioning the parkour system, which the game has, similar to Mirror's Edge. The story was all right, it kept me interested in throughout the game.

However, the game is far from perfect. First of all, the graphics and textures can bug... a lot. Your hands clip through the wall, the enemy's ragdoll clip through basically anything, some rock textures are weird. The bigger issue with the game, it's that size... the island is big, and it's like a maze. Basically I had to play around +15 hours, because at one of the area, I had no clue where to go basically, and it was so huge, that I explored a lot of part of the map, but the most important ones, and I basically had to look up where to go. Also, playing this game a lot will make you unbothered to any enemies in the game. At the beginning, I was really cautious against anything and I managed my inventory accordingly, however around half way of my playthrough, I realized the AI's flaw and you can bug it out if you want to, and I knew what equipment I need, so I crafted only that. About the characters... it's one thing that they are unlikable, except a few minor characters, but the voice actors are pretty bad in my opinion, especially the main character's voice actor.

Die Young is a mixture of Mirror's Edge and Dying Light, which sounds good on paper, but it's a bit unstable and has some issues, but has an unique mood. In my opinion it was an all right game and I can recommend it to play it, however if you are a hardcore survival game fan, then play this game if you have nothing else to do, because you most likely not gonna enjoy it that much. 16.8â‚¬ is quite expensive for it, get it for around 7-8â‚¬.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056818248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 2222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2222, 'last_played': 1654441728}
review:
Zu diesem Spiel entwickelte ich eine Hass-Liebe. Ich konnte einfach nicht die Finger davon lassen, da ich unbedingt wissen wollte, wie es aufhÃ¶rt. Aber jedesmal wenn ich das Spiel spielte, nervten mich etliche Dinge. Woraufhin ich dann irgendwann gefrustet wiedermal auf Alt-F4 drÃ¼ckte....

Der Spieler steuert Daphne, eine Person von mehreren, die beschlossen einen schÃ¶nen Urlaub auf einer Insel zu machen. BlÃ¶d nur, dass man dann auf der Insel Ã¼berfallen wird und in einem Brunnen eingesperrt wieder aufwacht.
Das Spiel nimmt einen so gut wie gar nicht an die Hand. Es gibt zwar Questbeschreibungen und diese sind zum Teil auch mit ungefÃ¤hren Ortsangaben versehen, aber dorthin zu gelangen ist jedesmal eine Herausforderung. Es gibt nÃ¤mlich nie einen geraden Weg und man muss sich seinen Weg suchen. Es ist zum Teil ziemlich labyrinthartig... Die Karte zeigt immer nur die aktuelle Umgebung an, nicht die gesamte Insel auf einmal, was die Navigation zusÃ¤tzlich noch erschwert. Dazu das begrenze Inventar, was man nur allmÃ¤hlich etwas aufstocken kann (dass man mehr Platz hat). Alles etwas schleppend... Man kann einige Dinge craften, aber - zumindest zu beginn - fehlt einem meistens noch die eine oder andere Zutat, um den Craftvorgang durchfÃ¼hren zu kÃ¶nnen. SpÃ¤ter ist das nicht mehr so dramatisch, da man bis dahin viel Rohstoffe gefunden hat. Da gibt's dann hÃ¶chstens das Problem, dass man wieder nicht die richtigen Zutaten im Inventar hat, weil, das habe ich jedenfalls so gemacht, man die Zutaten in sein Lager gepackt hat, da das Inventar dennoch begrenzt ist, wÃ¤hrend das Lager unendlichen Fassungsraum bietet.
Die Lager sind auf der ganzen Insel verteilt, in grossen AbstÃ¤nden und dienen ausserdem als Schnellreisestationen und ÃœbernachtungsmÃ¶glichkeit.

Eines darf einen nicht entmutigen: Die Dinge, die man suchen muss, um weiterzukommen. Beispielsweise ein SchlÃ¼ssel fÃ¼r eine TÃ¼r. Ich stehe also am einen Ende der Insel, benÃ¶tige einen SchlÃ¼ssel fÃ¼r eine TÃ¼r und dieser befindet sich dann ganz am anderen Ende der Insel. Immens weit weg, wie man es von den sonst Ã¼blichen Spielen absolut nicht gewÃ¶hnt ist.

Was mich zum Frusten brachte, sind logische Fehler im Spiel. Z.B. ist eine GittertÃ¼r ohne VorhÃ¤ngeschloss oder sonstiger VerriegelungsmÃ¶glichkeit im Spiel abgeschlossen - dabei ist die TÃ¼r grafisch nicht abgeschlossen! Sowas nervt einfach.
Oder man steht vor einer verschlossenen TÃ¼r und will sie Ã¶ffnen: "Von der anderen Seite verschlossen", heisst es dann. Und das selbe heisst es dann wieder, wenn man auf der anderen Seite steht.... Ahja.....
Oder TÃ¼ren, bei denen es heisst, sie seien verschlossen oder blockiert (steckt fest). Von der anderen Seite kann man die TÃ¼r dann Ã¶ffnen - ohne SchlÃ¼ssel oder ohne Barrikaden wegrÃ¤umen zu mÃ¼ssen.

Das war nur ein Beispiel, so gibt's noch etliche logische Fehler mehr....

Dann die deutsche Version! Wer hat das bloss Ã¼bersetzt? Da sind so richtige Schnitzer drin in der deutschen Fassung. Z. B. tÃ¶tet man ein Tier, da man dessen Fell zum Craften benÃ¶tigt. Nimmt man das Fell auf, zeigt das Spiel an: "Verstecken aufgenommnen". Is klar, "verstecken"...Weil Pelz = Hide. Was sonst.... Oh mann...
Auch dies ist nur ein Beispiel von vielen, die mich anfangs extrem verwirrten.

Naja, schliesslich habe ich es dann doch noch durchgespielt, trotz der Grafikfehler, logischen Denkfehlern, Bugs und vielen Frustmomenten. Im Nachhinein war ich ganz froh, dass ich es nun endlich durchgezockt hatte. Endlich konnte ich es wieder von meiner Festplatte entfernen. Hallelujah xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198084021881', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1654221314}
review:
Surprisingly good if you went in with low expectations.
All the different places you could explore on this mystery horror island and the story that comes with it was really fun to progress through. It felt very similar to the forest but plays very differently.
The enemies in this game do not respawn which kinda sucks but at the same time, is not bad in this game. This along with the equipment progression really feeds into a power fantasy, for example, [spoiler]when you clear out the military base[/spoiler] as Daphne, a girl not at all in her element. Killing a bunch of bad guys as an untrained and lost girl kinda funny. 
The boss fights are doodoo balls though, as two of them share the same unvaried moveset. That doesn't take away from the game too much however because the bosses are a minimal part of the game experience.

Overall really fun for $20, better if on sale. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198110451233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1652978659}
review: Example of how game design can go horrible. Its a product of a confused mind who thought tossing a little bit from other games into a pot and stirring it will be a good idea. The end result a character running in a big empty space occasionally catching a fight here and there and rest is jumping puzzles which are lengthy and boring. Many invisible collision boxes here and there that keeps pushing you down so you have to repeat a boring jump puzzle. Its quite linear game and there is nothing interesting to the story. Gameplay is so numb it feels like a walking simulator. Conclusion, waste of time and resources by an unsuccessful game designer. With all this effort they could have come up with a proper game. Waste of 20gb space on your hard drvie.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970971313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1652216880}
review:
Plays like a weird mix of Tomb Raider and a walking simulator, but with appalling controls.
You'll repeatedly miss the handhold you're jumping for, fall a few metres, and have to clamber around to get back to where you were to try again.

The landscape seems to be mostly populated by small animals and occasional characters just running in place.

Some areas feature locked doors which you'll need to find a way around, but instead of being able to unlock them from the far side, you eventually find keys when you've just about cleared the whole area, at which point they're useless.
This, combined with only being allowed save in certain locations, and repeated damage from random falls, really smacks of a game of limited length trying to drag it out by wasting the player's time.

Feels like it could have been a lot better than it is, but there's nothing particularly interesting that makes it worth the drag.

review:
this game is unbearable to play. the map in the game is a fucking static image that only changes when you move past the square. you have no sense of where to go. your legit thrown into a island with a jpeg and told find some coastal tower in the middle of the alps and btw theres homicidal maniacs after you and dogs who fucking team up on you. crafting in this game is dog shite aswell because you get no fucking instruction on how to get the resources. and the places where you can get the resources are surrounded by enemies who can 2 shot you.

only  get this game if you hate your life and want to run around a empty wasteland with 2 buildings everyone once in  a while that are surrounded by 20 enemies

author: {'steamid': '76561197999000679', 'num_games_owned': 5439, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1651396110}
review:
tl;dr This game was frustratingly almost great. It repeatedly jumped between 6/10 and 9/10 for me. I got all the achievements which I usually don't do (only needed miss the deadline and kill the liar after finishing the game without trying to get any)

Far Cry/Dead Island with (although an actually linear because of quest requirements) open world
I actually preferred the prologue over the rest of the game because I liked it better when it was a more action focused game then hiding and avoiding and backtracking and getting lost

and here I exclusively rant:
I played on the adventure mode and with the option to tone down the survival elements that is in the menu.
To try to avoid having the game annoy me with dieing over and over. Which I'm glad I did because there was already enough running around backtracking to annoy me. There are many fast travel points in the game, that you have to find and are sometimes right in front of your face and other time hidden behind something or in a place you wouldn't have expected. I missed several paths and got to a big section I couldn't advance from for some time, that I didn't know I couldn't, because I had taken the right side path instead of the left (Damn you High Tower) I missed the pack that lets you hold more things because I didn't see it on a table. There's a prisoner you can unlock the door of near the beginning that you have to go back to after getting a particular key, but as far as I could tell the closest fast travel point was pretty far away and hard to get back to to go back to the part of the game you were now at. *sigh*

author: {'steamid': '76561197977088954', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1663114611}
review:
Es un Must Have.
Me ha sorprendido mucho este juego. No me esperaba que me gustase tanto.

-Graficos: muy trabajados, han tenido en cuenta muchos detalles y la ambientaciÃ³n para ser un mundo abierto es de 10 porque no da la sensaciÃ³n de vacio como en muchos otros juegos con espacios grandes.
Puedes pararte a disfrutar del paisaje porque vale la pena.

-Jugabilidad: La mezcla de parkour y FPS me ha recordado mucho al Diying Light. Los controles son faciles y no te aburres.

-Enemigos: Bueno en algo tenia que fallar el juego, los enemigos en si estan bien, pero su IA... le puedes meter un flechazo en la cabeza, te mueves agachado 3 metros y ya no te detecta y se olvida de ti. Son muy simples y no suponen ningun reto cuando llevas muchos virotes para tu ballesta.

-Historia: Esta bien, es el tipico grupito de americanos que se meten donde no deben y la chica heroina tiene que escapar de la isla dominada por una secta. Sencilla, pero funciona.

Lo recomiendo totalmente. Es un buen juego que te entretendrÃ¡ algunas horas.

PD: Si miras hacia abajo puedes ver tus pechitos.

review:
The game is good, if not a bit clunky at times. 

While the graphics are not cutting edge the art direction is good enough that the game can be very beautiful at times.
Very enjoyable exploration and platforming, with horror elements that make for some intense moments from time to time. 
The "survival" part is very minimal, which is a good thing.  

The last boss is terrible and almost completely ruins the ending but I had enough fun in the rest of the game that it didn't really matter to me. 

In fact I liked it so much that I bought an extra key(on a huge discount) for a friend! 
But he didn't want it so it'll just put it here for a lucky someone:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006590187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1649277105}
review:
Die Young, el juego que predice tu embolia.

Sos una pende-ja que se escapa de parranda con los amigos a una isla donde son capturados por unos granjeros trastornados que los quieren despellejar vivos. Luego de escapar de un pozo donde la tiraron como si fuera una bolsa de bosta, tenes que empezar a movilizarte por el mapa en busca de tus amigos, pistas de que joraca esta pasando en dicha isla y objetos para sobrevivir como herramientas, armas y alimentos. 

El juego se basa mayormente en la exploracion y la supervivencia, el crafteo esta presente mas que nada para crear municiones y mejorar la capacidad de almacenamiento de nuestro inventario. Tenes que recorrer la isla buscando la manera de escapar y para ello vamos a utilizar una especie de sistema de parkout donde si le erraste, la mayoria de las veces te vas a hacer concha contra el piso y vas a tener que rehacer la ultima media hora de nuevo.

Visualmente es muy agradable y la jugabilidad es bastante buena a decir verdad, pero se vuelve algo monotono luego de un par de horas ya que basicamente es trepar paredes y evitar enemigos. Al menos hasta que conseguis la ballesta y ahi podes romperle el or-to a todo el mundo.

Normalmente recomendaria un juego como este, pero lamentablemente llegue a un punto donde me fue imposible avanzar. A cada pu-ta accion que hacia se me crasheaba el juego. Lograba alcanzar objetivos tras realizar un salto muy preciso y me tira el hijo de remil pu-ta mensaje avisandome que habia ocurrido un error y que podia enviar mi reporte. De que reporte me hablas la reconcha de tu madre!!!?... el juego salio cuando nacio Jesus... como me van a venir a decir que todavia tiene esos bugs asquerosos que te arruinan la experiencia completamente.

Me dio tanta bronca que lo desinstale, una lastima porque me hubiera gustado saber como terminaba las aventuras de la gua-cha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127631916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1649152332}
review: I like games that are rough around the edges and this game is very much that. Main complaint is the controls are stiff, when you swing your weapon you can't really back out of it and gotta commit to the swing. You might wonder why this is a bad thing. Against most enemies this isn't too big of an issue because you both dodge and go in for swings. This is a problem when facing bosses though, since they don't stagger when you hit them. it's kinda like hitting a bag of potatoes. The bosses just stiffly swing at you and can sometimes trap you in a hitstun loop if the AI is feelings aggressive. For the most part the AI is either so dumb that hiding behind a rock will cause them to be confused and lose sight of you or they're super clairvoyant and will snipe you across the map. All in all, it was an alright game but that final boss made me not wanna give it another go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967346265', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1648087753}
review: This was somewhat promising at first, but I couldn't bring myself to even reach the half-way point. The game provides an interesting enough premise, a pretty cool environment, and I personally found the parkour fun. I could deal with the weird switching of music tracks, the floating objects, and odd wildlife animations. However, as I kept playing, I just felt those things just kept pulling me out of the immersion. Then I discovered how painfully stupid the AI was and I felt absolutely zero fear towards them once I could craft knives, and especially once I got the crossbow that I could one shot them with. The worst part though was being able to cheese them. I could easily take out 2 enemies at once with a baton or knife and all enemies by just throwing rocks if it was one on one - hell, I could've even taken out the executioner with stones if I was bored enough once I discovered I could kite him and get him stuck in a doorway. If you want a "helpless protagonist" game I'd suggest Alien Isolation or Outlast - while those aren't perfect they're definitely much, much better executed than this. I don't think I paid much for this, but even if it was free I can't recommend it unless you've run out of other open world games with a semi-weak protagonist and some crafting elements and don't mind poor AI. Sorry, IndieGala - I've bought a few games from you, but if you're going to develop a game yourself then you really, really need to work on your polish. This could've been a good game but you completely lost me at the [spoiler]Cujo boss fight[/spoiler]. It was laughably bad.

review:
The game is broken for me. When i launch it freezes. alt tabbing in and out can let me navigate screens (barely). In the settings it shows no resolution is selected and none are available.
Never had an issue with any other game regarding this so I'm assuming it's an issue with the game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123208780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1647331996}
review:
If Farcry, dying light and the forest and mirror's edge had a love child, that would be die young.


I was playing on easy difficulty, to be honest after getting a crosbow and molotovs, the fights were mostly easy. 
Still the game can be a bit challenging with the puzzles and the parkour elements, and with fights aswell sometimes.

Overall I would say it's not that hard game, you can have a lot of fun, its a decently long open world survival/crafting/horror/parkour game, with elements.
Reminds me a lot to farcry3.
Haven't really seen any bugs or glitches. (maybe the AI is a bit dumb...)
I deffinietely recommend the game especially on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045754600', 'num_games_owned': 1319, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1646776531}
review:
Way too much back and forth across a large map without any direction at all. Early in the game there is a quest that tells you to find a Bull Key and it "might be around here somewhere". This is a blatant lie designed to trick the player into wasting time. The key is actually miles away near where you start the game, so you have to backtrack essentially reverting any progress you have made so far. Not only that, but to get the key, you need to get a poison recipe (which the mission doesn't explain how or where) and a different key that is miles in the opposite direction. This is artificial padding at its worst and I have no intention of running around for hours aimlessly hoping to find random quests that are miles apart that are meant to lead to more quests that finally lead to the solution of one step in the main quest. Bare in mind that none of this is explained and is almost directly contradicted by mission explanations, implying tot he player that looking around in the area will resolve their issue. Really the only way to play this game is to explore everything immediately and ignore the main quest because it is literally impossible without randomly finding everything else.

Awful mission design, Horrible pacing, and mediocre everything else. Not worth your time at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059361840', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 1031, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1645712703}
review:
Die Young disappointed me a lot. The game itself could be really good, but it just doesn't feel that way. I would describe Die Young as the ugly child of Dying Light and Far Cry. Stranded on an island, you fight for survival and must progress as sneaky and stealthy as possible. It's a mix of parkour and survival. Unfortunately, the game feels like a walking simulator most of the time, as you just walk from A to B a lot (go to A and find out that you need keys, go to B to get the keys, go back to A, open the lock, gather new items, go to C, etc.) - at least in the first half of the game. The second half is more about climbing a lot. Nevertheless, there is not much happening, and you have seen 70% of all the interesting locations in the first hour (you will unblock new areas as you keep playing â€“ but a big part of the late game consists of walking through the woods, climbing a mountain and reaching the top of the high tower). Angry animals are slow and can be outrun and the enemies canâ€™t really catch up either, if you jump on rocks in order to escape.

The worst thing about the game is that sometimes you go down a huge route, which was sometimes even difficult to reach, only to realise that you are at a dead end because you need another key or another special item to move on. So, you turn back the whole way again to get the item and come back. And this happens way too often. Especially because there is no clear indication of where to go, but most of the paths are blocked until you have the right objects. Super annoying and a big waste of time.

Unfortunately, even the gameplay doesn't feel as good as I wish it did. In fact, the controls are slightly junky when running around and climbing. Also, the fighting doesn't really feel that great for being a main element of the game. The parkour elements themselves are nicely done, even if there are minor technical errors from time to time.

The story is okay, but not exceptional (and it only begins to be interesting towards the end of the game). The graphics, on the other hand, are really well done.

Unfortunately, I can only recommend the game when it's strongly on sale.

review: excellente surprise! que d'Ã©nigmes et de chemins possibles, les phases d'escalades tres prenantes, les labyrinthes supers, le craft... et j'en passe. petit bÃ©mol pour la vie dans le jeu qui est un peu trop vide et le boss pas tres intelligent. mais dans l'ensemble, une belle surprise. 16/20 pas moins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198974471430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1643835952}
review:
I really enjoyed Die Young, which is all I want from a game. Just keep in mind that it is an indie game and it has that indie "jank" (bad AI, at best mediocre voice acting etc.). But... the puzzles and parkour is interesting, the island is beautiful and fun to explore. This is basically an open world adventure game with some light survival elements and personally I like it that way.

Oh and yeah... just like everyone else said, the end boss fight is..bad. You are basically forced into a fight. But that is literally 0.1% of the game.

Fun factor: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982696065', 'num_games_owned': 929, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1644123866}
review:
Pretty good "survival horror/parkour" game.

With slow, very-completionist play, I 100%-ed it in 41 hours: a decent amount of entertainment for the money, I feel. All achievements can be gained, mostly just by reaching places through the course of the story, and completing necessary quests. The remainder are completed through normal completionist play (killing optional people, etc). Zero silly or grindy achievements, so even better than the prologue. If you complete the main quest, all sidequests, and kill all bosses, you should 100% the game.

I believe one of the goals in making the game was to make it dissimilar to many survival games (The Forest, Subnautica, etc) in that it is not a base-builder, but instead pushes you to progress through the goals of the story. I'd say it by-and-large achieved that goal. One of their tactics was to have it so that the closest you have to a "base" is the system of fast-travel nodes, which also have an infinite storage "bank" at them, shared between all fast-travel points. So there's no reason to return to areas you've cleared out, and instead you want to move forward to find more loot.

For a slow completionist explorer gameplay, the game is very easy, at least in "adventure" mode (medium difficulty, if you change it in the settings later). You have more food, weapons, meds and tools than you will ever need. The only thing you will realistically find yourself wanting more of is materials for expanding your craft bag, most notably the "binding" material; and wanting to find more snakes! For the most part, though, it's one of those games where, if you want to save, you'll find materials to build a camp fire, or a pre-built one; if you need to crowbar something open, one will usually be conveniently to hand, etc. Not *always*, though, so it's worth carrying all your tools (or at least, materials to build them with) at all times.

Survival mode (the harder setting) is apparently tougher, and you have pretty fine-grained control over the difficulty, being able to tweak 

Pleasantly PC-oriented controls, so things like the scroll-wheel work in containers, etc.

The parcour/climbing part of the game feels a little simplistic, as you can only climb on deliberately placed handholds, not on arbitrary rock surfaces. Still, the mechanics are fun and challenging. The timing for the parkour jumping feels "off" somehow, in that the latest time you can jump is when your body is already over the edge of the thing you're jumping off: the moment your leg would be fully extended behind you, rather than the moment you would send the "jump" message to your leg. Despite this minor niggle, it's still mostly pretty easy and fun, and this different timing means most jumps are far more lenient with my slow reflexes than I have any right to expect. Basically, it's tuned to make the player feel like they are being awesome, and I like that: that's what good game design does.

Props to the game designers throughout, really. The game design of the climbing puzzles, and all challenges in general, is good. A *lot* of thought has clearly gone into the layout of the areas, giving good vistas and letting you plan your approach through areas ahead of time by letting you look over them, while concealing from you things that they wanted to reveal later.

Finding stuff can be a pain sometimes, I had to look a few things up, but the full detailed map in the Steam community's "guides" section will help with that.

Negligible replay value: I don't see myself ever returning to the game, but it was a worthwhile experience.
