author: {'steamid': '76561197995771159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1496, 'last_played': 1622710970}
review:
This is a lovely game. Truly. I beat it yesterday, and now I'm on my computer late at night prepared to uninstall it and choose my next game to play. And I got to thinking about it and asking myself what I would put in a review.. So here we go!
This game very much plays like a cross between Tomb Raider and The Forest. You don't have a base of operations, but rather you move from area to area completing quests and points of interest. -- The storyline is pretty damn well developed for an indie game.. and you know what, I think I can say that for every component of this game is "pretty damn well developed for an indie game". There are definitely moments that feel rough around the edges, and if these are things that bother you then maybe this game isn't you for. [i]However, if you generally like playing games partially for the love of the game itself as a labor of love for a team, then this game is perfect for you.[/i] 

Notes for the devs if you'd like to take them:
1) There were some frustrations around inventory management. It was frustrating that items could only be equipped from the quick select, as opposed to from the menu, and that consumables had to be 'long held' to be used. This made it so that the relatively robust number of consumables you provided me were basically unusable. 
2) It was frustrating when I explored an area, and found a future Point of Interest that I didn't get have the key for. 
[spoiler] The door to Andre in the Abandoned Mines for example, or the fire pyres where I'm allowed to kill my friend. [/spoiler]
Both these occasions, I found the area before my quest triggered there to be anything happening there, and so it was really confusing for me if I was supposed to find something elsewhere first, or what I should have done. If there was many some dialogue to hint that I need to get something else first... (like with the 
[spoiler] gas mask obviously being needed for the greenhouse, or the light needed for the fuel place) [/spoiler]  
3) The
[spoiler] brother 3 fight  [/spoiler]  was way too abrupt and difficult to not be given some warning. Compared to the follow of the game up to this point it was the only part that I ultimately decided to "cheese" rather than do tactically, especially given that I entered the area with 1 arrow and a knife.. A quick note during the "sleep till 8" telling me to be prepared for a fight would have been nice. There may have been a dialogue warning me, but in-game activity ended that conversation early.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986556464', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1462, 'last_played': 1703902129}
review: Gorgeous looking, tad short but insanely fun to play survival/exploration game. I loved the parkour filled open world exploration, finding useful items, discovering secrets and hints of lore while pursuing main and sub quests, that's where the devs totally nailed it. There is crafting but it's not overwhelming ergo no creating armor out of grass->wood->stone etc. there are only makeshift weapons, arrows, healing items and upgrade to inventory space. After story completion and getting all secrets/achievements (I had multiple saves to rollback to for story choices) the game left me a bit unsatisfied, hungry for more. However I soon began to cherish that fact. In a stream of giant, open world games filled with repetitive, boring actions and stories stretched to breaking point in favor of prolonging game time, smaller, tightly content filled yet still amazing game is a nice change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214340319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 7957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7957, 'last_played': 1621020996}
review: WOW. What a fantastic game!! Worth every cent paid. Loved the freedom, and the open world concept. Story was great too. Challenges were fun, kept you on your toes.. It's just so good. Definitely scratches the itch for those of us that love single player open-world survival games. I also loved that the sidequests had a genuine benefit to completing them. This is Far Cry but better. Hope to see more like it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968990136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1620635479}
review:
Pretty fun game, way better than the prologue, which I hate to say sucked. The parkour/rock climbing is fun, but sadly the (mostly optional) boss fights are way too hard. The graphics are quite nice, however the built in anti aliasing is horrible and I'd  recommend injecting AA with Reshade.

All up, was fun, would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997063641', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1620145817}
review: Map is unnecessarily too big, empty and boring, devs had to implement a fast travel system in a survival game. Combats are decent, climbing is approximate and frustrating, main character is bipolar : scared as shit but suddendly jokes about a big blood pool "someone must have sneezed during their period" ok... I can't recommend this game unless you are a walking simulators veteran and you really don't know what to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165740404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1620143355}
review:
If you were to throw 'Mirror's Edge' and 'The Forest' into a blender, you'd get 'Die Young'. That is the most apt description I can give. Though it is a little misleading, since it is far closer to 'Mirror's Edge' than the forrest.

As a "survival" parkour first person adventure, this game is pretty great. Parkour feels excellent (except for the occasional jump) and manages to capture the same sense of speed and control the original Mirror's Edge had. For that alone, I would recommend this game. "Survival mosty consists of drinking enough water to keep your stamina from being capped down. Food only restores Health. The combat is a bit simplistic, does get a lot better though, once you aquire a crossbow. 
Stealth is emphasised early on, can serve you well until the end of the game though. I also really loved the game world, both in design and graphically.   

The Story is pretty decent, it's good, that is possible to agree with a few of the villain's ideas (like the world being built on exploitation), whle wholeheartedly disagreeing with his execution. There is also one interesting moral choice towards the end. The voiceacting was mostly fine, though some of the performances early on leave a bit to be desired.

Overall, a great game, that I highly recommend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259528464', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1619904652}
review: Kind of slow gameplay. The parkour needs a lot of work. When jumping and grabbing rocks or some iron sticking out of a rock your sights will change telling you the character will make the jump. When jumping from ledge to ledge you don't get that indicator in your sights. The ledge looks like you'd make it with no problem but you don't. On a second attempt she'll make it. It's like she won't get enough speed or something and not all ledges give you space for a running start. It's really aggravating. I quit playing because of this. Tired of falling to my death when I did everything right. Enemies... You sneak up on an enemy and attack them ferociously and your character will delay and they'll hit you hard out of nowhere. You'd think they'd be stunned or overwhelmed especially since he was talking to himself about the devil and not going to church. Not much dialogue or ambiance to draw you in. This could be a descent game if some issues were addressed. Right now I can't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999053174', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1619813418}
review:
It's a little more linear than it wants you to believe. Like it's a little too explicit where you can and can't climb, and as an extension of that there are locked gates and such that you really should be able to climb around or through but can't. It's still rather open, though. Also the stealth/detection is jarringly unrealistically forgiving.

Otherwise, it's pretty solid so far. I have had a good time exploring and skulking around. It also crashed the first time I ran it, right after the intro cutscene, but it's been stable since.

It's also got a few small nice touches I appreciate. Like the plants that you can craft with are named things that are just short descriptions of the plant, until you find a document that gives you the actual names.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057990658', 'num_games_owned': 6240, 'num_reviews': 1539, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1618460943}
review: Super fun and interesting survival//rpg. It's got an intriguing plot that's easy to understand and follow, fun exploration elements, good pacing, and plenty of save points/fast travel points (which are incredibly necessary, the game would be hell otherwise). My only two real issues with the game are that the "survival" aspect is barely present, I never really had to worry about health as there are berry bushes everywhere you look and especially never even thought of hydration as it just doesn't go down fast enough to worry about. The second issue (which is pretty bad but not gamebreaking) is that the bosses in the game are just plain stupid to fight. Besides that it's a fairly great game, only a few crashes but they may have just been me tabbing in and out constantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985253346', 'num_games_owned': 1016, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1618441952}
review:
Original review I wrote: 

"Your review is 5,634 characters too long. Please shorten it and try again."

Seriously steam? You have petabytes of space for people posting screenshots of genital shaped vehicles they built in a minecraft-clone game but not the 14 kilobytes for a detailed review? 

*sigh*

I wanted to like the game, really did, but those 5,634 characters? Those were all in the "cons" section of it. I sat here for over an hour trying to be fair and find good things to say about the game, how the art assets were generally well done and the world was rather pretty... but what it comes down to is that it has a pretty bad story, universally unlikeable characters, animations that seem to transition very badly into each other (which is especially bad in combat, makes heavy attacks harmful only to yourself), really only bad endings, tho the least bad one at least has the saving grace of not having the player character die after all that effort as it seems to be so fashionable these days, and one of the dumbest ending bossfights I've seen in recent years. 
The Crafting system at least isn't in the way but... you only ever get like half of the "locked recipes" the game shows you, I mean... why? Just... why? I've searched the game world pretty thoroughly and unless I walked by some super hidden corner that opens up a lot of sidestory or some quests or whatnot... it's just not there.

Sorry, this game just feels like the developers ran out of budget and tried to tie it up into a lackluster ending at least instead of dropping the project.
If anyone actually wants my full review (I highly doubt it) I still have it. Have fun... playing something else I suggest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289350813', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1640689396}
review:
Die Young est un jeu d' infiltration qui est dans l'ensemble est correct mais pourrait Ãªtre mieux avec des patchs qui je pense ne verront jamais le jour.

Je vais commencer par les points positifs (parce oui, il y en a quand mÃªme) :
Tout d'abord le systÃ¨me de parcours, dâ€™Ã©nigmes et de parkour est plutÃ´t bon voir trÃ¨s bon, le fait de pouvoir se reposer uniquement dans les abris rÃ©partis dans la map nous oblige Ã  les chercher pour pouvoir passer la nuit, les graphismes sont bons, un sentiment de quasi-libertÃ©s prÃ©sent une bonne partie du jeu et pour finir le scÃ©nario n'est pas excellent mais est potable et dispose de plusieurs fins (3 ou 4 a ma connaissance).

Maintenant les points nÃ©gatifs :
HonnÃªtement le jeu aurait du rester accÃ¨s anticipÃ©, je n'ai pas jouer lorsqu'il y Ã©tait mais j'ai vraiment eu cette sensation, entre des fantÃ´mes qui vous balancent dans le vide ou vous repoussent lorsque vous montez des montÃ©es ou descendez d'objets ou de descente, les ennemis qui soit vous voit Ã  travers les murs (Ã§a met arriver 3-4 fois en 17 heures de jeu mais bon c'est quand mÃªme chiant de mourir Ã  cause de Ã§a) soit ne vous voit pas alors que vous Ãªtes littÃ©ralement Ã  1 mÃ¨tres dans une fougÃ¨re. Bien que le jeu est basÃ©e sur lâ€™infiltration il est impossible dâ€™exÃ©cuter l'ennemi par derriÃ¨re et il y a certains passage (cela dÃ©pend de la voie narrative que vous prenez) ou vous devrez vous battre avec les outils que vous aurez collectez, le problÃ¨me est que les combats sont trÃ¨s mou, Ã  tel point que je ne diffÃ©rencie pas lorsque je tape avec un bÃ¢ton en bois et un pied de biche, la seule arme potable est la matraque que certains ennemis drop et l'arbalÃ¨te si on tire dans la tÃªte. Pour continuer sur les bugs, les bugs sonores dans ce jeu sont un vrai mystÃ¨re on passe d'une grosse rave qui sors de je ne sais oÃ¹ Ã  un silence complet, les ennemis tuÃ©es resteront sur la map et ne respawn pas mais par contre meurt sous vos yeux dÃ¨s que la zone s'actualise, ceux qui veulent complÃ©ter le jeux vont souffrir car les trophÃ©es ne marche pas tout le temps notamment pour les quÃªtes annexes. Et pour finir les boss - mini boss, sÃ»rement les pires que j'ai vus certes on est pas obligÃ© de les tuer (mini-boss et certains boss) mais sont indispensable pour les trophÃ©es( si quelqu'un est assez maso pour le faire) ou pour une fin, bref les tuer sont un vÃ©ritable enfer le corps Ã  corps est impensable Ã  moins d'avoir un trÃ¨s grand stock de mÃ©dicament et l'arbalÃ¨te... bha faut juste un stock de 40 Ã  60 flÃ¨ches ce qui est vraiment Ã©normes et encore faut-il que leur hitbox ne soit pas buguÃ©e; le seul moyen d'en arriver Ã  bout sans farmer (encore faut-il que ce soit possible) est de lui jeter des cailloux... OUI des cailloux que vous avez Ã  l'infini normalement pour distraire/attirer l'ennemi; vous allez donc passer entre 10-15 minutes Ã  jeter des cailloux accroupis dans des fougÃ¨res ou en exploitant un bug de hitbox sur ce qui devrait Ãªtre un boss, un combat pas trÃ¨s glorieux on est d'accord.

Bref en gros c'est un jeu qui a un potentiel mais vraiment trÃ¨s mal exploitÃ©, je me suis vraiment amusÃ© les premiÃ¨res heures mais aprÃ¨s j'avais le sentiment de perdre de plus en plus cette libertÃ©, il me semble qu'il est possible de faire le jeu sans vous battre donc une partie des dÃ©fauts ne devrez pas apparaÃ®tre. Bien que je ne l'ai pas essayÃ©, je me suis renseignÃ© et regardÃ© du gameplay, le jeu sur PS4 me semble vraiment plus stable ce que je trouve bizarre que des bugs qui ne sont pas prÃ©sent sur console le soit sur pc mais le jeu reste la mÃªme merde pour les combats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202995105', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1617588695}
review:
Hola buenas!

Hoy os traigo la reseÃ±a de un tÃ­tulo que me he pasado un poco en modo "express", pero que como podÃ©is comprobar en mi perfil, he desbloqueado todos los logros y creo que he experimentado totalmente lo que me ofrece el juego. Se trata de un tÃ­tulo que se podrÃ­a categorizar como "indie" por su  "bajo presupuesto". Pero que esto no se tome como una connotaciÃ³n negativa, el tÃ­tulo ciertamente tiene algunas carencias o en algÃºn momento se le pueden ver las costuras a nivel tÃ©cnico. Pero esto (al menos en mi partida) no me ha estropeado la experiencia en absoluto.
Sin mÃ¡s preÃ¡mbulos, comenzarÃ© hablando de "Die Young"

Die Young es un juego de mundo abierto, es una experiencia dinÃ¡mica de exploraciÃ³n y supervivencia presentada en perspectiva de primera persona, donde el parkour serÃ¡ nuestra herramienta primaria para explorar. A medida que vamos avanzando en nuestra aventura, podremos elaborar utensilios que nos resultarÃ¡n adecuados para determinadas situaciones (palancas para romper candados, llaves inglesas para arreglar artilugios, cuchillos para desollar animales y obtener sus pieles...)

En el contexto argumental, nos encontramos en la piel de Daphne, una chica de veintipocos aÃ±os que vive una vida de lujos y vicios, con una buena posiciÃ³n social y econÃ³mica y por supuesto, con motivo de sus padres ricos. En un viaje con tus amigos por Europa del este, un dÃ­a decidÃ­s ir de excursiÃ³n a una isla del Mediterraneo en la que, segÃºn los rumores locales, quien llega allÃ­, no ha regresado jamÃ¡s. Poco despuÃ©s de llegar y pasar un rato, sois emboscados y cuando Daphne recupera el conocimiento, se despierta en el fondo de un pozo. No sabes quiÃ©n te secuestrÃ³ ni por quÃ©.
El objetivo final es encontrar una forma de escapar. Explorar la isla y descubrir mÃ¡s sobre sus habitantes sospechosos, las ruinas antiguas, minas y cuevas nos ayudarÃ¡ a comprender mejor la verdad que se oculta tras la bucÃ³lica y cautivadora isla.
A mi parecer, la historia me ha parecido muy interesante. Me ha tenido totalmente en vilo, desde el principio hasta los 3 finales que hay disponibles.

A nivel tÃ©cnico, se pueden apreciar algunos aspectos tÃ©cnicos que podrÃ­an mejorarse, pero probablemente esto provocarÃ­a que los costes de desarrollo del tÃ­tulo se elevaran bastante. Sin embargo, el resultado final es muy positivo. Una iluminaciÃ³n potente, un entorno muy colorido y unas texturas bastante fidedignas (en lo que a contexto "indie" se refiere). El mayor problema que he encontrado en este aspecto ha sido la renderizaciÃ³n en la distancia de dibujado, el popping en general y algÃºn crasheo inesperado que he sufrido en las 30 horas de juego (3 crasheos, exactamente).
He jugado el tÃ­tulo en calidad Ã‰PICA, en una resoluciÃ³n de 1080p a 60 FPS capados y el resultado final a nivel visual es muy satisfactorio. Salvo en los compases finales del tÃ­tulo (penultima ubicaciÃ³n) el juego ha corrido a 60 FPS estables con un i7-9700KF, una RTX 2070 Super y 24 GB de RAM a 2666MHz.

En lo que a gameplay respecta, nos encontramos con la continua capacidad de craftear materias primas para convertirlas en utensilios que nos facilitarÃ¡n las cosas. Plantas para elaborar medicinas, Palos para crear antorchas, palas y demÃ¡s, cuerda, pieles de animal, combustible... Nunca se sabe cuÃ¡ndo necesitaremos determinados objetos en determinado momento, de modo que lo mejor es llevar la mayor cantidad de existencias posibles de materias primas. Inicialmente, tu capacidad de mochila y de cantidad de materias primas, serÃ¡ bastante limitada, pero esta mochila puede mejorarse, aumentado capacidades de Ã¡mbos inventarios. TambiÃ©n nos encontraremos (a parte de la fauna local) con enemigos humanos que responderÃ¡n de manera hostil hacia nosotros y deberemos estar preparados con cualquier cosa que tengamos a mano, para golpearles y acabar con ellos. El momento en el que obtienes una mejor significativa es cuando obtienes la ballesta, a pesar de que la cantidad de flechas es limitada. No las desperdicies.
Por supuesto no siempre serÃ¡ recomendable pelear, o si queremos hacerlo, la mejor estrategia serÃ¡ usar el sigilo, el cual funciona de una manera bastante justa. Otra ventaja que nos pondrÃ¡ muy por encima de nuestras posibilidades, serÃ¡ el poder utilizar la ConcentraciÃ³n, dÃ¡ndonos la posiciÃ³n exacta de los seres vivos a nuestro alrededor mientras permanezcamos quietos.

A nivel exploraciÃ³n, el mapeado de la isla en la que transcurre Die Young es un mundo semi abierto. Podemos ir a casi cualquier lugar que queramos, pero estaremos limitados por las capacidades de escalada de nuestra protagonista, haciendo algunos lugares totalmente inaccesibles. Debo hacer menciÃ³n a un punto negativo. EL MENÃš DEL MAPA ES HORRIBLE, no me ha gustado lo limitado que resulta, pues no puedes navegar entre diferentes cuadrantes o hacer zoom. Solo ver los caminos, la ubicaciÃ³n de las hogueras (puntos de guardado de partida) que hayas descubierto, fuentes de agua, de combustible y refugios descubiertos, en los que podremos realizar viaje rÃ¡pido entre otros refugios que ya tengamos descubiertos, descansar y utilizar el cajÃ³n de almacenamiento para guardar objetos que no necesitemos prÃ³ximamente. TambiÃ©n disponemos de una brÃºjula (la cual apenas he usado)

Ya para ir concluyendo, Die Young me ha parecido un tÃ­tulo super recomendable, con una historia que te atrapa y llama tu atenciÃ³n desde el principio, un gameplay bastante sencillo y divertido, una exploraciÃ³n muy satisfactoria, con una sensaciÃ³n de aventura frenÃ©tica y tensiÃ³n en momentos mÃ¡s complicados. Con una duraciÃ³n un tanto corta en mi caso (30 horas), ya que he jugado a un ritmo muy alto, pienso que podemos alargar nuestra partida hasta las 50 horas, lo cual es una buena cifra para un tÃ­tulo de categorÃ­a indie y a un precio asequible (8â‚¬ en IG). Muy recomendado si te gustan los juegos de aventura.

P.D: A parte del juego final, viene incluido a mayores un prÃ³logo de la historia que es interesante hacer menciÃ³n.

Espero que os haya sido de utilidad esta reseÃ±a y nos vemos en las siguientes. Gracias por leerme :)

A.C.C.

review:
Einfach Klasse! GroÃŸes Kompliment an die Entwickler. Man hat bestimmt lange an den verschlungenen Wegen, Pfaden und den Klettereinlagen getÃ¼ftelt. Anfangs kann es etwas fordernd sein z.B. mit der Kletterei u. Wegfindung, aber ohne dabei unfair oder zu schwierig zu werden. Es bleibt die ganze Zeit spannend, Gegner zu umgehen, oder auch Schlangen auszuweichen. Grafik finde ich auch sehr gut gelungen, Musik ist der Burner, und es gibt ein riesiges Gebiet zu erkunden. Und nur wer dieses auch macht, kommt im Spiel gut weiter. Es gibt immer mehr GegenstÃ¤nde, die tatsÃ¤chlich sinnvoll sind, zu finden und zu craften. Was mich ein wenig stÃ¶rt ist die Map, die starr immer nur einen kleineren Teil des riesigen Gebietes anzeigt. Ansonsten sollte jeder, der auf Abenteuer steht, diese Spiel im Repertoire haben. 
Just buy it and have Fun, it's a fantastic Adventure Game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198217687991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1617572380}
review:
Ich wirklich erstaunt. So ein Spiel sollte einfach mehr Aufmerksam bekommen. Hatte nicht wirklich viel von dem Spiel erwartet und habe es im Sale einfach mal gekauft. Was muss ich bekloppt sein dieses Spiel nicht schon viel eher gespielt zu haben. 
Irgendwie schafft Die Young es mit simplen, aber guten Spielmechaniken mich stundenlang zu fesseln. 
Ich vermute das die Einfachheit des Spielaufbau, plus eine recht solide Story, gepaart mit einer grandiosen Map das Spiel grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils ausmacht. 
Die Map und der gesamte Wegaufbau durch diese, ist wirklich top. Ich habe einen guten Orientierungssinn, aber es gab Abschnitte an denen ich dachte WTF, wohin?! Es frustet nicht, es unterhÃ¤lt und macht neugierig auf das Weiterkommen. 

Ãœberschaubares Crafting, einige Sammelaufgaben und immer wieder neue Items im Laufe des Spiels machen hier auch nichts langweilig. Feste Speicherorte sind gut verteilt und selbst herstellbare Speicherorte kann man eigentlich solange man Holz hat ohne Probleme immer nutzen. 

Was das Spiel ebenso ausmacht ist das Thema Parcour. Am Anfang war ich recht vorsichtig bei den vielen Klettereinlagen,  bis ich merkte das man viel besser klar kommt wenn man im Flow ist. Das Sprinten und gleichzeitige Klettern lÃ¤sst alles viel flÃ¼ssiger wirken und funktioniert gut. 

Technisch habe ich keine Probleme mit dem Spiel gehabt. Ein paar minimale Grafikbugs tauchten mal auf, stÃ¶rten aber nicht. Alles lÃ¤uft flÃ¼ssig und sieht zu dem auch wirklich hÃ¼bsch aus. 
Was da eher noch weiter bearbeitet werden sollte, ist das es Probleme mit einzelnen Missionen gibt/gab. Betrifft aber scheinbar nicht alle Spieler. So konnte ich die Mission Camper erst nach umschalten auf die englische Sprachausgabe beenden. Kann man mit leben. 
Wenn ich wirklich etwas kritisieren Sollte, ist es die Ingame Map. Diese sieht man immer nur in Abschnitten. Ich wÃ¼rde mir sehr wÃ¼nschen das man die gesamte Map auf einen Blick sehen kÃ¶nnte.

Die Young macht nach meinem Empfinden mehr richtig wie manch Triple A Titel. Es fordert, frustet aber nicht. Es macht nichts wirklich neu, macht aber neugierig. Ich muss sagen, meinen Geschmack hat es voll getroffen und ich wÃ¼rde auch eine Fortsetzung ohne Bedenken kaufen. Da mÃ¼sste man noch nicht mal viel Ã¤ndern. Das Gesamtpaket was man hier bekommt ist stimmig, was nicht viele Spiele von sich sagen kÃ¶nnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2114, 'num_reviews': 1251, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1615852700}
review: A game where you play a young woman who has gotten kidnapped on a remote island in the Mediterranean and is trying to escape from cultists who have built elaborate mazes, obstacle courses, and rock climbing walls to torture her with. But seriously they're just trying to kill her lol. I feel like the stealth side of the game is all right. The exploration and climbing is fun but some of the areas are confusingly circular to navigate. Like, be prepared to end up working your way through an elaborate series of leaps and climbs only to find yourself back where you started because you grabbed this handhold, and not that one. Also, this is not a load bearing combat system, and yet the game has boss fights. I've never understood why games where you are encouraged to spend all your time sneaking around enemies and not fighting unless as a last resort will all of a sudden hurl you into an arena with a giant meat slab with a hammer and force you to fight them mano a mano in order to progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040943936', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1445, 'last_played': 1711167966}
review:
Die Young ist so eine kleine Perle unter den....... im weitesten Sinne.....Survival Games. Zwar wird auch hier aus versch. Materialien was gebastelt, der Fokus ist eher im zum Teil Parkour, Kletter, Schleich und Kampf Style. Konnte am Anfang, da war es noch Early Access, mir erst nicht so recht ein Bild davon machen, bis ich es das erste mal selber gespielt habe.
Die meisten von Euch kennen ja noch von damals Mirror's Edge, eben aus der Ego Perspektive alles erleben und kÃ¤mpfen. Aber nicht so "banals wie in ME, schon zum Teil heavy und die ein oder andere Darstellung ist schon derb.
Die Story ist schon recht interessant und man mÃ¶chte auf jeden Fall wissen wie es weiter geht.
Leider komme ich erst jetzt dazu es ausfÃ¼hrlich und als fertige Version zu spielen...... der BERG DER SCHANDE (Games die noch gespielt werden wollen) wÃ¤chst leider auch.

Und trotz der Weltweiten Misere, Zeit ist leider trotzdem so ne Sache.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059754051', 'num_games_owned': 1385, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1613859368}
review:
Die Young is a pretty weird game that mixes free-running, parkour, stealth, quest-solving, hand-to-hand combat and a little taste of FPS. Most of the characters in Die Young as well as the story itself are pretty deranged, so it's not for the faint-hearted. It also defies logic in every way possible so one has to try hard to let the BS plot slide. If you can do that, the gameplay part is awesome. There's lots of running and climbing, scavenging for supplies, crafting all kinds of tools and healing mixtures and whatnot. I experienced only a couple of glitches but otherwise it was a very smooth game.

The open-world (more like open-island) setting has varying terrain to offer, from sunflower fields to lovely forest areas to incredibly high and steep cliffs and man-made structures where one wrong step means instant death. Some of those hardcore terrains were a bit of a nuisance because they're designed to only allow one way traversal, e.g. you jump off a ledge but can't reach it if you wanna go back, meaning you'll have to once again find another way around. This going back and forth takes quite a bit of time and it really gets annoying towards the end. Sometimes though you'll be able to unlock a door or a gate from the other side to be used as a shortcut if you ever need it later. It comes in handy when exploring the island or doing quests because they seem to require plenty of backtracking. As for exploration, the island itself has many points of interest scattered all around it - documents, people, bodies, attire upgrades to increase your stamina or endurance, etc., and some of them provide good backstory context as to what's happening on the island and why.

The hand-to-hand combat is not the most pleasant aspect of Die Young though and generally felt clumsy. Stealth only works if you're further away from the enemy or hiding in tall grass, because enemies will hear you behind them even when you're sneaking. You can't really creep up and do a one-hit takedown, as apparently impaling an enemy's head with a knife does only about 30% damage. So your best bet is to either try and avoid enemies or pop their heads with an arrow, which works alright and is satisfying.

Overall it's a fun gore-fueled adventure game with a pretty unique idea. Not the most immersive experience I've had but polished enough to be called a decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969781760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2672, 'last_played': 1612660019}
review:
I like to give a quick reView of Die Young. Spending about 15 hours in the beta (back in 2019) and an additional 29 hours in the final build, I have to say I really enjoyed Die Young.

The simple crafting mechanics are not as involved as in other titles (Green Hell, The Long Dark etc) and even though the free-range parkour freedom is somewhat more limited than Dying Light, I think it's a very good blend of the two. 

The story was great and even after exploring an overwhelmingly huge map, this game still left me wanting more.

It ain't the prettiest game out there but it definitely deserves to be loved. I definitely recommend this game!

Thumbs up for a sequel!

review:
Considero que es un buen juego. Si bien la historia al principio es confusa, poco a poco comienzas a enterarte de la situaciÃ³n en la que te has metido gracias a los documentos y notas. AsÃ­ mismo, estas te ayudan a descubrir que no siempre hay un sÃ³lo camino por seguir. Puedes "desbloquear" zonas recurriendo a distintos caminos. [spoiler] En mi caso, por ejemplo, me pasÃ© el juego sin saber que habÃ­a unos guantes especiales para mejorar la escalada. Fue un gran dolor de huevos escalar hacia la Torre Alta. [/spoiler]

A veces abruma tener que recorrer medio mapa a pie, pero al final el mapa no es tan grande como aparenta, eso sÃ­, esconde a la vista sus secretos. 

Tiene finales alterativos. Guarda diferentes partidas para que los descubras todos :D

[Spoiler] Descubrir la forma en la que murieron los otros o mejor dicho, encontrar los cadÃ¡veres de tus amigos y supervivientes resulta ser algo aterrador pero gratificante (ya saben, por el logro, notas y recursos que te dan) [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198014704153', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 1986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1612253904}
review:
I really like this game, exploring and discovering things and feeling like an acrobat.
I found it mostly fun but sometimes frustrating when you have to do a lot of climbing.
I would class it as survival light as survival elements are very limited, it's very easy to stay hydrated.
What would kill me most is running out of stamina when climbing and falling or missing a jump. So death from falling was my biggest killer.
Enemies are relatively easy to avoid or kill.
The game runs well, it loads fast on a SSD and had no crashing at all.

I hated how difficult bosses are to beat. I found it impossible as combat is terrible. I was only able to defeat the Executioner by using a rock throwing glitch. I was not able to dodge his blows and he is able to kill you in 2 hits. I gave up on the horde and the last boss as it's too frustrating.
I would recommend this game to those who love exploring as don't get it if you're expecting it to be much of a survival game or if good combat is important to you.
But overall I can't recommend it myself as some things are way too difficult.
6/10

review: Die Young Ã© um jogo que mistura elementos de Parkour, sobrevivÃªncia e furtividade. Mas se vocÃª Ã© como eu que nÃ£o gosta de furtividade nÃ£o se preocupe o jogo te da opÃ§Ã£o de nÃ£o ser furtivo porem isso no comeÃ§o do jogo vai dificultar bastante a sua vida pois ainda nÃ£o temos armas ou recursos para enfrentar os inimigos. O jogo tem grÃ¡ficos bons (exceto na modelagem dos personagens) e uma vegetaÃ§Ã£o incrÃ­vel. Uma trilha sonora boa e uma histÃ³ria bastante interessante que te faz refletir sobre algumas coisas. NÃ³s somos jogados numa ilha belÃ­ssima e com bastante hostilidade nela. O gameplay Ã© bom e ruim, o Parkour funciona razoavelmente e Ã© limitado a certas Ã¡reas marcadas. O combate nÃ£o Ã© dos melhores e com uma esquiva ruim, Ã© melhor se defender e reduzir o dano do que contar com um pulinho para o lado que na maioria das vezes nÃ£o funciona. Mas com o tempo vocÃª aprende o alcance de cada inimigo e manter-se a uma distÃ¢ncia segura Ã© a chave para sua sobrevivÃªncia. Conforme avanÃ§amos no jogo, conseguimos mais armas, recursos e aprendemos mais coisas para craftar. Tornando nossa vida mais fÃ¡cil (Dica de ouro: O quanto antes vocÃª encontrar um crossbow mais fÃ¡cil vai ser a sua vida no jogo). O que me conquistou e acho que muitas outras pessoas Ã© a temÃ¡tica do jogo e como ela Ã© entregue ao jogador. Eu diria que Ã© uma experiencia que vale a pena dar uma conferida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 2947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2947, 'last_played': 1611078237}
review:
I played the adventure mode, and Die Young is much, much better than the trailer had me believe; not at all a game of incessant combat.
It's essentially a game of exploration with parkour and stealth elements. Except for a couple of (grindy) boss fights, running away is always an option. The survival aspect is kept to zero annoyance, with sparse, sensible crafting, and a thirst gauge that is immersive instead of being a nuisance.

The game has some weaknesses, like amateur voicing, unjustifiably illegible documents, and the big one, a half-arsed, double-stupid save system:
- You've got the bonfire checkpoint crap  of the Dark Stools franchise. To quit, first engage in some idiotic, possibly lethal pixel hunting for an hour, or lose your progress.
- Realising how moronic this system is, especially in an open world, they added crafting your own fires from collected wood. Again, a paramount feature is replaced by pixel hunting the smallest resource on the map.
- Crafted fires don't even stay where you put them. They are one use only.
- Loading times are long; feels like the entire map is reloaded each time.
- On the plus side, the system is multi-slots, although only at proper campfires. Half-yay!
Anyway, you can easily lose an hour of progress, particularly in the early game, when you can't find one of the tiny campfires after you've spent your 2 pieces of wood. The military camp is another culprit.
Even then, the UI dev didn't succeed in their nefarious plans of ruining the gameplay.

The island is the star of the game, and a joy to explore. Beautiful scenery, terrific sound design, vertiginous formations, vestigial buildings, nooks, crannies, shortcuts, secrets... Most locations are optional, each is distinct and nicely designed, memorable.
While the general plot is nonsensical, the environmental storytelling is excellent.
The climbing and jumping are very pleasant. The protagonist is more badass than Lara Croft. In fact, Die Young succeeds at recapturing the awesomeness of the early Tomb Raider games, unlike the modern titles of the franchise itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400411557', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1609643556}
review: The detail put into the development of this game is unbelievably good, the story is there but your so focused on survival its a thrill, seriously. The game play is very nice, but extremely realistic in a way as well, with your constant needs to survive.  If your into a survival, fast pace, run and gun idea of a game, and want more of a challenge then this is a game for you most definitely. I would recommend this to anyone who can handle playing a challenging survival game, but it does have multiple modes to choose from making play more fun or more difficult as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975018661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1610175906}
review:
I bought this a while ago, and finally got around to playing it properly. 

Great open world game with a fairly good stealth mechanic. The map, story, and scenery are pretty good, and would suit anyone who likes open world survival type games list 'The Forest'. Unlike 'The Forest' though, the crafting in this game is much smaller and limited to a few weapons and health items. The dialogue is a little mediocre in parts too, but definitely forgivable on the whole. A few glitches here and there, but for me at least, nothing game breaking. 

I'd give this a solid 75% - Glad I played it, but definitely no replay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136321977', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1607973574}
review:
For those of you that also have "Open World Survival Craft" as a favourite tag for games, I'm currently waiting to get a refund request answered. Normally I don't ask for refunds if I buy a survival game I don't enjoy, but instead spend money on this category in hopes of more games of this genre getting produced, and also that the funding will speed up improving said game becoming a game I'll enjoy playing.

"Die Young" is not, however, a game I personally would place in the "Open World Survival Craft" genre. After having tried it, I can't see any survival elements in it at all, and the crafting is as good as non-existent, the inventory is very small and it seem to only support building a few weapons and bandage, so I don't seriously understand the whole point of all the resources scattered around, nor do I get any enjoyment from gathering sticks in order to be able to save the game by burning the stick on a stationary fireplace. Also it's not a sandbox, huge open world to freely explore, but have a clear, linear storyline, and any "survival" elements in this come by progressing in the storyline. 

It would probably be a better game if it had focused more on the action elements already inherent in the game, and made the story more interesting. Instead it's a strange mix of survival elements, something "parkour"-ish, only it don't require skills, the monsters have a horrible AI and look mighty scary in the film clip, and it all look very horror-story in the video, but is simply boring when playing.

I can't imagine why anyone would vote "recommend" on this. I certainly don't recommend anyone to buy this even if it's on sale with a 80% refund. It's not worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998549732', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1608785760}
review:
"Survival light" meets Mirror's Edge... maybe with a hint of classic Tomb Raider.

There is a big open world map with a lot to explore and discover. Puzzle pieces of the story are scattered all over the island. The enemy AI, the stealth mechanic and fighting is lacking, but Parkour and climbing is great! The focus is on exploration anyway. The immersion while climbing is at times so good that one gets partly dizzy from the height. At the top then you are rewarded with a great view.

Great game, especially for that price. I paid about 8 â‚¬ when it was on sale. I'm 25 hours in right now and I'm having a blast. 

Underrated! Don't know why this game is widely unknown.

review: It is a cool mediterranean settings, graphics are good enough. It feels a bit like an open world survival mirror's edge, although the survival aspects are rather limited and forgiving, which I actually like. The story is also interesting enough, though most of the storytelling is environmental and through notes. I recommend the game to anyone open to a mirror's edge esque open world game with crazy survival/horror aspects.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963877789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1672, 'last_played': 1607411879}
review:
A- 

While a bit rough in places, Die Young has so much vision and it creates a quite immersive world for an indie game.  In my mind, the game is a fusion of Mirror's Edge, Dying Light, Miasmata, and Tomb Raider.  It takes elements from all of these games and makes it's own with some very basic survival elements.

At the core, I would call this game an adventure exploration game that has action and survival elements.  If you predominately like exploring, you will like this.  (Ex. for the first 60 hours of me playing Fallout New Vegas, I just explored and hadn't reached even 25% of the main story quests.)  Trying to find your way, map/compass read works pretty well.  Most of the dangers can be avoided and I recommend doing that as much as you can because you just aren't made to be a fighter.  I hoarded good stuff but in the end I didn't really need 85% of what I found.  Found equipment on the other hand was super helpful and I've would've like more variety.  (I liked that if you followed the in game hints and story, you can definitely find nearly all of the equipment if you're aware enough.)  A bit more robust inventory system would've been nice too.

Wasn't really a fan of the boss fights, I don't think they came off very well; I would've liked to see other ways to deal with them.   The hit boxes didn't always seem to be accurate.  And the voice acting (and dialogue) was absolutely not good; I didn't mind the voice of the main character most of the time but she didn't seem to have any emotional care for dead people she'd find and would make very crass remarks that didn't fit the tone.

The story and story elements (journals, papers etc) I think were well done and the mystery unfolds nicely.  For what it is, I think this work is very impressive and I can't wait to see what other types of exploration games they come up with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796108420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1696162288}
review:
When I first played this game, it was quiet boring and kind of dull. I didnÂ´t play for too long. I stopped playing but gave it a second chance a couple weeks ago.
I just kept playing and with time I got used to it and really started to appreciate the whole idea! I had so much fun! 
It was kind of confusing at times (some areas are like mazes :)) but I enjoyed it a lot!
It contains some parcourish things which I absolutely loved! Running around in a forest or jumping over insanely deep cliffs? At full speed? No problem :D
The story line is actually quiet nice. I got confused because of some side quests I wanted to finish before going on with the main quest. I can only tell those people interested in this game, just play it :) Follow the main quest. It may fall all in place with time :) 
Explore everything! Even tho the first "level" isnÂ´t the prettiest, there are way more levels coming with a lot more details and interesting designs :)
Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082857368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1709092760}
review:
It seems like a low budget game with not much to offer, but as you start playing it... GOD DAMN!! 
It is immersive, it is HUGE, it's fun, hard and simple at the same time, and it get's you on the skin of the character. 
You always want to know some more about it, and it end up making you spend hours and hours, trying to find even the last secret.
It's without a doubt a "must have" game on your library.
Of course, it has it's flaws.
Combat style is somehow limited. But at the same time, gives you the realistic feel.
There are also some minor bug problems, but not much of a deal.

My opinion:
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198321212538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2615, 'last_played': 1606189242}
review:
Graphics: very nice. This island reminded me of Just Cause 3. You get to enjoy many beautiful sights.
Combat: you don't have to fight everyone you see. Just stay stealthy and you will be fine. You need to be very skillful and resourceful if you want to be aggressive.
Survival and crafting aspects: be careful if you're not sprinting because snakes may bite you. Stay hydrated and you will be fine. Save medkits or stamina boost for critical fights only. Resources are plenty to find so don't worry about crafting. It is not necessary to buy all the stuffs the old man offer to be good at crafting.
Story: I like how you slowly discover the fate of your friends. Who was bad and who was unfortunate. There are 3 endings and each of them is uniquely interesting to find out.

This game is underrated. I hope more people find out about it and have a good time parkouring through the island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076067907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1605407806}
review:
Not a bad game, I found it a little slow at times but when ever I walked away I kept thinking about it and coming back to play more. 
Graphics are good enough, motion blur is off by default that, that's an up vote straight away! 
Worth buying, has lots of story to figure out and does create an adventure as you explore and find out more about the island. I look forward to seeing the direction the game goes in, so far they have done a good job! 

Thanks for the free review copy, it's not often I get something I like and catches my attention, putting itself above the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993890344', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1605228743}
review: Pretty decent little indie game. Its sort of like if you took Far Cry and Dying Light but put it on a much lower budget and remove the guns and monsters. Quite a big open world, lot of climbing around you can do, decent mechanics with that, quite a lot of things to do and find and there's like a crafting system and side missions and lots of lore to pick up. Voice acting could be better but not too bad for an indie game. The enemies are probably the weakest point, there's maybe like 5 enemy types in the whole game and like some enemy animations look pretty dumb. The combat isn't that great. For some weird reason enemies can throw rocks at you that makes you go flying 5 feet backwards which is dumb af. It did crash once which was annoying but not too bad. Didn't have any game breaking bugs or anything like that so that's good. The hit detection on stuff can be dumb sometimes and also the pickaxe for some reason barely ever hits enemies which is annoying. Also characters mouths don't move when they talk which sucks. Pretty interesting little story though with a lot of lore and all that. Not a bad game overall definitely worth checking out, although the final boss is retarded and tedious and just a reskin of other enemies in the game so that's disappointing. The game does have multiple endings though so that's pretty cool. Overall not bad I'd give it a 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1590085857}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Die Young is a Survival-Adventure developed by IndieGala.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

In the open-world survival game Die Young, we control a young girl from the first person view, who for unknown reasons has been kidnapped to an idyllic Mediterranean island. Our protagonist is not the only victim of the kidnappers, but she is the first to escape from prison. The goal is not only to escape the tormentor and find a way off the island, but also to explore the mysteries, ruins, mines, caves and inhabitants of the island. The latter are quite suspicious and may also pose a threat to you. Die Young is developed on the basis of the Unreal Engine 4 and, in addition to the basic gameplay consisting of running, jumping and climbing in the first-person perspective, it also offers the option of searching for water, equipment and other items that may be used during the escape and exploration might be helpful.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ stay alive
+ constant fear of being followed
+ beautiful graphics
+ matching pieces of music
+ Thinking alone is not enough
+ good puzzles
+ collectable items
+ Achievements and Trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- very difficult at the beginning
- better combat mechanics
- more Survival Elements

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Those who like to discover an unknown, dangerous world and uncover its secrets in the process will most likely find a lot of entertainment in Die Young. Personally, I would have liked more survival aspects than in other games, but a strong focus on parkour, free climbing and, above all, exploring and discovering small secrets makes this game different and puts its own stamp on the game.

Unsere Protagonistin ist nicht das einzige Opfer der EntfÃ¼hrer, aber sie ist die Erste, der es gelingt, aus ihrem GefÃ¤ngnis zu entkommen. Ziel ist es dabei aber nicht nur dem Peiniger zu entkommen und einen Weg von der Insel zu finden, sondern auch die Mysterien, Ruinen, Minen, HÃ¶hlen und Bewohner der Insel zu erkunden. Letztere sind recht verdÃ¤chtig und stellen fÃ¼r Dich mÃ¶glicherweise ebenfalls eine Bedrohung dar
Entwickelt wird Die Young auf Basis der Unreal Engine 4 und bietet neben dem grundlegenden Gameplay, das aus Rennen, Springen und Klettern in der First-Person-Perspektive besteht auch die MÃ¶glichkeit, nach Wasser, AusrÃ¼stung und anderen GegenstÃ¤nden zu suchen, die bei der Flucht und Erkundung hilfreich sein kÃ¶nnten. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ bleib am Leben
+ stÃ¤ndige Angst verfolgt zu werden
+ wunderschÃ¶ne Grafik

review:
ayant un peu jouÃ© Ã  ce jeu durant l'early access, je peux tÃ©moigner du suivi incroyable d'indie gala.
Pour faire simple : Die Young est un jeu de survie/parkour plutÃ´t bien foutu, avec quelques Ã©lÃ©ments metroidvania (exemple : rÃ©cupÃ©rer une recette pour empoisonner un clebs qui vous empÃªche de ramasser un objet clÃ©, rÃ©cupÃ©rer des gants d'escalade pour franchir un mur autrement infranchissable etc...)

les points positifs :
1) SystÃ¨me de survie simplifiÃ©e : pas de dÃ©lire ultra compliquÃ© de maladie qui doit Ãªtre soignÃ©e en appliquant des baies de jesaispasquoi toute les 30 minutes in-game pendant X temps, ici, vous aurez surtout besoin de trouver de l'eau (pour la jauge d'hydratation) et de la nourriture (pour l'hydratation, et les HP) et de faire attention a ces maudits serpent qui peuvent vous injecter du venin et vous faire perdre des HP sur la durÃ©e.

2) La fabrication (crafting) : il y a peu de ressource diffÃ©rentes, ce qui facilite le craft d'objet. pas de surmultiplication de ressource qui auraient logiquement la mÃªme utilitÃ©.

3) L'escalade : trÃ¨s semblable a Dying Light, si vous avez le vertige, vous allez en baver. mais dieu merci, il y a une aide pour Ã©viter qu'on ne se casse la gueule toute les 2 secondes, les mÃ©caniques Ã©tant moins raffinÃ©e que celle de Dying Light (vous pouvez dÃ©sactiver cette aide dans les options de jeu)

4) Les Ã©quipements : ils sont durs Ã  trouver, et il y en a peu, mais tous vous permettrons de jouer comme vous le sentez le mieux. exemple : des gants d'alpiniste qui rÃ©duirons votre consommation d'endurance lors d'escalades, ou des gants de travail qui rÃ©duirons votre consommation d'endurance lorsque vous tapez vos ennemis. simple mais efficace.

5) DifficultÃ© personnalisÃ©e : dÃ©gÃ¢ts reÃ§us, dÃ©gÃ¢ts infligÃ©s, taux d'hydratation, durabilitÃ© des armes, aide a l'escalade... je conseille de jouer en mode "adventure" pour une expÃ©rience sympa et plutÃ´t difficile, sans Ãªtre prise de tÃªte.

6) L'utilitÃ© des armes : car oui, presque chaque arme Ã  une utilitÃ© spÃ©cifique (Ã  l'exception du bÃ¢ton et de la pioche, qui sont juste des arme de bourrin) les clÃ©s a molettes servent a rÃ©parer certaines pompes a eau, les pieds de biche servent a dÃ©foncer les cadenas et ouvrir des conduits d'aÃ©ration, la pelle a creuser Ã  certains endroits spÃ©cifique. et si par malheur vous n'avez pas l'arme en question sur vous, vous pourrez la crafter (il faut avoir ramasser l'arme a crafter au moins 1 fois pour en dÃ©bloquer le craft)

7) L'histoire : Le dÃ©but est trÃ¨s simple et ressemble a Far Cry 3 ; Une jeune fille de riche fan de sports extrÃªmes part avec des amis sur une Ã®le paumÃ©es. mais elle se fait kidnapper et est jetÃ©e dans un puis. Ã  son rÃ©veil, quelqu'un lui balance une carte. Et, le jeu commence.
C'Ã©tait pour la base, intÃ©ressons nous maintenant aux spoilers : [spoiler] en fait, vous avez voyagÃ© sur une Ã®le rÃ©gie par une secte communautaire, dites socialiste (mÃªme si Ã§a Ã  plus la tronche d'un rÃ©gime extrÃªmiste) dÃ©chirÃ©e entre les 3 personnes qui la dirigent. L'un dÃ©teste la sociÃ©tÃ© moderne, mais se contente de l'Ã®le, l'autre veut plus d'indÃ©pendance car il estime qu'ils sont encore Ã  la botte d'un gouvernement qui ne les respecte pas assez, ou les craints trop, pour leurs envoyer de vraies armes Ã  feu. Le dernier est un psychopathe pur et dur qui aime tuer et torturer les gens. vous apprendrez que l'escalade de la Haute Tour est en fait une des nombreuses Ã©preuves qu'il vous fallait passer pour rejoindre la secte, ou la brÃ»ler. [/spoiler] le tout est bien amenÃ©, le storytelling est surtout prÃ©sent via diffÃ©rents notes Ã©parpillÃ©es un peu partout, et, fait assez rare pour Ãªtre notÃ©, la plupart des notes apporte de VRAIES indices sur le fonctionnement de l'Ã®le et la vie de certaines personnes. des Ã©lÃ©ments qui ne faisaient aucun sens au dÃ©but du jeu deviennent parfaitement logique Ã  la fin, preuve d'une bonne Ã©criture.


Les point "meh"
1) Les combats : c'est pas ouf, on bourrine en priant que Ã§a passe. les ennemis humains sont facilement tuable avec ce pattern : attaque ennemie, press S+espace, press Z, attack, press S. rince and repeat. les animaux sont lÃ©gÃ¨rement plus compliquÃ© mais la encore, pas ouf du tout. les hitbox sont parfois aux fraises (surtout la votre)

2) DiversitÃ© des ennemis : Humains sans bÃ¢ton, avec bÃ¢ton, avec arbalÃ¨te, gÃ©ant psycho, chiens, serpent, loups. et c'est tout. En soit, Ã§a suffit amplement pour faire un jeu, mais Ã§a manque de quelque chose.

3) Voice Acting : pas ouf du tout. c'est simple, en dehors de FrÃ¨re numÃ©ro 1, FrÃ¨re numÃ©ro 2, et de DaphnÃ© (perso principal) le voice acting ne vole pas haut.

4) Le Quest Design : certaines quÃªtes sont... mauvaise. Elles poussent a l'exploration, mais c'est pas plaisant. deux exemples :
-Dans une certaines forÃªt, vous pourrez rencontrer un vieil ermite qui vous demandera de creuser Ã  certains endroits spÃ©cifique car il avait enterrer son journal mais ne sait plus ou exactement. vous avez un vingtaine d'endroit Ã  fouiller et creuser avant de tomber sur son journal. C'est horriblement chiant, j'ai toujours pas fini cette maudite quÃªte.

Sinon, je repense Ã  cette quÃªte du dÃ©but du jeu : [spoiler] vous allez dans une tour cÃ´tiÃ¨re, un gonzo est retenu prisonnier sous une trappe, vous devez trouver la clÃ© de sa prison. mais personne ne saÃ®t ou elle est (en fait, si, elle se trouve a la haute-tour, dans une cabane, mais c'est a vous de la trouver) vous retournez dÃ©livrer le gonzo, surprise ! il s'est suicidÃ©. sur son T-shirt, un trollface. c'est le moment ou j'ai eu autant envie de rire, que de cracher sur mon Ã©cran. [/spoiler]

5) L'optimisation : le jeu est beau, certes, mais beaucoup de popping, de texture un peu baveuse et de lÃ©ger freeze. sans compter les bugs de collisions qui m'ont fait pÃ©ter un cÃ¢ble. Car oui, Die Young est l'un des rares jeux ou vous pourrez vous "tanker dans le pixel" et vous bloquer jusqu'Ã  ce que vous rechargiez une sauvegarde prÃ©cÃ©dente. ne faite JAMAIS de quicksave quand vous Ãªtes bloquÃ©, surtout si vous n'avez pas l'habitude de (rÃ©ellement) sauvegarder souvent.


Les points nÃ©gatifs
1) Les bugs de collisions (oui, encore)
2) OST indisponible en dehors de steam (youtube... existe, les gars)
3) Bugs de son, dialogues sous-mixÃ©s. C'est quasi impossible d'entendre les dialogues.
4) VF aux fraises : certains passages sont mal traduits, d'autres sont juste pas du tout traduit. certains mots sont encore en anglais. Le prologue n'est pas traduit. les noms des diffÃ©rents emplacement sur la map ont un bug Ã©trange qui les rends illisible.



Conclusion :
Sur beaucoup de points, Die Young est tout ce que Far Cry aurait dÃ» devenir aprÃ¨s le 3Ã¨me opus, mais Ubisoft se fout pas mal de ce que leur fanbase veut, raison pour laquelle on se retrouve avec un FC5 qui n'ajoute toujours rien. 
Merci IndieGala pour proposer un jeu assez ambitieux pour le budget modeste, et merci de prouver que les dÃ©veloppeurs indÃ©s ne sont pas tous d'immondes trous qui gardent l'argent du crowdfunding.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998027136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1604239330}
review:
J'ai beaucoup aimÃ© Die Young, qui a ses dÃ©fauts (comme tous les jeux), mais l'ambiance gÃ©nÃ©rale du titre m'a Ã©normÃ©ment plu, avec son Ã®le mÃ©diterranÃ©enne au level design vraiment bien fichu.

En terme de gameplay, le jeu est clairement inspirÃ© par Dying Light, mais qui s'en plaindrait ? D'ailleurs les phases d'escalade sont clairement le gros point fort du jeu, et l'ascension de la Haute Tour me restera longtemps en mÃ©moire.

La durÃ©e de vie est bonne, il m'a fallu 25 heure pour boucler l'aventure, mais si il est vrai que j'ai pas mal passÃ© de temps Ã  juste me balader pour profiter du voyage. 
J'ai aussi beaucoup apprÃ©ciÃ© le fait que l'exploration est bien mise en avant, et c'est au joueur de bien assimiler ce que le jeu attend de lui.

Quelques dÃ©fauts Ã  noter: 
-les doublages (uniquement en anglais), sont assez mÃ©diocres, et seul 1 ou 2 personnages sont jouÃ©s avec conviction, le reste fait trÃ¨s "film Z".

-Les combats auraient mÃ©ritÃ© d'Ãªtre plus approfondis et stratÃ©giques; ici on peut bourriner et Ã§a passe souvent crÃ¨me.

-La carte, qui est morcelÃ©e, aurait mÃ©ritÃ© d'avoir une option pour avoir une vision totale de l'Ã®le au lieu de bout Ã©pars.

En bref, de l'excellent boulot de la part d'Indie Gala, et qui plus est le jeu a bÃ©nÃ©ficiÃ© d'un trÃ¨s bon suivi des dÃ©veloppeurs. Bravo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108639928', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1603843624}
review:
Es dificil explicar por que Die Young es tan entretenido. 
Creo que es su ambientacion bastante bien lograda, su historia que sabe como revelar poco a poco la informacion, la exploracion y libertad casi total, buenas mecanicas tanto de movilidad como de crafteo y combate. 
Como punto negativo al ser un juego tan libre a veces puede agobiar y sentirse tedioso buscar ciertos objetos, lugares o simplemente ir de un punto a otro. Algunas misiones son poco claras y ciertas mecanicas deberian estar mas pulidas (como el parkour).

La historia no dura mas de 10 horas explorando casi todo. Tiene toma de decisiones pero no parece que afecten demasiado mas aya del final a obtener. 

En conclusion, buen juego si lo que te gusta es explorar y el miedo a sentirte perdido, desconcertado y acechado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059883113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1966, 'last_played': 1603949014}
review:
As i did promise then i did edit my comment after had gone contact to the developer about this bug that i now know that is not the same bug like the one you can find in some debat on steam, where this bug comes if you get a important item in the game you need later instead for first getting the item when you should be alowed to it.. explain comes later !..  first it would be most fair to tell again what good things there is about this game because beside of one bug that got me to almost give up all hope if not for the friendly help from the developer, then will say that i actually loves this game.. its long time since i last had ben so fast locked to a great game like this. if you see youtube videos or toher players play it on twitch then you can end up missunderstand that this game is too much a copy of tomb raider wich is still also a great game but if it were true then it would had gone booring too fast BUT its not like tomb raider.. when jumping around and climbing in some of the areas it minds a little of tomb raider but also the great old parqua game named Mirrors edge have some trails in this awsome game wich is a cool combination. It is also a open world or what i think i will call it some areas in diffrent sizes where many of them is damn huge, and when i say damn huge i mean it in a good way, there is tons of diffrent exciting tracks to find from some other survivors in the game story and many informations spread around about what happend and what this place you are in is. the balance in fighting enemies is good beside there is 2 kind that you will need to think on a great strategy to knock out. much of the nature in the game is pretty and nice to watch while running around and its easy to get the items you need for weapons or meds to survive and i had found out that they keep respawn wich is nice so you never need to think on to spare some materials. I must say it not is a game for kids because there is a lot brutal voilence in the game, that even did surprice me. I men yeah when you look at the picture its a crazy maniac with a slice but thats something you almost find in many games now.. but what he will do to you if he gets you.. now that is a total diffrent thing. Now there is great many things about the game and you can use hours on it but as i also did say to the developer then i wont lie about the bug that is in the game and i find it nessecary to explain it in hope other wont get caught and cant complete the game unless they do contact the developer like i did.

1 BUG IN THE GAME. THIS IS A NESSECARY SPOILER !!!

when you come to a sun flower field then there is a big building where you can sneak in but finds out that you need a lighter to unlock some fire doors so you can get a fuel can.. This fuel can is possible to get before the game actually allows you to. The way to do it is to kill one of the enemies outside that patrols with a crosbow and then pick up his weapon and some arrows. Go inside upstairs again where you was supposed to use the lighter. then down below in the side where this fire camera is, that you need to use the lighter on, there is a port you can open with a button on the wall. If you stand in direct potision upstairs and shoot at the button then the port will open and you can just go outside and walk in from behind where the fuel can is.. IF you do this then you have just destroyed the game you are playing now.. that will say, that im sure that you can of course jsut start over and try to do it right next time so it not happens again but its many many hours you need to replay :( so if you had done this, then contact the developer. Thats was all :)
developer_response: Hi DKC fighter, we have just read the email you sent yesterday. Sorry for the bug, but I can confirm you that we can fix it for you. You will receive a reply to your email soon with the instructions to get your saved file fixed.

review: It's exactly what I like in a game; part puzzle and part exploration.  I find it challenging enough I want to keep playing but not so challenging I feel like throwing the computer.  The jumps are sometimes terrifying as someone who's afraid of heights, I've discovered I'm afraid of them in game too. Nerve wracking in the best way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068982092', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1600529392}
review:
A very nice surprise!

This game's strongest points are the exploration and adventure with a dash of parkour and stealth. It has a survial mode but I wouldn't expect is to be too great because the survial and crafting mechanics are very basic. The fighting is also not a strong point of the game. It's basic and almost boring.

What I really love about this game is that is doesn't hold you by the hand. In the first half of the story, you have to figure out what you want to do and how you have to do it. It lead to one or two parts a little too annoying to figure out but, for the most part, I did everything on my own and it felt very rewarding.

I also love how open the world feels. Some area are more linear, especially towards the end of the game but you're often able to move freely between areas in multiple way and see neighbouring areas from multiple points.

Last note, I wouldn't recommend playing the prologue first. The base game does a very good job of teaching you the mechanics. The story of the prologue won't be relevant until the end of the base game and the main area feels a lot more like the areas you'll see at the end of the game. It was very nice to play and explore but I recommend doing it after the game if you want a little more.

Overall, very enjoyable, sequel please!

review:
Nota.: (7,8/10)
----
Die Young nÃ£o Ã© uma homenagem a mÃºsica da Ke$ha, nÃ£o se assuste. Cheguei a conhecer o jogo quando lanÃ§aram seu primeiro trailer, mas nÃ£o tinha nem sequer um computador para isso. Eu fiquei ansioso para conhecer desde entÃ£o.
O jogo se trata da sua personagem, a Daphne, uma menina que Ã© cheia de amigo Playboy e tosco e que vai com eles para uma ilha prÃ³xima a Turquia que era dita como o paraÃ­so. Chegando lÃ¡, vocÃªs sÃ£o sequestrados e largados pelo mundo para sobreviver, numa ilha que vive uma mistura de Anarcoprimitivismo com Socialismo.
Esse jogo mostra que todo aquele papo da esquerda de "Ain, sistema Ã© podre, te faz comprar coisas que vocÃª nÃ£o precisa", "ain, Clube da Luta mostra que vocÃª precisa mais de socialismo e menos capitalismo" Ã© papo de filhinho de papai que diz lutar por gente pobre, mas acha que se faz fumando maconha e vendo quizz do Buzzfeed. 
A ilha quer te matar o tempo todo para provar que socialismo Ã© amor e o capitalismo Ã© morte... SENDO QUE SÃƒO ELES QUE QUEREM TE MATAR.
Lindo, me emocionei, Ã© a pura representaÃ§Ã£o de como seria na real.
A jogabilidade Ã© legal, vocÃª sempre utiliza de Parkour para descobrir os lugares. Embora seja um survival de mundo aberto, vocÃª nÃ£o pode fazer casas e o caramba todo como um The Forest... Digo isso porque o canal Cow Level (um salve, irmÃ£o) o chama de The Forest com Parkour. NÃ£o tem nada a ver!
Os grÃ¡ficos sÃ£o Bons, mas nada lindo e maravilhoso... O design Ã© legal, mas nada UAU (atÃ© porque, os caras sÃ£o tÃ£o vacilÃ£o no socialismo, que roubam atÃ© estilo de arquitetura Grega e Romana).
Vale a pena comprar numa promoÃ§Ã£o. Mas nÃ£o compre achando que vai viver a segunda experiÃªncia de The Forest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970631771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1696, 'last_played': 1599840245}
review:
Die Young is primarily an open-world exploration game with parkour elements. There are survival elements, but unless you play in survival mode you will rarely ever need to manage resources - which is a good thing. You can spend your time exploring without having to micro-manage water and food etc. There is also very little combat,  apart from the last part of the game. In fact, in most of the early game you will rarely meet enemies and most of them you can easily avoid or run away from. Again, this is a good thing - you can concentrate on exploring.

Where Die Young excels is exploration and slowly unlocking the very large island (much larger than you initially realise). Most of the time this revolves around finding landmarks (a high tower, an abandoned farm, some old mines etc) which you need to use parkour to "solve". Whilst I'd normally find first-person jumping irritating, Die Young does it well - it's difficult, but not too difficult to frustrate and the sense of achievement in scaling buildings is great.

So, this is a game for people who enjoy exploring, adventure and unlocking a story. It's flawed, and it's indie roots are often apparent, but still a lot of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035599199', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1599597372}
review:
A good game.  
Some things to know up front as I had a vastly different expectation going in based on trailers and tags.
For one, this isn't really a horror game.  Sure they're quite liberal with gore as evidenced by the trailer, and that's all in there.  But there's nothing really what I would call scary in it.  It's almost entirely out in the sunshine.  There's no jumpscares or even a lingering sense of dread.  And the game actively encourages you not to be out after sundown, and it never forces you to be either.  And the day/night cycle is pretty much real-time as far as I could tell, and I ended up sleeping overnight in a shelter all of once.
Secondly, this game is very light on the survival aspects  - you really have only one meter, a thirst.  You can eat to restore health, but a medkit will do the same.  And there's no tiredness meter.  There is a stamina meter though it must be said your character is quite fit, and if you do the sidequests (which I thoroughly recommend you do) you'll pick up plenty of gear that helps that meter go longer.  And most of the crafting you do yourself is for health packs to recover from fall damage.
It was also clear the developers realised their combat system was pretty woeful.  As you do practically none of it throughout!  It's easy enough to be stealthy as long as you're keeping an eye out.  Once you're in combat all you can do is wale away with whatever melee weapon you have to hand until either they die, or you run out of stamina/low on health, run off to take a breath/medkit, and proceed to wale away some more.  And the game doesn't actually have that many enemies throughout altogether so it's never a struggle to keep hidden.
What the game does do well is it crafts an interesting setup, and with next to no handholding, you are set off to explore the fairly vast island.  Along the way you'll gather tools, pick up breadcrumbs of the story and world and the tales of other expeditions to the island, and do a helluva lots of climbing and navigating routes along tricky terrain.  I thoroughly enjoyed these aspects of the game and it had me hooked and invested.
Though a pretty big negative I felt is it feels like the game ends just as it's getting going.  It's clear they had a bigger game planned that their budget and small team just couldn't meet.  I haven't felt as stunned upon seeing the credits than I have in a very long time.  Though in fairness and to the game's credit I think I was most disappointed it ended when it did because I was enjoying myself.  And there's definitely a setup for a sequel here.  So fingers crossed it will come!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088689585', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1596837259}
review:
Die Young is a very interesting game, it is rough around the edges but i liked it a lot (I spent 32h in a single gameplay, from start to endÂ¹)

Graphics looks good, sounds are nice but the music is... well... i don't know what to say. Sometimes some random 80's sound fit for a Duke Nukem 1 lvl starts to play... Not that i complain about it... Eer.. Ahem.

One of the things about the game that i liked was the scenario. The island is very big, and all areas connect to each other in a realistic way. At later parts of the game, you'll find entrances to the earlier areas that you couldn't access before and it gives a nice sense of location, geography, or whatever it is called. Of course the jumping spots around the map are mostly fictional. I doubt anyone would even think about making most of them IRL. But they work for the game.

As for gameplay:
The parkour part - The animations are nice and i had only minor problems with jumping around. I fell a few times but you just need to be patient and look around. In most parts of the game, you can actually jump your way around, avoiding enemies and also getting to hidden locations or shortcuts.
I believe some will not like it, others will. But it is intuitive.

Just don't expect tons of action. The game may appear to be an action game, but in truth i think it is closer to 'walking simulators', where you walk (in this case, run and jump) around, solve puzzles and find bits of story here and there to unfold the main plot.
It is more about exploration and story than action itself. Even one of the boss fights is actually a puzzle and not a real combat. Nice.

But this brings up one of the bad sides of the game... Combat.
Combat is clunky. Most times i didn't have a clue about what was happening. Was the oponent defending but i got hit? I was attacking but received damage? Wait, what?
You can avoid almost all combat by sneaking and finding alternative routes, and also craft stuff to kill oponents silently.
But i bet your best friend will be the crossbow. Aim, take one silently, wait, kill the other. I did this the entire gameplay and the few times (like 4 times) i tried to go melee, i almost died.

But you barely fight. And that's great, because you can explore more, and do things the way you prefer.

The devs tried some different things in the game and most of them work nicely, but maybe when put together, they end up not being so ncie.
While i really enjoyed the game, i can't finish it. I guess i'll just uninstall at some point without trying it again. Kind of a spoiler ahead:

Â¹ - You play the entire game the way you want. It offers different alternatives to solve whatever appears. And when it's difficult, you just need to think a bit.
I played it on stealth mode with the crossbow. I jumped around and killed the guys silently.

But, in the end of the game...
[spoiler] You are just forced to fight the boss... There could be jumping around, throwing things from scenario at him, like hitting a column to fall on him or something like that... But you need to fight. And if you  didn't pack yourself on your way there, you'll just lose it.
I suck at combat. I don't carry tons of stuff with me. Damn, they just throw everyone at you and call it a day.

This was NOT fun at all. After trying 5 times i closed the game and i don't want to open it anymore. There is no gist. No other way. No puzzle to solve.
Bad, very bad.[/spoiler]

BUT anyways, i had 32h of fun, and i enjoyed almost all of it, so yeah, i DO recommend the game. Just don't expect too much real action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332836391', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1506, 'last_played': 1598787395}
review:
The game is okay, but not overwhelmingly fun. The exploration part is fun for the most part, but it could get pretty boring when needing to go back to the same locations just to find an item, or to enter a room you couldn't in anyway enter earlier. I also feel there should have been more things to interact with in the environment. 
The climbing reminded me very much of Tomb Raider, with ledges you can grab marked with white. This isn't necessarily a bad thing as it would be tedious trying and failing when finding out where to climb, but it gives an idea of how open the climbing environment is.
I think the fighting in this game could use an improvement, and so could the AI of npc's, both of which reminded me of some old school game. 
Something I miss is the ability to take down enemies from behind or stealth. I think this could have been a good addition to the game.
I would give this a 6/10.

Des bugs de collision, Ã  priori rares, mais qui sont toujours gÃªnants. En 20h de jeu, je ne me suis retrouvÃ© coincÃ© dans le dÃ©cor qu'une seule fois, et je l'avais un peu cherchÃ©...
