author: {'steamid': '76561197970560085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1597893332}
review: A very impressive first-person survival style game made by a small team.  I clocked in 28 hours after exploring everything and doing every single hidden mission.  It's not a game where you'll be doing a lot of gun shooting fps.  You're weak and you'll craft items to help you fight but none are powerful.  You'll have to rely on your running/climbing/crafting/stamina skills to see you through this mysterious island with different endings.  A lot of exploration and a unique story that you haven't played before in like so many other titles.  Optimization is very well done using UE4 engine.  I clocked maxed at 4K with everything about 85 fps.  Without question I can easily recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089805810', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1597370872}
review:
[h1][i]"The world out there is a burning furnace, Daphne, and you're all digging your own grave every single day."[/i][/h1]
[i]Die Young[/i] is a first-person open-world survival game. You control Daphne, and you wake up to find out that you are on a mysterious island off the coast of Turkey that is controlled by a cult, known as The Community. Your mission is to find your missing friends and escape from the island. I completed the story, unlocked all the endings, earned all the achievements and saw everything the game has to offer.

[h3]Pros[/h3]
âœ”ï¸ Intriguing story, with interesting characters and good voice acting.
âœ”ï¸ Fun parkour and platforming gameplay.
âœ”ï¸ A simple, yet satisfying, crafting system
âœ”ï¸ Gorgeous and well-designed world.
âœ”ï¸ Stunning graphics.
âœ”ï¸ Good soundtrack. 

[h3]Cons[/h3]
âŒ Some awkward writing
âŒ Not very polished game, encountered minor bugs and glitches.

[h1]Story[/h1]
You play as Daphne, a young adrenaline junkie who enjoys rock climbing and hanging out with her friends. One day, you were on vacation with your friends in Turkey and decided to check out a mysterious nearby island. Once you reached the shore, you were attacked and fell unconscious. After waking up, you find yourself alone on the island controlled by The Community, a group of extreme socialists led by a man known as Brother No.1, and it is up to you to find your missing friends and escape from this place as fast as possible. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2196744449

You will meet very few characters in this game (enemy and friendly), as many of the inhabitants want to be left alone, but the few characters that you meet are interesting, mysterious and you just want to know more about them. Like Daphne, they are well voice-acted and sound believable (even though there is no lip movement). However, the writing is not very great, as some of Daphne's dialogues feel awkward and out of place.

There are also secrets, documents, hidden locations and side quests that expand the lore and reveal the history of the island and some of the people that you meet. There are a total of three endings, one of which can be achieved early in the game, and they are based on the choices you make during specific missions. In conclusion, the story is really good and it keeps you interested till the end.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[u]Survival[/u]
[i]Die Young[/i] isnâ€™t like the other popular survival games; One quick thing you'll notice is that 24 hours in-game equal to 24 hours in the real world, so don't expect to spend multiple days in there. However, you canâ€™t play during the night (after 9 PM specifically), or else you will be given a "Game Over" screen, so you have to find shelter before that happens. 

You also have to keep an eye on your hydration meter, since it depletes as time goes. Thankfully, it's fairly easy to find water and food on the island that can replenish both your health and hydration meters. You can also hunt animals roaming around the island for food and crafting materials, some flee from you once spotted, while others are aggressive and hostile towards you. 

Bonfires allow you to save the game and cook raw meat, while shelters serve as resting spots, have shared storage boxes where you can store your items, and are a way to fast travel from one shelter to another. With that said, itâ€™s weird that you can't manually save in your shelter, only saves automatically once you exit.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2196744428

[u]Exploration and platforming[/u]
The Island is huge, so you will be exploring a lot of landmarks, from ancient ruins to a military base, and you have to use your platforming skills to access some of those areas. The climbing and parkour system in this game is very similar to [i]Dying Light[/i]; itâ€™s fast-paced and very engaging.

[u]Crafting[/u]
The crafting options in this game are limited, but sufficient. You can craft multiple weapons, arrows for your crossbow, health potions, and different upgrades for your character. However, you wonâ€™t be able to build any structures; your main goal is to find a way to escape as fast as possible, or die trying.

[u]Enemies[/u]
Aside from some hostile animals that you'll come across (hogs, wolves and snakes), The Community has its own militia, wielding either batons or crossbows, and vicious dogs. They can be easy to deal with during stealth, but difficult when facing a group of them, as you have to dodge their attacks and evade their arrows (when you face a mob of them, use a molotov to burn them to a crisp). 

[u]Bosses[/u]
There are two main bosses in the game, and the final boss can be dealt with very early; two optional bosses will be roaming the island, and if you kill [b]both of them[/b] then there wonâ€™t be a final boss fight. However, you have to kill them as fast as possible, or else theyâ€™ll disappear later in the story. I should mention that those fights are hard, so make sure to bring a lot of health potions and equip your best weapon.

[u]Trading[/u]
Halfway through the game, you will meet the Collector, an old fisherman and a native of the island. After completing his optional quest, you can trade owl artifacts that you find on the island for very useful weapons and recipes.

There are a few gameplay aspects that I didnâ€™t like; you canâ€™t break windows, there are no weapon stats, and the recovery time after dealing a heavy attack is very slow. I also felt that the achievements werenâ€™t enough, as they could easily add more to increase the total playtime of the game, but thatâ€™s just a minor issue.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The game looks stunning; the island itself is just so beautiful and feels alive, from wide open grassy fields to dark and claustrophobic mines. I just love how the foliage is interactable, how trees sway in the wind, wildlife wandering the forests and hearing the mountain breeze when climbing towards the top.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2196744777

[h1]Technical[/h1]
[u] Laptop: Omen HP 17t, GTX 1070, Intel I7-7700HQ, 16 GB RAM, Windows 10 Home[/u]
The game is not very polished, as I experienced a few FPS drops when I visited the military base and stuttered a few times while traversing through the landscape. I also ran into some minor bugs and glitches, such as dropped items floated in the air, enemies froze in place, unlimited stamina and glitched walls. 

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
The soundtrack is pretty good, as it starts with a cool rock song in the main menu. Suspense music plays during suspense moments, adrenaline-pumping music during platforming sessions (oddly similar to [i]Dying Light[/i]) and boss fights, and light melancholy ambiance while traversing the island

[h2]Additional Details:[/h2]
[table]
[tr]
[td]Total playtime[/td]
[td]16 hours (100% completion)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Recommended difficulty[/td]
[td]Adventure, then survival[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]M&K or Controller[/td]
[td]M&K is preferable[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Offline mode[/td]
[td]Yes[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Achievements[/td]
[td]Yes[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Trading cards[/td]
[td]Yes[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Games Saves[/td]
[td]Automatically and Manually[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
It took me about 16 hours to complete the story and earn all the achievements. This is a decent survival game, Indiegala did a great job and should be commended. Despite some optimization issues and minor bugs, the story is good, the gameplay is intense, the platforming is engaging, and the island is just so beautiful. I definitely recommend this to any fan of the genre. The post-credit scene hints for a sequel, so I canâ€™t wait to see what Indiegala has in store for us.

[h3]Final Rating: 8/10[/h3]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37072886][quote]If you're looking for more quality reviews like this, follow our curator page, [b]Devils in the Detail[/b].[/quote][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198151985314', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1630721331}
review: This is pretty cool. Die Young is an open world survival horror game with great exploration and okay survival elements. The game will have you exploring in a sort of simplified mirrors edge way, and while that may not make sense for the setting, it's used fairly well wherever it can. There are points where you climb up buildings, run away from predators, and make your way along small canyons. The only problem is, is that you won't be finishing this game without the guide. Alot of the time, the game will ask to "find key A" or "Find person A" and no matter how much you look, you won't be able to unfortunately without a guide. So I'd reccomend this if you are experienced with more flawed game design and aren't afraid to use a walkthrough, or to people who are thorough with exploration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075784908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2014, 'last_played': 1597376152}
review:
Liked the game, not quite as survival-oriented as I expected, but it did a good job at keeping me on the watch to find food(water, really) and keep my health bar full.
I understood the idea behind the game, but kinda felt like a right-wing extremist POV of how communism/socialism would be like. 
Not a hard game, but its a long one if you aim to explore and do all the quests - and thats not a bad thing.

La map est grande vaste et le jeux est aucunement rÃ©pÃ©titif, je le conseille vivement. plusieurs armes, un systÃ¨me de craft bien pensÃ©, une rÃ©elle impression d'immersion. et quelques heures de rÃ©flexion pour trouver comment passer certaine difficultÃ©. author: {'steamid': '76561198014477762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1730, 'last_played': 1596344686}
review:
Outright, the game is pretty fun and challenging. 

The story is...utterly ridiculous in terms of whether or not it could happen in real life but it does feel satisfying at the end and you get immersed in the world as you play through it. Ultimately, it feels like you work to get whatever ending that you got. I also feel like I completed the game in a reasonable amount of time as well and that it was well-worth the money (and that's without knowing anything about it going in). It creates great tension and fear throughout. It never feels like you're truly safe even when you are. 

Daphne is fun and you can relate to her character. She's scared. Alone. She's rich but not snobby. She's honest and thoughtful and up against some punishing odds that test her. Her victories feel earned and she grows thicker skin the more you play. I only wish her climbing improved as the game went on, like maybe she starts scared to make jumps or vaults but eventually gets more confident in that regard. But it's a minor thing. 

With that said some of the climbing/vaulting is---well, let's just say no NORMAL non-experienced mountain climber could do what the character does nor would they attempt to either (Daphne has balls of steel). I also like the variety in how the story gets told and that how you act in-game truly does impact the game-play and the story itself. So that's satisfying. 

The stealth in the game works well but if you are bold the combat feels like it works as well. Daphne is strong enough to feel like a threat to the smaller enemies and fragile enough that if you aren't careful they can definitely take you out even on normal difficulty. I also like the upgrades you can find where she can run longer, climb longer etc. Those were nice surprises. 

I really like that there weren't enemies EVERYWHERE. Even in buildings that you would suspect would be full of them. Perhaps it's the lack of them not being there but puts you on edge while you explore because you're expecting enemies to be around every corner. I really liked that. A lot of the time you're running and enjoying the beautiful scenery --- and when an enemy does emerge, you feel a sense of shock and dread; either sneaking by or planning your attack. 

Overall, I'd give it a 8 out of 10. Well done! 

SUGGESTION: 
1) One major suggestion I have is make the Executioner or one of the other Brothers a roamer. Like, someone who roams around the island just hunting survivors. It would be terrifying to be trotting along and then see one of them walking about or spotting you and giving chase for a long period of time (maybe 3x as long as other enemies).

2) Make Daphne build up her climbing skills kind of like in Shadow of the Colossus. The more she climbs and hangs on the stronger her finger-strength gets and the longer she can hang on for or the further she can vault.

3) Slipping off slopes needs to be fixed. Sometimes, I'd be walking on a slight slope and Daph would just slip off and fall to her death. It only happened 3 times or so but that should be looked at. 
*
*
*
******
SPOILER
4) Make Daphne the star of the sequel. Maybe years later on the "new" island as the first test subject for Brother #1's trials. He did seem to be rather fond of her. And a happy ending might be good!
*****
SPOILER
*
*
*
MORE SPOILERS/SUGGESTIONS
1) I do wish some of the characters were less....stuck in place or even alive when I try to find them. I really enjoyed finding out about Abby and was hoping she was alive when I got to her but...unfortunately, she misplaced her footing and smashed her face against the rocks. 

2) The other character I was hoping to save was the guy in the Watchtower. I told him to just wait. One day went by and he hung himself. I was pretty disappointed in that. 

3) I also HATED that Andre killed Dave and basically lied to me. It's like...were both of them just completely irredeemable? I made sure not to give away any locations/whereabouts of the other survivor when talking with them both; cause I suspected giving too much information to one or the other would cause either their deaths or the Brothers finding out where they were. Meh. 
SPOILERS END
*
*
*

review: I like this kind of games, thrown in with no info on what is going on and the player have to find clues and find out what's going on. I won't say anything particular about the ending, but I liked that too, so this was a great experience, I am definitely hoping for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028191914', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1595611888}
review:
This is such an odd game... I would recommend it to certain players, but it's not for everyone. If I can summarize what this game is quickly then it is budget far cry with no guns and survival elements. If you're a fan of games like Far Cry, the Tomb Raider remakes, or survival games you might like this game. It was better than ok so I continued to play it to completion, but there is much wrong with it and certain aspects of the gameplay are shallow. If you like exploration games, give it a shot.
6/10 Get it on a sale

What an absolute waste of MONEY, energy, time and computer hard drive space!!! 
First: This game is a HUGE â€œSpin Off" similar to so many games created before it that itâ€™s simply not enjoyable! The creators canâ€™t think of something new so they take an old concept of surviving and escaping while adding a few more things to do like search and craft stuff for survival whoopee do GZZZZZ!...  (in reference to â€œGreen is Hellâ€ and others)
Second: There is so many BUGs and Glitches Example: you "Hoover for a few seconds before falling to your DEATH at the first tower... You can almost predict when the game is going to â€œCRASHâ€.  
Third: Good luck trying to contact anyone for support to try to get the game working, No response!!!! After the game crash you will be asked to â€œReport Problemâ€ Isn't that what "Beta Testersâ€ do? 
Huge disappointment to what they make it out to be!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047594635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1611396842}
review:
Le jeu est excellent. Un jeu qui prend le risque de mÃ©langer plusieurs genre comme l'horreur psychologique, le parcours, exploration, ainsi que d'enquÃªte, survie et combat.
HonnÃªtement on ne joue pas au jeu pour la partie survie car celle-ci est quasiment inexistante mais cela pour permettre de mieux profiter de la partie exploration et enquÃªte.
Le jeu brille a mon gout par son histoire extrÃªmement bien lÃ©chÃ©. MÃªme si au dÃ©but l'histoire semble bancal, en avanÃ§ant on se rend compte que l'univers est plausible.
J'aimerai aussi revenir principalement sur pour moi sur les principales critiques faites aux jeux qui me semblent injuste et trompeuse de la rÃ©alitÃ©. DÃ©jÃ  je n'ai constatÃ© quasiment aucun bug exceptÃ© la stamina qui ne descend plus ce qui fait que on ne perd plus d'endurance. (il suffit de mourir ou de utiliser un point de voyage pour que le bug disparaisse). Les phases de saut sont en rÃ©alitÃ© assez simple quand on a pris le coup de main et l'escalade est trÃ¨s simple car le curseur nous indique les sauts rÃ©alisables. Graphiquement le jeu est vraiment beau, je n'ai rien a dire. Bref pour rÃ©sumÃ© un tableau +/- sera plus simple.

Les +:
-Une superbe histoire
-Deux fins possible
-Une ambiance rÃ©ussite
-Un mÃ©lange de mÃ©canisme rÃ©colte/craft intÃ©ressant
-Un systÃ¨me de "tenue' changeant les faÃ§ons d'apprÃ©hender les combats et l'escalade
-Pas mal de quÃªtes secondaires

Les -:
-Les succÃ¨s Steam en partie buggÃ©
-Une musique electro totalement hors sujet dans la montagne qui brise l'immersion
-Les combats de boss assez mÃ©diocre
-Les traductions buggÃ© a certains moment ou pour certains objets

Au final je conclurai par dire que le jeu vaut largement son prix et que le jeu a vraiment Ã©tÃ© soignÃ© par les dÃ©veloppeurs. Enfin si je devais donner une note indicatif de mon apprÃ©ciation global, 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991984890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1595142136}
review:
I am only 4-5 hours in (I did finish the prologue), so it might get better... but I will never know because I can't play this anymore. If you have a LOT of time on your hands and you enjoy aimlessly wandering around this is the game for you. But if you're more about open world survival crafting then IMO For almost the same amount of money the game The Forest is by far a better game, in sort of the same genre, in all aspects of gameplay.

The game is somewhat frustrating:
- The jump mechanic is terrible, you happen to miss jumps because of it, which does damage and worse you need to backtrack through a parkour of artificial jumps.
- The game seemingly can't decide whether it is a survival game, a horror game, a parkour game, an exploration game. There's just too many things mixed. And none of them are well polished. For example the crafting system is very basic, so basic they may as well have dropped it and you wouldn't miss a thing.
- The is no clear goal, sure there is a goal list which is fairly open ended (like this door needs a key), but you have no idea where to go... which could be fun if the map wasn't so crazy terrible and had some markers or so. What is worse is that a lot of things have to be done in a specific order, but the order isn't specified... For example there is a point where you need to get a key, and you can see the key... but to get it you now need to find another item, so now you have to back track all the way to some other unknown.
- The enemies are boring (especially the captives) and all enemies have a radius that as soon as you run out of it they stop following you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975630210', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1594898334}
review:
While the game still isn't 100% polished, it's incredibly fun. I'm going to throw this out to start: I'm not usually a fan of survival games. As someone with bad A.D.D., having to remember what tasks I'm currently trying to accomplish just to not die at any given time makes it incredibly difficult to play survival games with intricate crafting systems and lots of resources to manage. That being said, Die Young may not appeal to the hardcore survival game player. You have only two things to worry about: Thirst, and healing yourself, and neither are too difficult to keep taken care of. The rest of the crafting is for healing items and upgrades to make your life easier.

So survival aspect being simple, what makes the game fun? It's essentially a challenging 3d platformer that clearly has a bit of inspiration from games such as Dark Souls with the level design. You find ways to climb stuff, you open shortcuts to make it easy to get back to where you were at if you fall, and you rest at campfires to save. You also have the ability to craft a 1 use portable campfire for very cheap if you are about to try for a jump you're not sure you can make in one go. This is just the main mechanic of the game that you'll start to get more and more used to and better at. (hint, look down as you take running jumps off of ledges to see when your feet hit the edge)

Now why did it stay fun and interesting to me after 8 hours of exploring and jumping? Because 8 hours in, the game was still introducing new mechanics I hadn't seen. And they did so seemlessly and without throwing in tutorials that broke up the gameplay. Each new mechanic was hinted at with the right level design that just kinda shouts "I bet I can do X here." Fantastic game design there imo.

Finally, the story while a little cliched at this point, still manages to put its own unique feel and spin on the "trapped on an island survival" thing. There is lore to be discovered about what is going on, why you're there, and why this girl has any shot at surviving this situation to be discovered and it's paced wonderfully to make it feel like a reward for making progress and exploring thoroughly. 

Anyways, I've ranted a lot, so I'll just throw out a few cons I noticed that I don't think are by any means enough to really break the experience. The devs are also still updating and polishing the game, so these may be fixed in the future.
-Your hands clip through certain climbing surfaces at times
-The music tends to phase in and out repeatedly in certain areas as if the triggers for it are not entirely set up correctly just yet
-sometimes the ragdoll for killed enemies has some hilarious physics ie. launching rats across rooms, not really a con imo, kinda adds to the fun
-Some of the jumps require exact placement and timing to make, especially for optional side paths, and I could see these getting frustrating for gamers who aren't willing to replay parts several times to overcome the challenge
-It's not always entirely obvious where to go, and depending on your instinct and possibly luck, you could end up backtracking very large portions of the island to find some essential areas you may have missed
-related to the above, the map as far as i can tell, only displays in single segments at a time, making it impossible to look back at everywhere you've been without being in that quadrant of the island. As a result, again you may end up having to backtrack a decent amount to recheck for important things you missed

Overall, despite some flaws, this is one of my favorite indie gems I've picked up in a while. I'm glued to it and I can't wait to see if it becomes even better in the future with updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055458783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1594850115}
review: The prologue was a crap shoot. "Rock simulator 2019." The game itself, wonky at best. Certainly better than their forgotten prologue. But not by much. My biggest struggle was with simply jumping. Purely my only issue was the parkour style jumping this indie game makes you do. 4/5 times you're going to miss that jump you would have made in ANY other game or title on the market. As for the rest of the mechanics, the amount of items you're able to hold at the start is severely limited, to the point where it's almost a joke that it offers so many items for you to pick up. There is not a single way to use the map and look at the entire thing or move around it. The only way to look at different sections of the map is to go to each different part and open that part of the map. Making it essentially useless. I spent the better half of my time dying to jumps than the crappy enemy AI. Animals run the instant they see you, granted having a number of bloody marauders that seemingly kill everything and anything would probably do that to you, it's a simple AI that runs in a straight line away from whichever direction you come. I made a goat jump off a cliff and kill itself. That's how simple. Put simply, until the devs put a TON more work into the game, this overly ambitious project will be just that, overly ambitious.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012593203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1594772616}
review:
J'ai dÃ©cidÃ© de modifier mon avis aprÃ¨s avoir terminÃ© le jeu, pour une critique plus globale et objective. 
J'ai postÃ© mon premier avis aprÃ¨s quelques bonnes heures (je dirais une dizaine) et j'Ã©tais assez pessimiste et dÃ©rangÃ©e par ces points :
- ClassÃ© Ã  tort dans la catÃ©gorie des jeux de survie, j'ai d'abord Ã©tÃ© dÃ©Ã§ue de dÃ©couvrir que la gestion faim/soif/froid n'Ã©tait clairement pas un souci dans ce jeu. Mourir de famine relÃ¨verait de l'exploit. D'ailleurs, vous n'avez pas vraiment de jauge de faim ou de soif, mais plutÃ´t une jauge de vie car, que vous buviez ou mangiez, c'est la mÃªme.
C'est donc un jeu d'aventure/exploration qui plante son dÃ©cor dans une Ã®le bien mystÃ©rieuse, pas complÃ¨tement dÃ©serte, mais les quelques habitants non hostiles que vous y trouverez seront suffisamment Ã©tranges pour titiller votre curiositÃ©.
- Ce qui m'a Ã©normÃ©ment dÃ©plu dans ma premiÃ¨re dizaine d'heures de jeu, c'est que l'exploration se transforme vite en parcours d'escalade, avec un gameplay qui tente de se rapprocher de celui des Tomb Raider, mais qui est particuliÃ¨rement laborieux et mal optimisÃ© pour ceux qui jouent Ã  la manette. Je ne compte pas le nombre de Die and Retry que j'ai pu faire pour sauter d'un rocher Ã  un autre, tant il faut calculer son saut au millimÃ¨tre prÃ¨s. Selon moi, c'est le problÃ¨me d'avoir optÃ© pour le FPS. Il faut bondir au bon moment alors qu'on ne voit pas son perso, et parfois, j'ai bien l'impression que pour rÃ©ussir le saut, il faut s'imaginer prendre appui dans le vide (trÃ¨s bizarre).

Bref, j'ai failli abandonner aprÃ¨s ces constatations car l'objectif que j'avais alors demandait tellement d'heures d'escalade que j'ai cru que c'Ã©tait l'objectif final, et que le jeu Ã©tait finalement qu'un simple jeu de plateforme.

Je suis bien contente d'avoir persÃ©vÃ©rÃ©e. Fort heureusement, une fois la montagne gravit, l'histoire continue, et d'autres objectifs vous permettent de reprendre un gameplay moins douloureux, plus axÃ© sur l'exploration, parsemÃ© de quelques combats (assez simples), et la quÃªte de dÃ©couvrir ce qui se cache sur cette Ã®le mystÃ©rieuse reprend son cours.

Niveau craft, cela reste assez restreint. On les dÃ©bloque au fur et Ã  mesure mais ils ne sont pas vraiment trÃ¨s utiles (en gros, des crafts de soins plus amÃ©liorÃ©s, des crafts de munitions dont on a pas forcÃ©ment besoin car on en trouve si on explore avec attention...). Concernant la confrontation avec les personnages hostiles, Ã  partir du moment oÃ¹ vous avez l'arbalÃ¨te, cela ne pose plus trop de problÃ¨mes. Cela le devient cependant vite si vous tombez sur plusieurs hostiles en mÃªme temps. LÃ  encore, le gameplay n'est pas trÃ¨s opti, mais il semble de toute faÃ§on que l'action n'est pas le parti pris de ce jeu. La discrÃ©tion et l'infiltration seront souvent les meilleures (voire les seules) options.

Dans l'ensemble, le mot que je choisirais pour qualifier ce jeu : dÃ©sÃ©quilibre.
Si les diffÃ©rentes phases de jeu Ã©taient un peu mieux dispersÃ©es au fil de l'histoire, il pourrait Ãªtre un jeu excellentissime. On retrouve ce dÃ©sÃ©quilibre Ã©galement dans le Sound design : certains dialogues mal jouÃ©s, une ambiance sonore plutÃ´t simple et chouette, mais dÃ©valuÃ©e par une musique horrible au synthÃ© (faÃ§on annÃ©es 80) complÃ¨tement dÃ©calÃ©e qui dÃ©barque de temps en temps au fil de l'explo, on ne sait pas pourquoi...

L'aventure vaut tout de mÃªme le coup d'Ãªtre vÃ©cue. Une belle durÃ©e de vie (je dirais une vingtaine d'heures, si on retire mes Ã©checs de sauts Ã  mon compteur... hihi...) et j'ai apprÃ©ciÃ© le lore, l'ambiance, le dÃ©cor, et l'exploration calme et douce de cette Ã®le, qui rÃ©vÃ©lera son secret aux plus patients.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019578071', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1594155395}
review:
Kicsit sajnalom ezt a jatekot, mert rengeteg potenciallal rendelkezett, de vegul kisiklott es egy kozepszeru alkotast kapunk. 
A [b]TORTENT[/b] klises, itt nincs nagy meglepetes. Rossz szigetre erkeztek te egy dogkutban tersz magadhoz es fel kell gonygoliteni, mi folyik a szigeten es mi tortent veletek.
A [b]GRAFIKA[/b] igazabol hullamzo, a kozepes es a gyenge kozott. Meg indie szinteren is talalni jobbat/szebbet/kidolgozottabbat, de a celnak megfelel.
A [b]ZENE/HANGOK[/b] tulajdonkepp mukodnek, teszik a dolgukat semmi olyan, hogy szaladnek es LOOPban progetnem a Youtube-on.

A [b]NEGATIVUM[/b]:
- Rettenetesen zavart a mozgas es mivel ez egy ugralos/maszos jatek alapvetoen (ertsd ugy a 85%ban) pont ez a resze a legfajobb. Sokszor fogalmam nincs miert nem ugrik, ha ugrik miert, akkorat. Volt, hogy 42x ugrottam el meghaltam, aztan valami csoda folytan 43x elkapta es tovabb tudtam haladni. Nagyon frusztralo.
- a szerencsere harcolni sokat nem kell, amit kell az vegulis mukodik, de alternativakent ott lenne a lopakodas, de felesleges egyszerubb mindent agyonverni/agyonloni.
- Van benne crafing, de teljesen haszontalan. Tudod Upgradelni pl. a hatizsakod vagy legyartni fegyvereket, de annyira ritkan volt, hogy kellett, hogy total felesleges (maximum a mobil mento allas miatt).
- Van benne survival, ami kimerul az ivasban(sosem szomjaztam fogalmam sincs mi tortenik, de kb fizikai keptelenseg szomjazni...). Enni azert kell, hogy toltsd a HPd, de ez kb 15 meterenkent elszort bokor boven megfelel igazabol.
- a terkep teljesen hasznalhataltan

Nagyon sajnalom ezt a jatekot, egy leertekeles kereteben egy 10-12 orara nyujt egy "gazdasagos" mirrors edge filinget es el lehet vele lenni, mert a sztori bar klieses, attol meg magaval tud ragadni(van 2 fele befejezes). Annyira keves kellett volna, de sajnos nem tudom pozitivra ertekelni.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979438474', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1593390500}
review:
This one's a lot of fun.

Die Young is an open-world parkour adventure game. Contrary to some expectations, it's not a survival game. There is certainly crafting/scavenging for items, but you'll never be desperately managing different meters or building structures.  It's hard to compare this to another game--it's not really the survival game it might appear from the outside. The game 'Miasmata' is the closest parallel. The fluid system of movement pared with rewarding exploration is the standout gameplay feature

Kidnapped on a Mediterranean island and left for dead, you must overcome the island's challenges and escape. The island is huge, full of varied environments and secrets. Above all, a fast-paced parkour style of gameplay pervades. You'll be doing plenty of running, jumping, and even climbing. At times, you will climb to stomach-churning heights that I've never experienced before in a game. Often, you'll make death-defying leaps that'll leave you on the edge of your seat. There were a few times when I thought the system wasn't consistent, but I realized it was mostly my failing (stamina recovers quickly, but don't start a climb on low stamina!). A handy cursor icon always indicates where a surface is safe to climb.

As I journeyed over mountains and through dark caves, a fun little story emerged. There's some twisted things happening on the island, and as long as you don't try to analyze it too seriously, it should keep you motivated. 

By the game's end, I had gone from being lost and confused in a strange land to feeling like the master of the island. The was exactly the title I was hoping it would be, and despite some jankiness and a number of strange crashes in the final third of the game, I was strongly motivated to finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969417125', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 378, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1593025821}
review:
Die Young is an open world survival game played from a first person perspective. The player controls a young girl called Daphne who has been kidnapped by a strange cult while visiting a mysterious island with her friends.

Your goal is simply to escape the island, although to begin with its not really clear how youâ€™ll achieve this, so all you can do is explore the island and try to figure out what to do. Thankfully youâ€™ve been given a map indicating a few locations of interest, which gives you a starting point.

Travelling around the island often involves jumping puzzles similar to a Tomb Raider game, whether its climbing up rock formations and jumping across narrow ledges while trying to avoid falling and breaking your legs, or just climbing up the side of a building whose door is locked, to enter through an upper floor window.

The island is a dangerous place. As well as cult members armed with melee weapons or crossbows, and the occasional large guy with a massive axe, youâ€™ll also encounter wildlife such as dogs, wolves, boars and snakes. You can sneak past enemies by crouching through long grass or by taking another path through the environment, or fight them using weapons like a knife, wrench, and crowbar.

Melee combat feels a bit janky and fighting more than one enemy simultaneously is tough, but as soon as you find your own crossbow, the combat becomes much easier. The AI is pretty dumb and I found that as long as the enemies didnâ€™t see where I was shooting from, I could pick them off one at a time with silent headshots while they stood around looking confused. 

Thereâ€™s some basic crafting, using scrap metal and wood to make new weapons (they eventually break after repeated use) and collecting plants to make healing items. You can also craft upgrades to your inventory size, and can keep spare items in Resident Evil style storage boxes that can be accessed from multiple places around the island. You need to drink water fairly regularly to avoid dying of thirst, but there are plenty of water sources around the island so its not a big problem.

In addition to the main quest to escape the island, there are a few side quests to find out what happened to some other kidnap victims, or to help some friendly NPCs, and if you explore the island thoroughly youâ€™ll find special items like canteens to store extra water, or clothing which gives bonuses such as improving stamina or reducing fall damage.

It took me 20 hours to finish the game. The story has multiple endings depending on how you choose to deal with a late game quest, but unfortunately the dialogue and voice acting is mostly terrible. Controls are fully rebindable and work well with mouse and keyboard, I didnâ€™t have any problems with framerate but I did encounter a few bugs. Nothing game breaking, just weird stuff like corpses spawning in mid air and falling to the floor, when I returned to areas Iâ€™d previously cleared.

Thereâ€™s a separate prologue where you play as a different character. Its much more combat focused than the main game, which is not really a good thing. Thankfully it only takes a couple of hours to finish but it doesnâ€™t really add anything to the story so honestly you could skip it.

I mostly enjoyed playing Die Young, its a bit rough around the edges in places, but exploring the island and gradually piecing together what you need to do is fun, and it kind of feels like youâ€™re the protagonist of a horror slasher movie. Iâ€™d recommend buying it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330818404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1614945094}
review:
Die Young is a Zelda-like Experience - The Game-Genre and the way of the free choices what to do next and to build up your experience is like Adventure of Link or Breath of the Wild but with more Violence and Gore due to the theme. The 1st few Minutes, that actually are very important for a Game, it is starting less powerful with a few weak points like the Animations of the Animals and little other stuff. But if you think it was a small Team and what they realized with this Game -Respect!

I just say: Stay on it, and you will discover a very captivating experience when finding out more what is going on on this Island, when you get stronger by better crafting-recipes and developinng from the running Daphne to become the Hunter later...

For the Record, my first impression of the Game:
It is good so far. Other than the Prologue this goes into Exploration, but what doesn't mean you havn't still the Terror chasing you :D ... I will write a complete Review after i finish the Game.

Le scene di parkour/arrampicata sono ben studiate anche se certi salti li trovato davvero impossibili,
La difficoltÃ  Ã¨ un punto debole si passa da nemici stupidi come i sassi a boss che ti arano con un colpo e che per abbatterli bisogna avvalersi di qualche arma divina data la loro costituzione assolutamente non bilanciata,l'ho giocato a normale ed Ã¨ stata dura finirlo non oso pensare a sopravvivenza come sia.
I problemi maggiori tuttora sono sulla ottimizzazione, passi da aree che sta sui  120fps e oltre ad altre sui 30 e inferiori senza neanche reali motivi apparenti Ã¨ inutile se volete giocarlo al massimo vi servirÃ  un hardware potente,allo stato attuale non mi sento di consigliarlo al 100% diciamo di provarlo a piccole dosi nel caso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322695895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1610832992}
review:
Das beste Spiel des Jahres ! Mit Indie hat das eigentlich nichts zu tun , das ist ein AAA Titel ! Denn Grafik , Spielumfang , Story , ist erstklassig ! Besonders empfehlenswert ist Die Young fÃ¼r Spieler die sich Zeit nehmen und denen es SpaÃŸ macht eine offene Spielwelt zu entdecken . Man muÃŸ alles einsammeln was man findet , das herstellen von AusrÃ¼stung ist aber angenehm unkompliziert . Hat man erst eine Armbrust erbeutet wird man vom Gejagten zum JÃ¤ger . Das Spiel ist wie eine Mischung aus FARCRY ( sonnige Insel mit dunklem Geheimnis ) und TOMB RAIDER ( klettern und entdecken ) . Sehr gut finde ich auch , das man den Schwierigkeitsgrad in verschiedenen Punkten sehr individuell anpassen kann . 
Und wenn ich jetzt so nachdenke fÃ¤llt mir absolut nichts Negatives zu dem Spiel ein , es ist einfach perfekt !

review:
Fun to play, good game mechanics/ideas. Just some of the jumps are pretty tuff, same goes for some fights.
Sadly it crashed a few times and some of the achievements wasnÂ´t unlocked, seeking for keys can be pain and i expierienced heavy performance losses, when using the lighter. But overall a nice Game with some potential. Maybe give it a shot. Prepare for some fun and falling to death on parcour routes. :) Oh and it has crowbar n crossbow, whatelse could someone need to survive this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048786713', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1952, 'last_played': 1629511833}
review: Absolutely adore this game, if you love story heavy games that have a bit of a survival  aspect (like any of the Lost in Blue series), play this! It's wonderful, far better then The Forest. I have tried to play the forest 4x and have never been able to get into it, I have however played this game twice through. So I suppose it's what you are into game-wise.  If you enjoy survivor style games that give you a heavy dose of lore/story. This is it. If that's not your jam and you prefer base building go play subnautica or anno. Both good games of course but to me not super story-based.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026863328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1654138635}
review:
Upfront Disclaimer: Don't go into this expecting a AAA-quality, Cinematic movie-level experience. If you accept it as something more along the lines of a Mid-Level/Indie Studio offering, you'll have a better time, and may even be pleasantly surprised.

It's best to think of Die Young as sort of a "Wilderness Exploration/Hiking Game, with Survival Elements". The Crafting options are limited pretty much entirely to Weapons/Tools, Healing Items, and Inventory/Ingredient Upgrades, but there's still a decent number of recipes to unlock and try out, which are also spaced pretty evenly throughout the world and story.
The Hydration Meter is in the game, but in the course of my playthrough, it was never an issue (You CAN, however, adjust a variety of difficulty settings to make things like Stamina, Health, Hydration, etc., change slower or faster - so if you really want to make the game hellishly hard in that way, you can probably do so.)

It's a weird comparison, but this game is sort of like a hybrid of Far Cry 1, and Gone Home - a lot of focus is on the atmosphere and exploring a variety of places (Old Houses, Ancient Ruins, a Dilapidated Mine, several ramshackle towers, and quite a few more), with wilderness hiking and material gathering spaced in-between. The story is mostly presented through documents and papers you find scattered around the important locations, and helps to flesh out what is otherwise a fairly bare-bones story. (Aside from some odd voice-acting and writing, the story itself is pretty serviceable.)

This game also places a lot of importance on the climbing mechanics - you will be climbing, hanging from thin ledges, and sprinting to get enough momentum to try to jump across gaps. A lot. And you will probably fall and die. A lot. But some of these climbing areas are definitely the high-points of this game. (Pun not intended). Without spoilers, the halfway point of the game is by far the best part, with a beast of a climb that is genuinely anxiety-inducing if you're willing to invest yourself into it. The developer could have quite easily made this game just about climbing a single mountain and tower, based off of that section ALONE.

Overall Score: 6/10 (Slightly Above Average)
For the price it is ($19.99 at time of review), I would say it's worth picking up and playing through.

review:
I effin hate this game!
But I would still recomend it for others to try.
Considering it is an indie title I would say that 98% of the game is brilliant.
What ruin the whole game experience for me is the last 2% that is mandatory combat (i.e. bosses) and the combat in this game is the worst I have ever played in any game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091075928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3001, 'last_played': 1589427380}
review: I believe I paid $20 for this gem.  I have beaten both the main game and prologue. (play main game first) and I can say this is a great game.  I enjoyed mostly the intricate story (finding notes and random lore to fill in story plot lines) and the Parkour elements (think dying light), the combat is decent with room to improve (used an Xbox 1 controller). Exploring is the main element, (the game hints where to go, and you have to figure the rest out with clues and Lore you find by exploring around the Island). I loved exploring and finding out the history of this Island we are trapped on.  The landscape is gorgeous and the developers put a lot of love and detail in this unique island. ( I wanted to search every possible place and secret I could find)  I played on the hardest setting, which makes you plan out carefully before attacking anyone and being mindful of where campfires (saving) are. Dodging and blocking need work.  Would say it is a cross between Mirrors edge and Dying Light, with a story "like" The forest.  I can not wait to see what the developers have in store for us on their next title (which is in the works).  $20 is a steal for this game, It took me 50 hours to explore the entire Island and complete the Prologue, answering all the questions I had about this Island, its history and the people who control and inhabit this land.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047523667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1600012208}
review:
Das Spiel fÃ¤ngt gut an, aber irgendwann summieren sich die vielen kleinen schlechten Designentscheidungen zu einem unspielbarer Desaster, daher der Daumen runter.

Nur einige Kleinigkeiten:
- Kletterspiele mit waghalsigen SprÃ¼ngen funktionieren nur gut, wenn man im Zweifelsfall immer vor dem Sprung speichern kann (vertrÃ¤gt sich hier nicht mit dem komischen Speichersystem.)
- Openworld und Quests funktioniert gut nur zusammen, wenn man weiÃŸ, wo man hinmuss und wenn man fÃ¼r Quests nicht Ã¼ber die ganze Karte hin und her gescheucht wird
- Ich habe auch nach 11 Stunden keine Armbrust gesfunden, selbst wenn ich zu blÃ¶de zum suchen bin, sollte ich nicht mittlerweile Ã¼ber eine gestolpert sein - dafÃ¼r verstopfen 1000 Pfeile mein Inventar

Zusammengefasst: Das Spiel ist ein typischer Fall von zu viel gewollt und dann ist nach ewigen Early Access wahrscheinlich irgendwann das Geld knapp geworden und es wurde verÃ¶ffentlicht. Schade eigentlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211684145', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1589303274}
review:
I really tried to like this game but I couldn't. The trailers look so cool but doesn't represent my experience very good. The combat is just boring don't even think of buying it for that aspect of gameplay - the main focus of this game is climbing. If you don't like climbing all day stay away. 

You have a huge open world to "explore" and by explore I mean endless amount of climbing. The world looks very beautiful but fails to interact with the player. There is just no points of interest or something like that so you will have a lot of side quests you'll never complete because they are like "find X" with no clue or quest markers that tell you HOW to find it. 

Navigation generally is very hard. You often have no idea where you are and where you need to go. The game fails to make the paths the player should take stand out from the optional paths. You will often come to an area where you have like 5 paths ... and you have to choose which one you go. But none of them look particulary interesting so you choose randomly ... and if you choose wrong it's not like you will end up finding some secrets or a dead end. No you will just walk 10 minutes until you realize it's probably the wrong direction and you have to go back try another path. 

Last but not least the item system is too boring too. I have done a lot of exploring, main and side quests but never found any item that I found to be cool or helpful. 

This review was brought to you by: Bearable Games https://steamcommunity.com/groups/actuallybear

author: {'steamid': '76561198147689590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1588867148}
review: This game is a really interesting adventure, with many survival elements. The fact that you start with basically no info about the territory that surrounds you is very atmospheric and stimulates curiosity, you will have to discover the lore by looking around and finding clues. A thing that i hope will be modified is the map, it isn't helpful at all, it shows only fragments of the locations you visited and considering that navigation is quite fundamental in this game, I think it's a rather sore note.

author: {'steamid': '76561198961727738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1672170706}
review:
8 / 10
GOODS
--- For the most part, very adventurous survival game, really good use of parkour elements, most of the environments are good, and the parkour sections in the first half are well thought-out (especially the ascent to the High Tower).
--- Probably best played by messing around and getting people and animals to chase you through the environments (and you can throw molotovs at them), it can be good fun. You can also do the stealth approach if running low on health and resources.
--- Really good graphics, decent soundtrack, and serviceable sound effects.

MIXED FEELINGS
--- First half of the gameplay is really good, but second half was only okay, the environmental designs and parkour elements are not as well thought-out (probably budgetary issues).
--- Perception button seems to make the game too easy for me. I recommend disabling it for the challenge. Shouldâ€™ve been a craftable item instead.
--- Pfft, final boss for some reason is f**kin tough to kill, this guy has so much health XDâ€¦ I did finally beat him and his buddies in the end, but it took some time.

FLAWS
--- Whole game on Hard mode is probably too easy once you have a crossbow, you can take out regular enemies no problem, the tougher enemies are not seen in the second half, and I donâ€™t think there is enough enemies throughout.
--- Minor presentation flaws and technical bugs in the details.

I think the game would've been a mega-classic, but partly because of budgetary reasons and partly by design, it's only a good game as it is. Ideas of improvements include awkward situations in the parkour moments such as if there were sniping enemies during the ascent to the High Tower, and with some additional weapons like a machete or a throw-able harpoon that kills bigger enemies. Maybe updated patches would help. Though hints of a sequel are there, so hopefully something better can come out.
As it is, I enjoyed the game enough to consider replaying it eventually. First half of the game up to the point of completing the High Tower location I thought was really enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025879493', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1667296722}
review:
[h1][b]Warnung: Ich war nicht weit davon entfernt [u]keine[/u] Empfehlng fÃ¼r [i]Die Young[/i] auszusprechen - weil der finale Bosskampf ein absoluter SpaÃŸkiller ist. Selten kommt es vor, dass ein Spiel in letzter Minute noch einen solch negativen Eindruck hinterlÃ¤sst. Dass das in kaum einer anderen Bewertung erwÃ¤hnt wird, ist in meinen Augen schockierend.[/b][/h1]

Aber erst mal langsam und von vorne: Was genau ist [i]Die Young[/i] Ã¼berhaupt?

[h1]Geschichte[/h1]

Man schlÃ¼pft in die Rolle von [i]Daphne[/i], die mit einigen Freunden einen Urlaub auf einer abgelegenen, aber idyllischen Insel vor der tÃ¼rkischen KÃ¼ste verbringen mÃ¶chte. Der Urlaub beginnt aber alles andere als geplant und [i]Daphne[/i] wacht mit Kopfschmerzen in einem alten Brunnenschacht wieder auf. Von ihren Freunden findet sich jedoch keine Spur und sehr schnell stellt sich heraus, dass die idyllische Insel ein dÃ¼steres Geheimnis birgt und es um Leben und Tod geht.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Das Gameplay erinnert im Kern an Spiele wie [i]Mirror's Edge[/i] oder [i]Dying Light[/i]. [i]Daphne[/i] rennt, springt und klettert durch die Spielwelt, um Hindernisse zu Ã¼berwinden, GegenstÃ¤nde zu finden und die Story voranzutreiben. Geeignete Objekte in der Umgebung sind dabei regelmÃ¤ÃŸig mit einer weiÃŸen oder grÃ¼nen Markierung versehen, damit man selbst beim Sprinten erkennen kann, wo es weitergeht. Allerdings kommt es leider immer wieder mal vor, dass [i]Daphne[/i] eine Kante nicht greift und dann abstÃ¼rzt - nicht hÃ¤ufig, aber oft genug, dass es auffÃ¤llt. GlÃ¼cklicherweise gibt es reichlich Speicherpunkte in der Form von Lagerfeuern, die in der Spielwelt verstreut zu finden sind. Alternativ kann man selbst zu einem beliebigen Zeitpunkt eines herstellen, wenn man etwas Holz bei sich trÃ¤gt.

Neben dem flotten Parkour-Gameplay gibt es auch noch einige Mechaniken aus Survival-Spielen. So muss man regelmÃ¤ÃŸig Wasserquellen finden, um nicht einen Hitzeschlag zu erleiden und viele nÃ¼tzliche GegenstÃ¤nde wie SchraubenschlÃ¼ssel kann man aus rudimentÃ¤ren Materialien herstellen. Auch kann man seine AusrÃ¼stung verbessern in dem man Tiere jagt und deren HÃ¤ute sammelt. GlÃ¼cklicherweise nehmen diese Mechaniken aber nicht alles Rampenlicht fÃ¼r sich, sondern sind nur als sinnvolles Extra am Rande vorhanden, ohne jemals zu nerven.

Die bereits erwÃ¤hnten GegenstÃ¤nde fungieren in ihrem Nutzen als Waffe allerdings auch als essenzielle Werkzeuge, um in der Spielwelt voranzukommen. Mit einer Brechstange kann man beispielsweise SchlÃ¶sser aufbrechen, mit einem Messer ein Seil durchschneiden oder mit einer Schaufel einen Schatz ausgraben.

Es gibt auch einige feindlich gesinnte Figuren auf der Insel, allerdings sind diese meist verstreut und kÃ¶nnen (und sollten auch) einfach umgangen werden. Dazu kann man sich in Ansammlungen von StrÃ¤uchern oder hohem Gras verstecken und wird dann fÃ¼r Feinde unsichtbar. Auf Tastendruck kann [i]Daphne[/i] dann auch eine Art "SpÃ¼rhundmodus" aktivieren, bei dem alle Feinde in der NÃ¤he als rote Umrisse sichtbar werden - dazu darf man sich allerdings nicht bewegen.

Ein in meinen Augen sehr positiver Aspekt ist das sehr minimalistische HUD. Zu jedem Zeitpunkt hat man alle relevanten Infos auf dem Bildschirm wie etwa Lebenspunkte und WasservorrÃ¤te. Gleichzeitig wird man aber nicht dauerhaft von einem Missionsmarker in der Ferne zum nÃ¤chsten Missionsziel gelotst wie ein Esel mit der Karotte vor der Nase. Alle nÃ¶tigen Infos finden sich in der Form von Briefen und Notizen im Inventar und es ist leicht mÃ¶glich essenzielle Punkte von Interesse in der Spielwelt zu identifizieren. Trotzdem muss ich auch an dieser Stelle das Design der Weltkarte kritisieren: Man kann immer nur einen kleineren, statischen Ausschnitt der nÃ¤heren Umgebung sehen, aber es gibt keine MÃ¶glichkeit die Ansicht zu verkleinern und sich alles auf einmal anzuschauen. Diese EinschrÃ¤nkung ist nervig und ich kann nicht zu 100% nachvollziehen, warum genau sie getroffen wurde.

[h1]Grafik und Technik[/h1]

[i]Die Young[/i] basiert auf der [i]Unreal Engine 4[/i] und sieht daher alles in allem sehr solide aus. Trotzdem gibt es definitiv einige Aspekte zu bemÃ¤ngeln, insbesondere bezogen auf die Beleuchtung einiger Bereiche und die QualitÃ¤t von Schatten. So sieht beispielswiese der Keller eines Hauses aus, als wÃ¼rde nach wie vor die Sonne den Raum ausleuchten. Ein Ã¤hnliches PhÃ¤nomen findet sich auch in felsigen Schluchten.

Auch muss ich die zahlreichen AbstÃ¼rze des Spiels erwÃ¤hnen (geschÃ¤tzt 7 oder 8  mal). Ein weiteres markantes Problem stellten fÃ¼r mich einige der vorgerenderten Videosequenzen dar, die ohne Grund entweder komplett Ã¼bersprungen wurden oder ohne Ton abgespielt wurden. Diese kann man immerhin als .mp4 Dateien im Installationsverzeichnis finden und anschauen.

[h1]Bosskampf[/h1]

Keine Sorge, ich verrate keine Spoiler zur Geschichte an dieser Stelle, aber das Design dieser Auseinandersetzung ist geradezu surreal. [i]Daphneâ€˜s[/i] effektivste Verteidigung Ã¼ber das gesamte Spiel hinweg stellte das AbhÃ¤ngen von Feinden dar â€“ und das war durch das Design der Level mÃ¶glich mit gewagten SprÃ¼ngen  und zahlreichen Verstecken auÃŸer Sichtweite. Nur nach genauer Planung kann man Feinde auch im offenen Kampf herausfordern, da sie extrem gefÃ¤hrliche Angriffe haben und Ausdauer (zum Ausweichen und Angreifen) eine rare Ressource ist. Selbst Hunde, die elementarsten Feinde im Spiel, sind in der Lage ordentlich Schaden zu verursachen. Mit der richtigen AusrÃ¼stung kann man seine Chancen verbessern, aber alles in allem sind Gegner tÃ¶dlich.

Im finalen Bosskampf jedoch wird diese MentalitÃ¤t komplett aus dem Fenster geschmissen â€“ man wird in eine Arena gesperrt mit in etwa 4 Hunden, 4 NahkÃ¤mpfern, 4 ArmbrustschÃ¼tzen auf erhÃ¶hten Stellungen und einem riesigen Mann, der ein Koloss aus einer Sage des Altertums sein kÃ¶nnte. Verstecken und AbhÃ¤ngen der Gegner ist unmÃ¶glich, selbst im tiefen Gras der nÃ¤heren Umgebung wird man sofort entdeckt, umzingelt und in StÃ¼cke gerissen.

Ich habe diesen Kampf nur Ã¼berstehen kÃ¶nnen, indem ich eine kleine, fÃ¼r Feinde unerreichbare HÃ¶hle als Versteck genutzt habe, die dazu fÃ¼hrt, dass bei Betreten die KI verrÃ¼cktspielt. Nach dem Beseitigen der lÃ¤stigen SchieÃŸbudenfiguren, muss man sich noch um den Koloss kÃ¼mmern. Ich bin dabei wie ein kopfloses Huhn um eine SÃ¤ule getanzt, um Gegenattacken herauszufordern und dann lÃ¤cherlich wenig vom Lebensbalken des Gegners wegzukratzen â€“ fÃ¼r ganze 15 Minuten. Das hat keinen SpaÃŸ gemacht, war nervig und hat mehr HeilungsgegenstÃ¤nde als Gehirnzellen benÃ¶tigt.

Im Ernst, selbst das offizielle Gameplay Video dieses Kampfes wirkt, als wÃ¼rde der Spieler sich nur mithilfe von Glitches und GlÃ¼ck zum Ende durchschleppen.

[h1][b]Fazit:[/b][/h1]

[i]Die Young[/i] ist alles in allem ein spaÃŸiges Spiel mit einem soliden Gameplay, auch wenn man an den rauen Ecken und Kanten merkt, dass es sich um ein Indie-Spiel mit kleinerem Budget und Team handelt. Besonders negativ anzumerken sind dabei die zahlreichen AbstÃ¼rze und der fast schon komisch schlechte Endkampf. 

Im Sonderangebot vielleicht mal einen Blick wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393825451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1588095282}
review:
I bought it because I`ve read many people comparing this game to The Forest.

Be aware: this has NOTHING to do with the forest. It`s not a survival simulator. You have a linear story and 
quests along the way. If you want something similar to The Forest, stay away from this one and don`t make the same mistake as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806066507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1588389096}
review:
Great game, very fun to play. I did have some problems with it running at times and then chrashing but that was rear and only happend to me when entering new arear like the Stone Pillers and the farm. I do have some problems with the game though that i do wish to be adress at least in the next game. 
My biggist problem is running out of snakes and thuse running out of poison arrows for the big guys. All other reasurse you can get a more of easily but not the poison. Once your out your out. 
My next problem is the big guys healing after they kill you. Not that I died and got sent back to the start of the fight, I mean you almost kill the jack ass and you make a save point then go to finsh him off but he stuns you to death and when you respone he's full heath and those seven poison arrows are gone as well. Good by half of the Islands snakes.
I also have some problems with the Par core but that's more to do with it clipping though the ground and one time a dog that was near by that was pretty funny.
I have other problems with the game but over all I loved the whole game, it gave me a feeling of becoming the tomb raider the whole time. Just wish I could burn down the WOODEN gate that lead to the main town and kill everyone there and kill Brother 1 my self but that's what we got mods for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057433697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1588384638}
review:
Creo que un buen y corto resumen es: [u]Si tomb raider y mirroÂ´s edge tuviesen un hijo, este seria el resultado.[/u] Tiene un nivel de dificultad bastante alto, tanto que al principio puede desesperar, pero con el avance del juego [b]y su mas que decente historia[/b] se va compensando, y de quÃ© manera.

Encarnaremos a Daphne, una joven que junto a su grupo de amigos, deciden hacer ese tÃ­pico viaje en grupo, un viaje que se torna un infierno cuando son secuestrados en una isla del mediterrÃ¡neo y empiezan a "jugar" con ellos. Tu misiÃ³n serÃ¡ reunirte con tus amigos y escapar, pero poco a poco te vas dando cuenta de que no va a ser tan fÃ¡cil y mucho menos cuando no sabes ni quien es tu enemigo realmente, por que sufriras moralmente en varios momentos del "juego" dando lugar a un par de finales.

Un juego no muy reconocido, que sinceramente tenÃ­a de lado en mi biblioteca (lo tenia desde el lanzamiento y decidÃ­ esperar a que estuviese acabado) y me ha flipado. En uno de los finales, aparte de dejarte con el cul* torcido (en el buen sentido) [spoiler]dejan la puerta abierta a una segunda entrega, si es asÃ­, teneis mi compra asegurada!![/spoiler]

Sin duda este es uno de esos casos en los que un juego indie, no tiene nada que envidiar a un AAA. DespuÃ©s de haberlo jugado, entiendo menos que este juego sea tan poco conocido y tenga tan poco cartel...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043075540', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1588542429}
review:
I wanted to recommend this game but it is FULL of bad game design elements and input lag!
Sometimes the character simply IGNORES that I want to run. 
Maybe the 3rd or 4th time I press SHIFT, that is when her mayestic ASS starts to run. 
This is bs big BS.
Sometimes grabbing a ledge won't work and I fall ofc.
The hitbox is way larger than the player or the NPCs meaning I and ofc mostly they can hit me even they aim next to me so it should have been a miss but no it COUNTS.
Animal NPCs mostly dogs and wolves are extremely stupid in combat. For example if I run around them they can't follow me so I can spank their butt easely.
Let's not forget about loading lags, meaning when the game loads a new chunk of the map sometimes the game stops for seconds. Also lag can happen in combat. Which is horrible.
Talking about atmosphere. Sometimes the ambient noise goes off, have no idea why.
Human NPC animations are ok but the animals are poorly animated. 
Animals can not follow the terrain differences so they are walking in the air (some legs are in the air)
Rabbits are drifting and some animal sounds seems to be taken from a BDSM movie, not from nature.
Only recomend buying the game when it's on sale. (50% min.)
All in all the game could have been a great Tomb Raider+Far Cry mix but the execution is poor, even the story and the atmosphere is good.

PS. The Prologue is one of the worst demo/DLC ever. 
Unstable, auto-save only, wanky enemy movement + all the cons above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242652692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1588097785}
review:
ItÂ´s not bad but itÂ´s not great either. Finding stuff is a pain in this game. Objective A can only be completed by finding a spot which is at the end of objective C. The progression doesenÂ´t fell rewarding when you have to scury around the map like one of the rabbits to find keys. 
Survival is minimal, outside of combat I never felt that i was worried about my health or hydration. Comparing Die Young to the Forest or Green Hell is a joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005301074', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1587954078}
review:
Aloha,

This is my review of Die Young, it is an open world crafting survival game, you play as Daphne, who's main hobbies include, rock climbing, cocaine, clubbing [bars and boyfriends], and having parental problems. She's fragile and even at the later parts of the game, one dude with a few punches can still take you out. So, the game has an excellent atomosphere, bright sunny landscape, contrasted by insane cultist that want to convert you to their religion of "Love and Peace." The game takes place on an creepy island, you have to contend with not just bad guys, but the environment is out to kill you too [thirst, animals, pointy rocks]. The game rewards exploration with all kinds of items, secrets, and there are multiple endings, and a sequel hook too! The game took me 17 hours for the first play through, I don't know if I have another in me for the last two achievements I missed, but I do recommend giving it a play. It is short, sweet, and fun to play.

The Good: I actually enjoyed the main character of the game as probably the best part, she's fun enough to play with and a change from the bland walking Man's-man meat fridge MC from most survival crafting games give you, No matter how well armed you get though, you still are fragile in this game. And because of her inner monologue, you actually feel like you're inside her. Which was quite satisfying. She reacts to disgusted to the horror parade you are met with [mutilated bodies, crazed cultist, torture rooms, etc], and only in the later stages of the game does the dry dead inside sarcasm come through. The graphics are colorful and vibrant, I found my self stopping to admire the beauty of the environment. The controls are very responsive, and there are big parkour and jumping sections, but I didn't find them obnoxious, like in mirrors edge. There are collectables [owls] you can find and trade for different recipes to craft. The story is enjoyable, and really hammers home the isolation on the island. I played this game during the quarantine, so I could relate in a way, not to the cultists or island, but feeling alone, talking only to people through a radio [phone], all that stuff. Maybe that's why I enjoyed it so much. 

The Bad: the music is forgettable and annoying. I would have prefered no music to the crap they put in. The boss battles are VERY difficult as the game trains you to be a puzzle solver, be prepared, learn to block and dodge early in the game, or you will get wrecked by them. Some of the achievements will require multiple plays to get them all if you aren't careful. Daphne and Brother #1's voice actors are great, everyone else are pretty terrible, like Made for TV movie bad.

The Ugly: Getting "Trolled" ... you will know it when you see it. :'(

author: {'steamid': '76561198798520955', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1587926436}
review:
Uno dei migliori indie mai giocati. Veramente bello, super consigliato anche se ci sono ancora un po' di cosine da sistemare (piccoli bug qua e la) la mappa Ã¨ enorme, varia e ben strutturata ma parecchio confusa e certi passaggi non sono immediati. Ottima l'atmosfera che si crea nelle varie aree del gioco. La trama Ã¨ una storia giÃ  vista ma non stanca. Il gameplay Ã¨ ottimo molto scorrevole e personalmente ho fatto fatica a smettere anche solo per un secondo ti tiene incollato allo schermo. 
Ora veniamo alle cose negative oltre la carenza di animazione degli altri personaggi e vari errori dovuti credo al font nei dialoghi e glitch grafici e di hitbox c'Ã¨ una cosa che odierete di questo gioco e sono le bossfight, tutte brutte in particolare quella finale (non voglio fare spoiler), Ã¨ oggettivamente pura merda. Oltre a essere complessa e fin qui ci sta il gioco ha sempre cercato di rendere l'esperienza piÃ¹ realistica possibile, ma Ã¨ anche terribilmente buggata (colpi che arrivano anche se sei dietro ostacoli, problemi di hitbox in arrampicata) ed Ã¨ veramente, veramente lunga. Ad un certo punto ti viene voglia di tornare in dietro e fare altre scelte. Con un po' di pazienza la si riesce a superare per caritÃ  e  nel complesso Ã¨ un bel gioco da sistemare ma vale la pena giocarlo

review:
Mir persÃ¶nlich gefÃ¤llt Die Young schon sehr, ist aber noch nicht so ganz abgerundet. Die Grafik ist in Ordnung und die Kletterei sorgte bei mir (HÃ¶henangst) fÃ¼r nasse HÃ¤nde. Es macht super viel SpaÃŸ die Gegend zu erkunden, um mehr Ã¼ber die HintergrÃ¼nde der Insel und dessen Bewohnern in Erfahrung zu bringen. Das Crafting ist relativ simpel gehalten, geht daher gut von der Hand. An manchen Stellen ertÃ¶nt dann einfach diese Oldschool-Musik, die ich absolut feiere und sogar stehen bleibe, einfach um mir diese etwas lÃ¤nger anzuhÃ¶ren. 

Leider bin ich, ohne mir entsprechendes Material anzuschauen nicht immer weiter gekommen. DIe Wege sind ziemlich verzwickt und es fehlt einem manchmal einfach die Orientierung. Hier weiÃŸ man zwar was zu machen ist, kommt aber ohne an einer gewissen Stelle gewesen zu sein und Gegenstand X eingesammelt zu haben, nicht weiter. Die ControllerunterstÃ¼tzung bzw. Steuerung gefiel mir hier leider nicht so gut. Sie ist einfach nicht ganz on the Point. Switched man hier auf die klassische Maus und Tastatur, rennt das Game aber absolut smooth.

Hoffe auf eine grÃ¶ÃŸere Gegner Vielfalt und weiteren Kontent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089046862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1590176238}
review:
Bueno me encanta, el juego esta muy bien, voy apenas 2hs de juego, y se crasheo, espero no sea algo que pase seguido ya que estaba jugando mientras paso esto, y me perjudica muchisimo ya que debo volver a empezar desde el ultimo punto de control o partida guardada, mas adelante cuento que tal me parecio, pero despues del crahseo, el juego es genial

Edit: 22/05/2020

Termine el juego con sus 3 finales! Una locura, un juego que no es caro y me dio horas de entretenimiento, bastante bien. No volvi a tener crasheos asi que mucho mejor, no note bugs ni nada raro, lo recomiendo muchisimo, mas si esta en oferta!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978463539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1586911012}
review:
[h1]Tl;dr:[/h1] A bit clunky but fun to explore the island.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Large island to explore
[*]Somewhat ineteresting story
[*]Decent graphics
[*]Main character's voice acting was good
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Parkour was more annoying than fun
[*]The map can only be viewed one quadrant at a time
[*]Music would start and end abruptly and some didn't fit the mood
[*]NPC lips don't move
[*]Most NPC voice acting is meh
[*]Final boss was underwhelming
[/list]

[h1]Closing Thoughts:[/h1]

I bought this way back on sale and waited for it to be done. I also tried the prologue which I didn't like so it was surprising that I mostly enjoyed the full game. Some of the level design was way more convoluted than it needed to be but overall, it was fun to explore and uncover things. There are some very light survival elements and multiple endings. It's not bad for an indie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003954429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3745, 'last_played': 1586723678}
review:
I liked the game very much. until the final bossfight. It was horrible. The only way to win was to cheese him for 20 minutes. Wasn't fun at all. Didn't feel satisfied when finally he dropped dead. Kinda ruined the game for me.

Despite the many crashes the other parts of the game was fun and entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193261941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1586727876}
review: Listen I have played this game over 10 hours and it has its fun moments. My issue is the absolutely ridiculous find things for the sake of finding them mechanic. You need A to do B but A is hidden way across the map and does not stand out so blink and you will miss it. They are out in the grassy areas sometimes and you have to rely on notes to tell you where they are. There is no real story except get off the island and roam around forever. Combat is unforgiving and taking on more than one person is not recommended unless you save very frequently. I like the look and I like the parkour style jumping. I don't hate it and I don't love it but I cannot recommend it. I was looking for logical hiding places, a story, and just more overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053705433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1830, 'last_played': 1586666878}
review:
I did actually enjoy this game while figuring out how to play it, however having completed it now and seeing how that ended in addition to a few other issues I don't think I would recommend this game as it is.

This game did give me a good challenge as a whole, which I liked. There were a lot of clever bits that made it enjoyable. I have not played a survival game before, and this one was a good start to get me into the genre.

However there were a few cons that occurred.

If you miss something, it is extremely taxing to backtrack. Save for a few designated areas there is no fast traveling or anything which as a whole makes sense or you wouldn't have to explore. However if you were to miss a clue or a key, going on a hunt for it means backtracking miles of multi-layered maps. As a piece of the exploration, your map only updates with water or camp fire locations. There is nothing to indicate where you have been, what is there, really what the terrain is like, and you only get one portion of the map at a time. [spoiler] I for instance missed the key on the crushed logger. I had been in that area, but didn't see him in the mess. I had basically exhausted all avenues trying to find the key myself (thinking that I was done in that area), before googling for help and then having to figure out where the heck that location actually is. [/spoiler]

I was getting ready to wrap up the game and started going through achievements to figure out if there were things I missed. There is one to kill a particular enemy so I went back to take care of him only to find out that after a seemingly random point in the game he is no longer available. There is no reason for this, other than he would be a slightly easier kill with late-game equipment. So now I am missing one achievement that honestly wouldn't be all that hard to complete, but it isn't worth starting a new game just because he disappeared from this one.

One of the routes to completion also has essentially a final boss fight, which doesn't entirely fit. I feel a large portion of the game was the exploration and being sneaky. The character is not really a fighter and would easily be overwhelmed if you decided to hack and slash through the game, particularly in some of the late-game bases. But for this boss fight you are pitted against a team of melee and ranged opponents, a few dogs, and a monstrosity of a man who is even more complicated to kill than the one I mentioned in the achievement I missed. All for a character that really isn't made to fight. The only things I have read or heard about were basically people outsmarting the AI to take pot shots and kill them all which is what I did as well.

There are also little things that take away from the immersion. On one hand you can take a leap across a whole chasm or from a small, finger tip ledge up to another. And on the other hand there are times when she can't jump high enough for a ledge because you didn't do it in just the right spot or the dev didn't want you climbing there so she takes this little bunny hop and that's it.

While this game is made for exploring, there are at least two conversations I can think of that if you don't grill the person you're talking to, you miss out on huge pieces of the game. My first run through I did not contact [spoiler] Ibrahim's men [/spoiler] and I didn't actually utilize [spoiler] The Collector [/spoiler] until my game was basically over because unless you act ungrateful for your gift he doesn't mention anything else.

Overall it was a decent game, but there are just some really odd loopholes that were apparent near the end that really kind of killed it for me.
