author: {'steamid': '76561197970897072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1586927165}
review:
I purchased this during a sale for $10. You get 2 games, one is labeled as the Prolog. I started with the Prolog, where  it is described as a vacation on an island gone wrong. You start out in a sewer system, looking for a away out and off the island, picking up items, crafting basic stuff, and being tutored with mechanics. The game looks pretty, built in the Unreal Engine.

However as a â€œcasualâ€ player I disliked the save mechanism, which is sparsely placed camp fires. After communicating with the responsive developers, I was informed that the main game (same premise, nightmare vacation ) in Adventure Mode includes the ability to craft campfires with the sole purpose of saving the game. Curiously, crafting a campfire does not create a campfire in the world, where as a real campfire allows you to cook  meat, Maybe since the game is in early access, this feature will be added in the future where crafting a campfire, actually creates one. I have not yet figured out how to harvest meat. A knife does not seem to do that. Iâ€™ll go research this online at the gameâ€™s wiki. ;)

So, after switching over to the main game, which allows the player to craft â€œsave campfiresâ€ and locating the difficulty settings under Options, allowing me to increase my stamina, strength, and hydration (even after the game has been started) this has turned the game around for me for the better.  Iâ€™m not going from full hydration to empty in 40 minutes of game play. I can save a game at a time of my choosing without too much effort. With a heavy wrench (found In the vicinity of a broken water pump), a knife I found sticking out of a dead dog, or a home made knife, I can reasonably expect to  emerge from a dog fight reasonably uninjured. Exploration is fun and Iâ€™m enjoying the game. 

Of note:
* The game encourages exploration, youâ€™ll find things of interest, and supplies, items. When you are no longer so worried about dehydration, you can more enjoy your surroundings even under the circumstances. ;) 
* The game guides you with objectives, frequently found by way of notes written by people in the game. 
* It  has a fun climbing mechanism like Tomb Raider or The Climb, with a fatigue element, easy to execute.
* There is a perception mechanism that highlights significant objects, people, and animals, making it easier to navigate the landscape.
* Crouching is sneaking, always helpful, especially in tall grass or crops.
* Being able to fine tune the difficulty level for personal preference makes all the difference in enjoyability
* Combat with other than the big sickle hulks, is doable, and makes you feel good about your combat prowess. At least you no longer feel like a weakling, if you have modified the difficulty settings like I did. ;) 
* Most buildings, if they canâ€™t be accessed via a door or window, can be climbed. Look around for a way up. 
* I canâ€™t say how much replay ability the game has. Once youâ€™ve seen and explored an area, youâ€™ve seen it. I suppose you could go back and see what you missed, but at the current price, this would not stop me from purchasing it.

So, to wrap up, being a relatively new player and not that far into the game, Iâ€™m enjoying it,

author: {'steamid': '76561198123990671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1585946078}
review:
Mhhh... Ich hab zu dem Spiel eine sehr gemischte Meinung. Ich habe es bei einem Youtuber gesehen und dachte: Hey! Das sieht echt gut aus.
Gekauft, Gedownloaded und gestartet. Die ersten EindrÃ¼cke waren wie auch im Gameplay gut.
Nur nach relativ kurzer Zeit (2 Stunden) Ã¼ebrhÃ¤uften sich meine "Tasks" und ich wusste nicht wohin in dieser RIESIGEN MAP?! Ich bin von A nach Y gelaufen und wusste nicht on ich richtig oder falsch war... Ich musste das Gate Ã¶ffnen mit einem SchlÃ¼ssel obwohl nicht gesagt worden ist wo dieser ungefÃ¤hr steckt? Letztlich habe ich einfach das Gate umschwommen und bin weiter und weiter gegangen.. Ich hatte keinen Plan was ich machen sollte. Klar- Ich sollte meine Freunde finden (obwohl die meisten Tot waren bis auf Michael?!) und dann mit denen fliehen. Naja... Am Ende stand ich in der Basis von Brother 3 und habe alles nieder gelegt. Ich bin hoch zum Funkturm und ich brauchte wieder mal einen SchlÃ¼ssel den ich nicht hatte.... Phew... Sehr guter Climbing und Running Simulator aber ansonten kann man das Spiel in die Tonne kloppen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301112203', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2464, 'last_played': 1585761882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024921337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1585716442}
review:
Overall a fairly enjoyable game, up until "Brother 3". I pretty much decided it wasn't worth playing any more. I wish game developers would realize that you don't need a big boss battle to "intensify" the game. I pretty much tapped out because I didn't care enough to fight this boss battle, especially if it was a sign of things to come. 

Overall, this is a realistic 6/10 game. It's like an unrefined Tomb Raider. I think it would have been a 7/10 without the boss battle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009495431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1585744212}
review: In 4 hours of playtime 3 crashes, lost 1 hour of progress so all my will to play this game is lost too
developer_response:
Hi.

Thank you for your feedback. 

We recently introduced a major engine upgrade. 
Could you please send your save game data ( even an early one ) to dieyoungnow@indiegala.com as well as some info on where the crashes occured so we can investigate? We will fix also your save game data if you write us which quest you completed.

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044030124', 'num_games_owned': 2496, 'num_reviews': 577, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1591952136}
review:
I have played the version offered for free on their site and got this for steam, so will explain low time played. I am really surprised how well this game has progressed and happy that it is always being improved, Either a engine upgrade or graphics improvements and bug fixes etc.
Normally I would suggest getting this on a sale but since it has shown some really good improvements and is still being worked on I would say go ahead and pay the asking price..

author: {'steamid': '76561197989686888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1653485069}
review:
Why does a 221MB Die Young game update reserve more than 20GB hard drive space?

After the update is finished, the memory is released again, but with such updates I regularly get "Not enough memory".


Otherwise, the gameplay and the story is quite good, optically it is very nice to look at, what I particularly like is the challenge in close combat, if you e.g. have to fight against several opponents at the same time and partly the puzzles which are not particularly difficult but well done.
______________________________________________________________


Warum reserviert ein 221MB Die Young Spielupdate mehr als 20GB Festplattenspeicher?

Nachdem das Update durch ist, wird der speicher zwar wieder freigegeben aber bei solchen Updates bekomme ich regelmÃ¤ÃŸig "Nicht genug Speicher" angezeigt.


Ansonsten ist das Gameplay und die Story ganz Gut, auch Optisch ist es ganz Nett anzusehen, was mir besonders gefÃ¤llt, ist die Herausforderung im Nahkampf, wenn man z.B. gegen mehrere Gegner gleichzeitig kÃ¤mpfen muss und auch teilweise die RÃ¤tsel die zwar nicht besonders schwer aber Gut gemacht sind.

developer_response:
Hi.

Thank you for your feedback.
Die Young is a big adventure with a lot of text and documents. 
We already fully localized it in 10 different languages, 

but we are a small development team with limited resources and, since most of our translators operate on a voluntary basis, apparently it is not so easy to find Chinese speakers that want to help us with the translation.

If you want to contribute you are welcome.

Best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154910611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1581403274}
review:
This game is really fun. There is a lot of parkour ( which yes I suck at) and theres a lot of things you can learn/discover on the island. Its fun fighting different things, hiding from different enemies, solve puzzles, parkour to the top of buildings. This game kind of has it all. It plays on a strong survival aspect, there even some bosses which was hard but well worth beating.  I honestly would recommend this game to anyone whos into survival and who want to follow a very story driven story.  The story is well made and super interesting, especially when you're dealing with a very crazy cult etc. The Devs for this game are also wonderful. If you ever need help due to bugs etc, they help super fast, im thankful for them helping me fix some issues I had with a few bugs. 

The only negative thing that I can say about the game would be the loading times when you die. But other then that, there isnt much things I can say thats negative about this. There is a lot of running around but they did put in a way to quick travel which is very helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358359808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1524, 'last_played': 1584560613}
review:
I liked it overall. Many pros and many cons.

Pros:
A challenge, takes multiple tries to find the correct way to perform a task
A whole lot to explore
Detailed environment with lots of landmarks
Pretty cool quests/side stories
Good plot, keeps you engaged. Performing certain story lines made me really want to continue and find out more

Cons:
Its quite buggy. I have a good pc but I kept dropping frames for a while. Things became laggy and such
Because of the lag, the parkour in the game really screwed me over a lot
Combat could very much be improved. Seems the devs mainly focused on exploration rather than this
NPCs were lack luster in both their performance and behavior
More creativity with the crafting aspect would've made it a better experience imo. 
Story characters were cheesy and so was their dialogue, especially the main character's. Cringey at times
Even though I stated its level of difficulty a pro, it could have used a bit more direction in the gameplay. Many times I found myself lost, simply just roaming, hoping to find the next portion
Story line moments are not active unless triggered first. This made the exploration a bit annoying. For example, certain dialogue needed to be said before certain items would appear. Going from one side of the map to the other after thinking you've completely explored it became annoying because you wouldn't know that an item spawned. 

In general, I did not like the game at first. Seemed generic but as time went on, I found myself glued to it. Sure, there are some bugs and such but it was a good ride for sure. Very cool elements in it. I do recommend purchasing it on sale though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359988869', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1678966726}
review:
An adventure on an island full of mysteries. Parkour and adrenaline. I like it.
The whole technical aspect of the game development is good. I'd say it's very underrated: I changed the HD and lost the old save file, but starting from the beginning is a pleasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009903018', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 325, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1584456311}
review:
Sorry, this game is not really for me: too much stress about jumping around and very strong enemies.
But it's a decent game, not a great one, not the successor of Tomb Raider, but definetely worth a try.
A 7 out of 10, for me, but non my genre of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156846701', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1583862877}
review:
- The biggest map with the least guidance for things to do and how to do them (not even know how to finish the game)
- The dumbest AI with the easiest sneaking and fighting even in survival difficulty
- Huge limitations on crafting items and carrying things (it's crazy)
- Spent the most time on running and getting lost and eating berries (hardly touch my canned food)
- Trivial gain from a fight so i never picked up one

Money is not the point.
This piece of scrap have ruined my whole night and expectation.
Farewell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010038066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1580142875}
review:
Die young is an ambitious attempt at a lot of things, but ends up doing all of them in a mediocre way. That , in itself, can still make an entertaining game , but for me at least, it wasn't. Why?

CONS

*Most of the time is spent with exploring between 3d platforming sessions , that can extend over hours.
* 3d platforming suffers from the usual problems of the genre , along with occasional invisible walls you jump into and fall to your death. in fact , the great majority of my death stem from those.
* The length of the platforming parts , even if you can unlock shortcuts and return, makes it suffer from poor pacing.  You spend so much time climbing and jumping, that you still have to go on for another half an hour, even after you are fed up with it. once free , you're happy to disregard the main story in favour of exploration - because the main storry will throw yet another hour of platforming at you. 
* The survival aspect of the game boils down to crafting health potions and tonics, and sipping water. But  water is so easy to come by, that i never actually had to make use of the bottles i had. You can also slay animals for leather , which allows you to upgrade your carry limits.
*The difficulty of hunting is a joke. you see something , you run at it and smack it, till it's dead. There's a lot of animals around , and you can outpace most with some persistance.
*The quality of humanoid ai is fairly basic aswell. Enemies may not react to beeing shot from a certain range on , or remain in the vicinity , trying to get to you , as you pelt them with arrows. They do become alert or search for you , if they find a corpse - for a short time. 
*Once you get your hands on an arbalest, you can one-shot most things you encounteron the map. Only boss battles may be challenging.
*The game is set to play uncanny music , when enemies are within a certain radius. however , that radius is way too large , and you may end up spending an hour platforming with no foe in sight - with panic inducing soundtrack in the back, untill it either looses it's effecciency or you get annoyed enough to turn it off entirely.
* The horror aspect of the game doesn't really stick , but maybe it's just me. You are supposed to feel horror at finding certain corpses , but the game never gave the player the time to connect with them - so all the atrocities and brutality you run across happen to strangers. 
*The platforming parts tend to be fairly compact, on top of beeing long. As a result, they start to not only feel frustratingly claustrophobic, but also stale, as you are essentially spending an hour stuck in the same scenery.

Be that as it may.. there are good aspects about this game. 

PROS
* The boss fights can be pretty cleverly designed.
*The world looks quite beautifull and idyllic in many instances. And if you turn off the jaws sountrack playing in the background for no reason again, you can even enjoy the exploration a little. 
* There's many little side-tasks and notices you can find. so it is up to you how deep you want to go into the backstorry of the game's events.
* several instances of finding point A for the MSQ offer you two paths to reach that destination.
* The character's monologues reflect the player's growing disregard for the brutal things they find with further progress into the game. This helps feeling validated. And it's kind of ironic , that they start feeling frustrated , bored , unimpressed and sarcastic after a while , as the player feels pretty much the same. However , the Player should not feel bored, frustrated and detached all the time. 

I really tried to push trough the chewy bits, but i won't be finishing this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981116674', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1841, 'last_played': 1583433789}
review: Reminded me quite a bit of The Forest, with mountaineering replacing spelunking as the main exploratory activity. It's an open world survival action-adventure in a similar vein to the aforementioned (great) game. More subtly creepy than outright horrifying, the combat and AI aren't as strong, and the crafting is much simpler (no shelter building). On the other hand I really liked the world design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054075272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 90, 'playtime_at_review': 3384, 'last_played': 1711646858}
review:
Sono alla mia seconda run e finalmente ho completato ogni achievement possibile in questo titolo e l'ho amato alla follia. Il mondo creato Ã¨ assolutamente mozzafiato e la storia Ã¨ ben dettagliata. 
Qualche contro c'Ã¨ come alcuni bug che ogni tanto costringe a riavviare, il parkour che a volte missa il comando e precipiti nel vuoto, ma togliendo questo Ã¨ stata un'esperienza nuova e diverte.
Mi piacerebbe se venisse aggiunto qualcosa di nuovo nel futuro, da rendere piÃ¹ interessante ancora il titolo.
Consigliatissimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258939169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1581732069}
review: Let me start out by saying this is my first review. i feel i need to let others know about this game if your looking to buy it. Not much a suvival game. Mostly my health and water stays full so far. Pretty sure im not going to finish this game, let me tell you why. First WAY to much climbing. I mean a little is fine, but this is crazy. almost like they couldnt think of how to make it more challenging so they where like, "hey lets add some run and jump climbing to give it the illusion that its more challenging." to me its more of a exploration game with a story. save your money unless its on sale. I paid $20 for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088927184', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1581049096}
review:
Man I never felt so good about hating socialism until I got to BURN SOME MFs with gasoline, shoot them in the face with a crossbow, smash their skull with a wrench, take a breather and heal up with some goods I crafted, and then killed a snake or two to get some poison to stab them with. I mean Die Young practically HAS IT ALL. As a survival horror title, the stress on survival is truly there. As Daphne, extreme sports and camping enthusiast, you're kidnapped after going for an adventure to an island off the coast of Turkey, only to discover your friends are missing, you've been thrown into a well, and the island is populated by what is basically a socialist cult without any coffee shops. Always a bad thing. There's a nice difficulty curve here and eventually it's up to the player to adapt and evolve, but with so much to do, some great challenge, mysteries and story to unearth, parkouring over impossible heights, BEAUTIFUL graphics and views, it's a good one. I didn't get to play earlier versions or the prologue, but the current 1.0 build is solid. I think my only complaint is how ridiculous your running shadow looks, but other than that Die Young is true survival horror and you get to feel the Bern of GASOLINE at the same time whilst killing socialist olive farmers, so that's cool. Got to love the human choices you have to make too. Definitely recommended. You can scope more of my thoughts on the official Deaf Sparrow website here:

https://www.deafsparrow.com/2020/02/07/die-young-socialist-dystopia-survival-horror/

author: {'steamid': '76561198003521846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1581303275}
review: This felt like an open world, low-budget spiritual successor to Mirror's Edge.  I thoroughly enjoyed my play through.  The survival elements are minimal; the major challenge is traversing the environment, and some pretty average combat with sub-par AI near the end of the game.  The real star here I think is the level design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997994663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1613, 'last_played': 1568554030}
review:
[i][b]Die Young: un concept qui fonctionne ! [/b][/i]

--------------------------
Die Young est un jeu indÃ© dont il est facile de voir les inspirations: un monde Ã  explorer avec quelques lÃ©gers Ã©lÃ©ments de survie (craft, gestion de l'endurance), et des phases de plateforme faÃ§on Mirror's Edge.

Ce sera Ã  vous de trouver le moyen d'avancer sur cette Ã®le, oÃ¹ il se passe des choses vraiment pas nettes...
L'histoire est d'ailleurs assez travaillÃ©e pour un jeu de ce calibre, avec du doublage pour les dialogues. il y a aussi plusieurs fins possibles (dont une qui demande d'explorer bien plus de choses).

Au dÃ©but de l'aventure, vous n'aurez rien sur vous et mÃªme s'il est possible de rÃ©cupÃ©rer plus tard une arme trÃ¨s efficace, vos premiers combats se feront avec les moyens du bord.
Certains coins grouillent d'ennemis et comme notre hÃ©roÃ¯ne n'est pas un super-hÃ©ros, Ã©viter la confrontation ou se la jouer infiltration est souvent le plus avisÃ©.
Le cÃ´tÃ© "fragile" est d'ailleurs bien retranscrit, Ã  travers des animations ou le doublage. 

L'avancÃ©e sera rythmÃ©e par quelques classiques "trouver la clÃ©" mais aussi des phases de plateformes qui demanderont observation et endurance. 
Je les ai trouvÃ© rÃ©ussies en gÃ©nÃ©ral, surtout vers la fin du jeu. Sensations garanties ! 

Le monde proposÃ© est vraiment grand pour le coup, et offre pas mal de verticalitÃ©. C'est une des force du jeu, il est assez crÃ©dible et "organique". 
Certaines zones sont franchement rÃ©ussies. (Et une autre a rÃ©ussi a me foutre la frousse, lol x)
Et si vous cherchez bien, il est possible de dÃ©bloquer des raccourcis entre les rÃ©gions - pratique car tout se fait Ã  pied sinon.

Sinon, les petits dÃ©fauts du jeu Ã  relever seraient un manque de clartÃ© dans la navigation / progression Ã  certains endroits, ou peut-Ãªtre l'ambiance sonore, il y a juste quelques pistes musicales. Le reste est fait de sons d'ambiance souvent.

--------------------------
VoilÃ , Die Young fait partie de l'un de ces rares que jeux que j'avais pris en Early Access, et la promesse a Ã©tÃ© tenue.
Les sensations sont excellentes manette en main (il se joue aussi trÃ¨s bien au clavier/souris) et les phases de plateformes sont parfois vertigineuses, littÃ©ralement !

author: {'steamid': '76561197992510187', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1580616895}
review:
This game is incredibly poorly optimized, has some serious performance bugs in critical areas of the game, the animation is a bit wonky at times, its kind of glitchy (several NPCs didn't move their mouth at all when speaking, I had the game crash while resting at least once, and it crashes if you put your machine to sleep), and the interface is not always intuitive.

But it was really fun game play and an engrossing story so I played it to the end and will probably play it again to explore more story paths.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973492128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1597023721}
review:
This game has a really cool premise and I love the idea.  I'm torn about the execution.  After playing for a while I've come to the conclusion that this is not primarily a stealth game.  It is not primarily a parkour game.  It is not even primarily a survival game.  It is, in fact, a jump challenge game.  And on a jump challenge scale of Super Mario Brothers to Turok 2, this game is heavily on the Turok 2 side.  There are ridiculous nonsensical jump pillars everywhere.  And the game mechanics do not favor jump challenges, so plan to die very often as you leap for a far ledge or pillar only to fall just short or slide sideways on the pillar and fall instead of catching it.  I haven't been this mad at a game in a long time.  Rating voice acting on a scale of resident evil 2 (the original) and the new Tomb Raider series, expect resident evil 2.  I'm not sure about the story yet because I'm only three hours in.  Keep in mind that only an hour has passed in the real-time game day, so simple math shows I've wasted two hours dying on jump challenges.  I'm not kidding.  
There are several bugs that are annoying,  For example, if I accidentally or on purpose change the language in the settings, the selection window will never go away and become unusable so I have to click around it to figure out how to start or quit the game without access to the selection buttons I need.  If I succeeded in changing the language I now have to do this in Spanish or some other language I can't read.  I've also had enemies get stuck or AI get wonky.  Stealth mechanics are schizophrenic.
That said, I love the exploration and the graphics, and again, the concept is compelling.   So despite the insanely frustrating, overused, and unnecessary jump challenges that are only there to slow down the progression of the game (and the slow it down a LOT), I keep coming back to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282499566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2771, 'last_played': 1578093002}
review:
This is a solid game with a well designed world, reasonable combat, an interesting story, and no bugs that I can recall. The game took me 46 hours to complete.

I would say that the basic adventure mode was a bit easy and didn't take as much careful planning as say various Far Cry releases. The climbing/jumping mechanics were good.

I wish the game was longer. It is an open world game with a number of "gates" that must be passed to get to the final stages. Now that I've solved all of the problems in the game I'm not inclined to re-play it. This is in contrast to games like Fallout 4 where it is fun to try the game again with different bases and talent build outs or games like The Forest which I never seem to tire of playing because of the base construction and the challenging non-player adversaries.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198127274687', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1578071918}
review: Poor perfomance, crashes and bugs. You have to go to new places to find items and then you have to go back to complete missions, but you never know whether the item is somewhere around and you just fail to find it or if you have to go to the next location. The fighting system sucks, every normal enemy is a one shot kill with the crossbow and bosses are extremly hard and optional. At least story and setting are decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972309532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1673719759}
review:
This game is absolutely fantastic, and I would heartily recommend it. It is one of the real indie gems. Having said that there is one caveat, the final sequence of the game is badly designed and extremely frustrating to the point of probably being unbeatable for lots of players. This is a terrible shame as it will leave a sour last impression of the game. 

Save for this one blemish this is easily one of my favourite games. Perhaps we can see a directors cut to sort out the final challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078401448', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1625341313}
review: Die Young has become one of my all time favorite games. I saw it last holiday season for sale and let it sit in my basket just looking at it as kind of a novelty game at a low price. i was so wrong and should have snatched it up then. The story is amazing as is the game play and the over all immersion. Every step I take in this game forces me to think and move with care. I just can not say enough good things about it. If you love survival games (and by survival I don't mean zombie shooters.. which are shooters) then this is a must have in your library :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971937059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1592125793}
review: Un gioco survival-stealth che si svolge su un'isola dalla ambientazioni tipicamente mediterranee direi tutto sommato ben riuscite, il compito primario tanto per restar fedele alla consuetudine Ã¨ quello di salvare la pelle dai costanti e non troppo assortiti pericoli che l'isola affettuosamente ci riserva, ma attenzione udite, udite il gioco tutto sommato ci viene incontro riservandoci un'IA che gestisce i nostri nemici non troppo votata al razionale ragionamento e alla mediazione ma abbastanza disattenta che spesso potrÃ  essere gabbata con fughe non troppo impegnative e rocambolesche tutto ciÃ² in modalitÃ  adventure... Questo discorso perÃ² cambia in modalitÃ  survival dove quello che ho detto sopra va decisamente ridimensionato, i nemici come detto prima non brilleranno troppo per attenzione e li potremo facilmente seminare, ma il numero e la tipologia di quelli presenti Ã¨ superiore alla mod adventure e di conseguenza in alcuni momenti l'impegno richiesto che dovremo dare per passare i livelli sarÃ  decisamente superiore. Detto ciÃ² l'opinione che mi sono fatto del gioco resta tutto sommato positiva, Die Young mi piace peccato perÃ² che dopo 4 ore non possa andare avanti perchÃ© un fastidioso crash mi impedisce il proseguimento della storia, un problema che spero sarÃ  risolto quanto prima.
developer_response:
Ciao Ultramarine,
ci dispiace per il crash che ti si sta verificando. Puoi darci qualche informazione in piÃ¹ sulle circostanze in cui questo avviene? Puoi contattarci direttamente a dieyoungnow@indiegala.com. Mandaci anche i tuoi salvataggi. Li trovi in C:\Users\[UserName]\AppData\Local\DieYoung\Saved\SaveGames (potresti dover attivare l'opzione "mostra elementi nascosti").

Grazie mille!

AlÃ©m de um mapa enooorme para percorrer e explorar, hÃ¡ vÃ¡rias missÃµes secundÃ¡rias qe podem ser feitas opcionalmente, bem como uma campanha principal cm um caminho certo para seguir e ter desenvolvimento na trama, qe Ã© mto boa e vivenciada melhor lendo os documentos perdidos, observando cada parte do mapa, encontrando sobreviventes e moradores da regiÃ£o, bem como prestando atenÃ§Ã£o nas conversas por rÃ¡dio cm o â€œvilÃ£oâ€, lembrando mto o Bioshock nesse sentido (atÃ© mesmo o personagem qe fala cm vcÃª lembra um pouco do Andrew Ryan em alguns aspectos e opiniÃµes) e com toda certeza vcÃª vai se surpreender mto e qrer ver o que acontece em cada possÃ­vel final, pois todos os trÃªs sÃ£o criativos demais e se adequam com as suas decisÃµes especificamente na Ãºltima parte do jogo. Para quem gosta de aÃ§Ã£o e de luta, Ã© possÃ­vel buscar por equipamentos melhores em partes especÃ­ficas do mapa, como roupas com bÃ´nus importantes, bem como fabricar facas, flechas e molotovs, o que permite atacar e derrotar os oponentes ao invÃ©s de ficar se escondendo (principalmente da metade pro final do jogo); tambÃ©m hÃ¡ trÃªs Bosses opcionais, todos podem ser encontrados em certas regiÃµes do mapa e um deles no final tambÃ©m dependendo de como vcÃª seguir a histÃ³ria, e devo dizer qe os trÃªs sÃ£o bastante difÃ­ceis de vencer, bem desafiadores mesmo com os melhores equipamentos, e Ã© mto legal buscar por diferentes tÃ¡ticas e ir tentando novamente atÃ© descobrir uma maneira mais fÃ¡cil de derrota-los. Outro ponto qe vale destaque Ã© o parkour, qe embora nÃ£o tenha a liberdade de um Dying Light por exemplo, consegue ser melhor no aspecto de praticidade, isso prqÃª vcÃª pode ativar nas opÃ§Ãµes uma â€œmira auxiliarâ€ qe te mostra onde vcÃª pode pular ou escalar enqnto passa por obstÃ¡culos de agilidade, e isso realmente ajuda muito, prqÃª no Dying por exemplo as vezes vcÃª mirava pra pular e segurar em algum lugar e aÃ­ o personagem ia errado ou caia, entÃ£o aqui vcÃª nÃ£o passa por isso como a mira indica qndo vcÃª pode pular certinho no lugar qe deseja sem ter problemas de queda ou de nÃ£o seguir o comando certinho. O que faz o jogo durar bastante Ã© o fator de curiosidade pra saber a surpresa qe te aguarda em cada lugar do mapa, valendo a pena explorar todos os pontos, assim como a busca por recursos para aumentar seu inventÃ¡rio, capacidade de carregar flechas e de guardar mais recursos na bolsa de ingredientes. E para nÃ£o dizer qe foi tudo perfeito, em algumas partes do mapa tive alguns travamentos leves como se estivesse pesado demais, tendo somente certas partes mal otimizadas mas qe nÃ£o atrapalham tanto na jogatina, e o prologue tambÃ©m achei muito difÃ­cil, se vcÃª for jogar nÃ£o desanime, o jogo principal nÃ£o Ã© complicado igual o prÃ³logo, sÃ³ se vcÃª quiser, pois em um Ã© possÃ­vel configurar a dificuldade, no outro nÃ£o (apesar de que ele Ã© totalmente opcional e se vcÃª quiser pular direto pro jogo nÃ£o vai perder nada). Enfim, amei demais e recomendo muito este jogo, tanto pra qm gosta de exploraÃ§Ã£o e de sobrevivÃªncia, como tambÃ©m pra qm qr apenas se aventurar e curtir a histÃ³ria em um open world maravilhoso. Vale muito a pena jogar e o tempo voa de tanto qe ele consegue te prender Ã  tela, e devo admitir qe fiz questÃ£o de platinar de tanto que eu gostei do jogo, levando cerca de 20-30 horas pra obter todas as conquistas. author: {'steamid': '76561198071933268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1575834047}
review:
This is one of the best games I've played all year, it's got meaningful exploration, impressive visuals, nice environmental storytelling and overall a very nice pace that makes you want to explore more of the world. It's also one of the games that I feel does survival right, you don't collect resources to build a random base, you can sprint for quite a long time and you don't get thirsty every 30 seconds.

Pros:
- Interesting story that keeps you engaged.
- Beautiful environments
- Good climbing controls 
- Fitting music
- Good pacing

Cons:
- Fighting can be a bit rough especially at the start
- Snakes, way too many snakes

Overall, I feel this game does a fantastic job with the journey, the sense of exploration and wander, tense moments and the meaningful crafting mechanics. I would recommend it to anyone that might be interested in a personal journey, patient and willing to discover things on their own.

review:
E' un giocone! Se vi piace come Ã¨ impostato The Forest allora vi piacerÃ  anche questo. 
Una bellissima isola molto grande da esplorare.
Attrezzatura, chiavi, ecc.. da trovare per poter proseguire sbloccando man mano varie zone.
Parkour.
Scalate da vertigini.
Misteri.
SINGLE PLAYER!

Nessuno vi dice dove andare. Per trovare la strada giusta bisogna esplorare, andare per logica e intuito.

Lo consiglio assolutamente.
Buon divertimento

author: {'steamid': '76561197961171426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1575252293}
review: Hadn't had a game hold my attention like this for a while.  Wonderfully crafted environment design.  Engaging story that makes you ask "wtf why?!?".  Parkour ranges from easy to challenging.  The game doesn't hand hold which took getting used to.  Middle boss was good fun.  End boss could use a little balancing and as an early access title the game needs some tuning for certain areas graphics-wise (occassional poor framerate/stuttering in later stages of game).  All in all there is a lot going on here.  Chicken Nuggets!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082038951', 'num_games_owned': 1148, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1575226516}
review: Has potential, but a janky climbing system combined with no autosaves means you will more likely be left feeling frustrated more than anything else as you plummet to your death repeatedly. I probably made it about halfway through the game but I just can't bring myself to continue playing any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966795166', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1311, 'last_played': 1631712037}
review:
Je suis plutot mitigÃ©, premiere partie du jeux un petit peux ennuyante , deuxieme partie meilleur ou l'action commence arriver.
C'est un jeux plutot d'aventure car la survie est au minimale dans ce jeux , vous ne serez que tres rarement a court d'eau ou de nourriture , il y a des points d'eau un peu partout et des baies tout les 5 mettres.
Niveau craft cela se rÃ©sume seulement a des armes et amÃ©liorations , aucun systeme de building pour cela que je le qualifierai plus de d'aventure-survie.
Si vous aimez les jeux de parcours vous serez ravis , fan de survie difficile passez votre chemin.

Il y a deux options de difficultÃ© , j'ai choisi la plus dure et le jeux est plutot abordable.

Les plus :

- Plutot Joli meme si cela manque de personnalitÃ©
- Le jeu est tres fluide sauf quelques points qui serons dans la partie nÃ©gative
- Musique plutot cools
- DurÃ©e de vie de 20 heures si vous comptez faire tout voir 25h00 si vous etes lents
- Les diffÃ©rents Brothers font bien flipper

Les moins :

- Il peux arriver que d'un coup le jeu crashe ou que le je se met a grave saccader avec pertes de fps ( obligÃ© de redÃ©mmarer le jeux a chaque fois )
- Boss annecdotiques
- histoire simpliste malgrÃ© les 3 fins
- Aspect survie dÃ©risoire
- Certains endroits du jeu optionnels mais vraiment inutiles sauf pour les succes
- IA horrible  
- Boss de fin completement fumÃ© sur la difficultÃ© 

Pour finir je donnerai ce jeu une note de 14/20.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974892018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1575185607}
review:
I was on the fence about whether to buy this game, but I shouldn't have been.  At 20 dollars, it is an absolute steal.  I feel it's worth twice that, easy.  Die young is an open world game that largely consists of exploring, climbing, stealth, and (later in the game) fighting.  It dumps you into an open world with very little direction and hardly any way to fend for yourself (at first).  The beginning of the game can feel overwhelming because you are way outnumbered and underpowered, but stealth is much easier than you think it will be (enemies have limited FOV and give up pretty easily).  

The climbing mechanics are absolutely fantastic - think mirror's edge, but slightly slower.  The developers have come up with some absolutely fantastic environmental/climbing puzzles, especially late game.  

Combat is the one area where the game is not as polished - its very similar to most first person melee focused combat games - in other words, you are pretty much just wailing on people until they die.  There is a dodge and a block mechanic, but they are not very helpful.  Things improve once you get the crossbow later game.

The island is beautiful, and there are tons of hidden nooks and crannies and side quests to go on while you explore.  I played for 18 hours and experienced nearly everything the game had to offer, but you could probably speed through it in 8-10 if you wanted.  Overall, I'd highly recommend this game to anyone who likes open world/exploration focused games.

Que no te engaÃ±en las etiquetas, ni es un juego de terror ni de supervivencia al estilo de aquellos tÃ­tulos donde nuestra prioridad es huir de enemigos aterradores (el combate es extremadamente fÃ¡cil) o cubrir nuestras necesidades bÃ¡sicas de comida, bebida o inclemencias metereolÃ³gicas (sÃ³lo comerÃ¡s para recuperar salud, ni te acordarÃ¡s del agua y no hay que preocuparse por el frÃ­o o calor mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de por el impacto del equipo en el aguante). [b]Nuestro Ãºnico problema en este juego serÃ¡n los diferentes personajes que nos encontremos y las alturas[/b].

Se nota que nos encontramos ante una obra de bajo presupuesto. La jugabilidad, en ciertos detalles como el combate o la interacciÃ³n con el entorno, no es la que se esperarÃ­a de un buen juego en 2019: el combate se reduce a meter un ballestazo en la cabeza o aporrear a un enemigo mientras le buscas la espalda. Sin embargo, esto no es problema porque los desarrolladores han decidido concentrar su esfuerzo en otros elementos. Como en todo juego, el esfuerzo implica presupuesto, y al ser una obra [i]indie[/i], han decidido priorizar otros aspectos de forma acertada. Desde [i]indiegala[/i] han decidido poner todos sus esfuerzos en ofrecernos una [b]experiencia de exploraciÃ³n con [u]muy ligeros[/u] toques de terror y supervivencia en entorno diurno[/b]. Para ello han invertido, a nivel tÃ©cnico, en el apartado grÃ¡fico, y, en cuanto a la jugabilidad, en el diseÃ±o de los niveles y el modelo de exploraciÃ³n. Remarcando el punto mÃ¡s fuerte de este juego sobre la exploraciÃ³n: no suele haber una Ãºnica ruta para llegar a nuestro objetivo por lo que, a medida que avancemos, nos encontraremos con diferentes caminos que no sabremos si llevan a nuestro objetivo, a una ruta anterior o una zona sin salida, esto parece una tonterÃ­a, pero aÃ±ade una sensaciÃ³n de estar perdido que se echa en falta en muchos videojuegos de exploraciÃ³n. Asimismo, la trama del juego es lo suficientemente llamativa para tenernos enganchados al mismo durante toda su duraciÃ³n, asÃ­ como de querer explorar la isla sÃ³lo para comprender mejor quÃ© estÃ¡ sucediendo realmente allÃ­.

En definitiva, es un [b]juego totalmente recomendado si buscamos un juego de exploraciÃ³n y plataformas con una historia que debemos ir desvelando nosotros mismos[/b], y seremos un poco transigentes con otros elementos de la jugabilidad (combate, interacciÃ³n con el enterno, variedad de enemigos, etc.).

Die Young ist kein perfektes Spiel. Da hakelt Mal die Steuerung, woanders flackert die Grafik so komisch und hier und da findet man sonst kleinere Ungereimtheiten.
Aber gerade Ã¼ber diese diversen Kleinigkeiten schaut man gern drÃ¼ber weg - Die Young fÃ¼hlt sich an wie ein abgerundetes Spielerlebnis und macht ordentlich SpaÃŸ!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992379520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1574809728}
review:
Une trÃ¨s bonne surprise que ce Die Young. Un jeu d'exploration/survie dans un environnement vraiment plaisant.
Alors certes, tout n'est pas rose. L'IA est aux fraises, certaines textures laissent Ã  dÃ©sirer et l'apprÃ©hension des sauts demande un temps d'adaptation. Les rares fois oÃ¹ j'ai Ã©tÃ© bloquÃ© dans le dÃ©core, je m'en suis toujours sorti. Non, le plus rÃ©dhibitoire dans ce jeu en fait c'est la carte. Vous n'en aurez toujours qu'une partie visible, elle est mal foutue et ne se gÃªne pas pour ne jamais se centrer sur vous (des fois votre curseur est carrÃ©ment hors cadre)... Une horreur !
Mis Ã  part cela je dois dire que je ne me suis pas ennuyÃ© une seconde Ã  parcourir cette Ã®le. L'histoire de base n'est pas originale mais les cutscÃ¨nes sont joliment prÃ©sentÃ©es et plus on avance dans le jeu, plus le rÃ©cit gagne en profondeur.
Beaucoup de choses ont Ã©tÃ© pensÃ©es pour nous aider dans notre tÃ¢che.
Le systÃ¨me de craft par exemple est simple et fonctionnel, pas besoin de 10 matÃ©riaux pour crÃ©er ses objets, tout est bien indiquÃ© et rapide Ã  assembler.
Vous pourrez sauvegarder trÃ¨s souvent, aux zones de repos, aux feux de camp, et mÃªme oÃ¹ vous voulez en confectionnant votre propre feux avec des brindilles ramassÃ©es sur votre chemin.
Les combats, ben sur les combats je n'ai trop rien Ã  dire. On va taper avec des bÃ¢tons et tirer Ã  l'arbalÃ¨te. On morfle un peu au corps Ã  corps mais on peut facilement se crafter des soins.
Dans l'ensemble les Ã©nigmes et quÃªtes ne sont pas trop mal foutues. Il faudra parfois avancer dans l'aventure pour atteindre certains objectifs, voir effectuer quelques aller/retour (merci les voyages rapides).
Perso, j'ai kiffÃ© les sÃ©quences d'acrobaties, Ã§a m'a rappelÃ© Far Cry, voir mÃªme les premiers Lara Croft dans les montagnes (j'ai le vertige, mÃªme dans les jeux lol).
Quant aux musiques, ben il doit y en avoir trois ou quatre (celle Ã  la guitare fait partie des sonneries par dÃ©faut de mon tel portable lol) mais bon, Ã§a le fait. Des fois elles apparaissent vous laissant penser que quelque chose va se passer, qu'on arrive dans un endroit dangereux... Et puis non. Bizarre !
De plus les dÃ©veloppeurs sont Ã  l'Ã©coute. Devant un bug qui m'empÃªchait d'avancer, ils m'ont donnÃ© une astuce pour le contourner.
Je m'attendais Ã  un jeu pas fini et contenant sa dose de bugs et j'ai Ã©tÃ© agrÃ©ablement surpris. Et on en a pour son argent. Bon d'accord je ne suis pas du genre sprinter, j'aime prendre mon temps j'avoue. Mais il m'aura tenu en haleine 28 heures tout de mÃªme. Je le recommande donc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038315976', 'num_games_owned': 2281, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1574104269}
review: The Game is good but not so open wold as described cause you need to find items to pass some areas in a more or less linear way. DonÂ´t expect a survival Game like ARK, 7days2die, The Forrest or Savage Lands. This is some sort of Tomb Raider with Dying Light climb and parcour mechanics and some Resident Evilesque Bosses wich beat the crap out of you even if you are equiped well and carry loads of healing items you have to use tactics and sneak. The Area is huge and the grapics are quite good for an Indie Game. The Game entertained me good and is challenging. Try the free Prologue, The Main Game is even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029602249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1574505721}
review:
All in all a really good game, impressive visuals and atmosphere, fun gameplay and good story.
A little confusing sometimes, but that doesn`t really hinder the experience, cause you always want to know what comes next and if you take your time looking around you`ll eventually find a way.
The level design is very impressive (verticality, shortcuts), they did a fantastic job here.
There are a few flaws like no lip movement for the npcs, or mandatory shelter at nighttime.
My Rating: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074749014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1575577330}
review:
Great game
I really had fun playing it.
It is a different type of  survival game. Here there is no building shelter you just have to keep pressing forward. I like it that way.
A lot to explore and a lot to learn about the island and it's people. There is generally a great mixture of surviving, story telling, climbing and fighting with few exception like a certain part where there is just climbing up to the top but since in terms of story it makes sense I say it's acceptable.
Some bugs still exist like getting stuck in a rock when trying to go where developers did not intend to let player go even though from player's perspective it should be accessible. Also, some more optimization would be nice but that can be fixed through future updates.
All in all a great game I enjoy playing and it definitely has my recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172079321', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1573872641}
review:
Como varios dicen, uno de mis descubrimientos del aÃ±o. 
Al principio lo comprÃ© pensando que era un juego survival estilo rust, scum, etc. Pero al jugarlo y ver su historia y jugabilidad me di cuenta que fueron los putos 13 usd mejores gastados (si, el juego cuesta eso y es una locura). Lo desarrollÃ³ IndieGala, una empresa que muchas veces regala videojuegos y tiene buenas ofertas, pero esta vez se pasaron de la raya para bien con el precio.
El juego es un survival con zombies, animales salvajes, enemigos humanos,  armas muy variadas, una muy buena historia, parkour (el parkour hermano, el parkour es increible en este juego), acertijos, recolecciÃ³n de materiales mediante cacerÃ­a o rastrillaje, recolecciÃ³n de pistas y notas,  y una ambientaciÃ³n muy buena. 
El juego no trata simplemente de sobrevivir, sino que, toda la supervivencia debe compensar a las misiones de la historia para lograr el objetivo del juego (Se preguntÃ¡n cual es dicho objetivo, pero serÃ­a un spoiler y le sacarÃ­a la gracia al juego.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198175974851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1812, 'last_played': 1573502753}
review:
Nice exploration game that does not hold your hand, doing sidequests and progressing in the story backgrounds feels rewarding, especially since there are multiple endings. Also some tasks and ways to locations have different possible approaches (even goes as far as being able to on purpose not do what the quest log says) which is nice. And on a sidenote, the music is awesome! Without rushing, it took me 30 hours to 100% this game.

Downsides for me were: Lips are not moving when someone is talking (makes some scenes a bit "ridiculous" and not very immersive) // Combat & AI can be a bit clunky // Sometimes it's not clear if you e.g. missed certain items while exploring that you need to progress or if you will find them way later at a totally different place. Since there is fast travel to get back to old spots a bit faster this was not as bad though, you should be willing to explore and walk / parcour a lot though since this is essential here, while focus on combat is not as much if you are looking for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134221199', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1573310803}
review:
[h1]I have played and finished the game with couple endings. Here is what I want to say about this game very shortly:  [/h1]

Story is bullshit. Really, it is so bad and empty. An island that can never be reached (apperantly not) and a whole forgotten corrupted socialism on that island? And this "secret" community is created by Turkey?! The very country that can't find it's own butt with both hands in broad daylight. So damn nonsense.

Anyway, I bought it to play some survival game, instead it turned out to be heavy parkour game. I'd play Dying Light if I were you if you love parkour games, not this poorly written game.

Even with sale, just avoid it, go watch some gameplays and soothe your curiosity. Because if you buy it, you'll want to complete it and it will cost you ~18 to ~20 hours. And it is boring! You'll only play just to explore stuff but really, there is not much to discover. Same stuff everywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032184657', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1637522615}
review:
Game is not combat focused, so don't buy it for that. It's based around exploring interesting and sometimes spooky locations, and parkour and jumping puzzles. It's not really a survival crafting game, think of it as Far Cry 3 Lite. You've been kidnapped and sent to an island, find your friends and escape. The crafting is there for making healing items and makeshift weapons but not much else. This game definitely scratched my exploration itch and crawling around abandoned Dark Souls towers is fun.

That being said, the game has a lot of bugs with animal spawning, some wonky parkour stuff, and the optimization isn't great, but I'm still enjoying just exploring the island.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979091641', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1572229014}
review: Die Young is a wonderful adventure game which looks and plays similar to Far Cry 3. It has light crafting elements, light combat mechanics, and a heavy emphasis on exploration and parkour. While it does feature combat, Die Young is more of a story-driven adventure than an action-focused shooter that was Far Cry 3. If you take your time, explore as much as possible, and try and complete all in-game quests, you can expect to spend anywhere between 12-20 hours on Die Young's unsettling island world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009392852', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1572026901}
review:
This games fulfills a fantasy I couldn't do IRL just in the title.

Thanks for existing.

review:
Jeu trÃ©s sympa, c'est assez immersif. Il y Ã  quelques bug mais aucun n'entrave la progression. La rejouabilitÃ© est moindre mais heureusement on peux faire toutes les fins en une run tant qu'on oublie pas de sauvegarder sur un slot diffÃ©rend.

Bon par-contre l'IA est au fraise ce qui rend les combats en milieu de game trÃ©s facile/ridicule tend on peux enchainÃ© les headshot a l'arbalÃ¨te en etant cachÃ© dans les hautes herbes. pour les combats au corps a corps le parti pris est clairement de donnÃ© l'avantage au enemies ce qui est trÃ©s bon pour l'imersion survival/horreur surtout en dÃ©but de game.

En 25h je l'ai finit avec tous les succÃ©s donc cotÃ©s durÃ©e de vie cela peux semblÃ© court mais au vue du petit prix et du sÃ©nar qui est a la fois original prenant et nous donne envie d'explorer cette ile malgrÃ©s les dangers c'est honnÃªte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290188920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1572977136}
review:
Ya cuando saliÃ³ como Alpha a principios de 2017 mostrÃ³ unos grÃ¡ficos excelentes y apuntaba maneras, ofreciendo algo que me fascina: terror de dÃ­a. Siendo mi gÃ©nero favorito, es un incordio que en la mayorÃ­a de tÃ­tulos sean tan oscuros que a veces ni siquiera veas nada, aun subiendo el brillo a tope.

En el aspecto survival es bastante light, aunque tienes que comer y beber no cuesta hacerlo. Es un poco como The Forest en el sentido de que tiene su historia, quizÃ¡s en este estÃ¡ mÃ¡s presente que en el otro. Es una historia realmente buena. El mapa es bastante grande pero tiene un sistema de puntos de viaje rÃ¡pido que facilitan mucho las cosas, sobre todo porque hay lugares de difÃ­cil acceso. 

Tiene mucho de parkour y escalada, muy bien implementado, es uno de sus fuertes, si tienes vÃ©rtigo como yo, resulta bastante impresionante. TambiÃ©n tiene sigilo y combate. Puedes craftear herramientas, armas y medicinas.

Un comentario reciente pone que no se puede terminar el juego. El juego ya estÃ¡ completo y no le he encontrado ningÃºn bug, va perfecto, de hecho, ya me he pasado los 3 finales distintos que tiene. Los logros son relativamente fÃ¡cil de conseguir todos, no hay ninguno de esos imposibles o de esos puÃ±eteros tipo recoger todos los documentos.

En resumen, una maravilla de juego, largo, interesante, completo, 100% recomendable, estÃ¡ entre lo mejorcito del aÃ±o, sin duda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064791137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1630284291}
review:
I've played about 4hrs and I'm loving it! The thing that stands out the most to me is the exploration. Sometimes it feels like an open world Tomb Raider when you're climbing and jumping off ledges in puzzle-like rooms. I like the slow paced gameplay. It can be a chill game with the right amount of danger and suspense. I don't like games that have danger at every corner like if it's an amusement park. There's enough breathing room for you to enjoy the idyllic atmosphere of the Mediterranean island. 

The only minor issue I have is the performance. It can stutter a bit when moving around but not to a point that it will kill your enjoyment of the game. And the protagonist's voice is way too loud. No matter how low I move the voice slider, nothing happens. So if you're using earphones, prepare for that! ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198005341943', 'num_games_owned': 1554, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1573298919}
review:
Es una mezcla de survival, sigilo y horror. Mientras vas descubriendo una historia te tienes que preocupar por sobrevivir en un mapa lleno de peligros y siniestros personajes y algunos animales a los que parece molestarles especialmente que respires.
Tiene partes donde tendras que ir saltando y colgandote literalmente para llegar a partes complicadas con el aliciente de que le dan un enfoque realista respecto al tiempo que puedes estar colgado... es decir, que los brazos se cansan y agotas la energia si te pasas colgado mas tiempo del debido, algo que hara que te caigas sin mas.
Han integrado "Die Young prologue" que es un una demo del juego con mecanicas similares pero diferente historia. Realmente es un minijuego y hace que te adaptes a sus mecanicas rapidamente.
Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006217347', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1573053168}
review:
This is a very clunky open world game with survival elements.

+ Big areas to explore.
+ Visuals are okay.

- Obscure objectives.
- Really bad story.
- Terrible combat.
- Very basic stealth.
- This game makes exploration a chore.
- Terrible map.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994290395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1572791690}
review:
Just finished the game.  It took me about 27 hours, and I did not do everything, but it also took me a while to figure out things, so it probably take other people less time.  Take the parkour elements from Assassins's Creed, the crafting style from Far Cry, and the exploration & survival elements of Subnautica and mix them together (no base building though.)

This is not a "hold your hands" type of game.  You immediately get thrown into the world, with minimal guidance and off you go.  This is not a shooter game, this is a stealth and avoidance game.  

So if you like an exploration game, with health, hydration and weapon durability, this is for you.  If you like some action, but not 100% intense action, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198405422695', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1662820998}
review: Why are you doing all of this ? You think it's freedom you're going back to ? That you're .. leaving captivity ? The world out there is a burning furnace, Daphne , and you're digging your own grave every single day. Did you fight this hard , only to live in a world like that ? Do you really want to be an accomplice of it ?  Maybe you think you're innocent . That your... conscience is clean . But it's not . It never was . You're guilty when you drive your car to the supermarket around the corner . When you eat a hamburger in your favourite fast food joint . When you buy designer clothes at the mall . You're guilty when you enjoy the cool breeze coming from your AC , or when you take a long hot shower . The world out there is rotten , Daphne . Youll never be as free as you were here . This place may be wiped out soon ... but one day ... one day you'll wake up in the middle of the night thinking : Was that right thing to do ? Am I reaaly free now ? You'll know the answer when the time comes .  Farewell , Daphne.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221611416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1659555272}
review:
I've had this game for AGES, and always liked the idea of it more than I liked the game itself;  until recently that was, the last update has done it wonders in my opinion. I'll be keeping my eye on this one more regularly from now on!

I completed this game on the 12th of November (as I write this its the 1st of December) and I'm itching to start the game again. Partly this is because I'm only 7 achievements off a full-house, but its also because I've begun to understand just how much I loved that island!

Die Young is Far Cry by way of Friday the 13th, two things I like very, very much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000298969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1572729155}
review:
MINOR SPOILERS (very minor) in this review

So I've played for roughly 5 hours and the story is sooooo bad and un-immersive I just couldn't go on.
I think the worst part was when I came through a kind of stone fort checkpoint...

So far I've been kidnapped. Thrown into a deep well. Chased by dogs. Hunted by insane people and forced to fight for my life. I found some of my friends brutally murdered! And when I get past this checkpoint-thingy I finally meet some non-hostile NPC's which I cannot interact with and they don't even seem to notice my existence.
WHAT?

How about crying for help? Asking wtf is going on? Demanding answers?
No. Instead you find some old horny man, give him some snarky comment and then agree to go look for a fu**** document hidden beneath some stone he doesn't remember where.

....really?

Also, the character reacts very random to scary encounters. They obviously tried to put some humor into the game but it's just... odd.

Example:
You find a hut, filled with blood on the walls and floor and she says "wow someone sneezed on her period".
 **badum tss - oh so witty** 
But when you find a room filled with blood in another area (later in the progress) she goes "OMG what the FU** happened here?"

Aside from the story;

Gameplay is... meh. The platforming is pretty easy, but you can't move around as freely as you might think. Every area has clear path you're supposed to take. 

The enemy AI is really stupid, making it trivial when you encounter them.
Honestly you can just keep running. Nothing can really stop you anyway.
Chased? Jump up on a platform. Or keep running. They will follow, and are quick (at least some of them), but they give up faster than your stamina drains.

Graphic is pretty nice though! So there's that..

The music plays totally random and doesn't deliver the right feeling at the right moment.
You run around the island and suddenly this super mysterious and evil soundtrack plays... making you think you found something...or someone found you!
But no. Just another randomly started soundtrack.

So glad I got this on a good sale... utter waste of time and cash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024113556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1572750958}
review: Great game if you're into exploration and finding hidden secrets. The story is fine and kept me engaged, I wanted to find out what happened at the end. Combat is wonky at best, once you get a decent melee weapon or the crossbow just dodge and kite and you'll never die.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970079390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1616517144}
review: Die Young's open-world turkish island has cleverly connected areas, the story's pleasantly mysterious and scary. Getting around the harsh terrain is dangerous - you will fall a lot from spectacular heights. A challenging game that borrows ideas from good survival adventure games. The main complaint is that you don't get much interaction with NPCs apart from conversations, that feels lackluster. Coop would have made the game a masterpiece. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067214386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 8890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7271, 'last_played': 1574473697}
review: Wow! This is one of the most value for dollars game I have played! The parkour is great and smooth, the engine rendering is awesome, the game is just fun and feels like a well built modern game! I typically don't review or rave over games, but this has add a new standard of game play that I've been missing - I am just wonder when some AAA games I like developers will add this kind of action/parkour to theirs. Outerworlds just came out and I am like, "this would have been awesome in it." Just when I think it's going to end, like the ol' "Indie game shortness" syndrome, it just keeps going - in a great way! I am eager for part two! Keep it coming guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993222028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1572556633}
review: A well-made mix of Far Cry and Dishonored, but with even more survival aspects. Enjoyable story, although very poorly voice acted and not entirely optimized to its full potential (no lip syncing, simple NPC interactions). But definitely worth playing through, I had a very enjoyable time where I was rather hooked over the course of a few days. Rather short game too, as I did everything in 2-3 days 100 % completed.

Quirky, pretty, B-movie horror, parkour, exploration game.  There's even a look over your shoulders button while you're running!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052702797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1657666693}
review:
En franÃ§ais: MÃªme si je pense que ce jeu a un gros potentiel et une histoire plutÃ´t intÃ©ressante (je prÃ©fÃ¨re gÃ©nÃ©ralement les jeux vidÃ©o avec un scÃ©nario spÃ©cifique), il a nÃ©anmoins besoin d'Ãªtre sÃ©rieusement optimisÃ©. Je joue Ã  ce jeu sur un ordinateur avec un processeur de niveau I7 (autant dire que la puissance n'est pas nÃ©gligeable) et malgrÃ© Ã§a, Ã§a lague Ã©normÃ©ment, Ã  tel point que Ã§a en devient franchement agaÃ§ant et que Ã§a gÃ¢che le plaisir et je ne comprends pas comment il est possible que ce jeu lague autant avec l'ordinateur que je possÃ¨de. De plus, le jeu des acteurs de voix manque d'homogÃ©nÃ©itÃ©: le personnage principal a un jeu plus que correct mais certains des PNJ comme le fermier qui se trouve dans l'Oliveraie ou l'ermite qui vit dans les FourrÃ©s du ChÃªne vert ont un jeu trÃ¨s pauvre en qualitÃ©; on dirait qu'ils lisent leurs rÃ©pliques au lieu de les dire.

Je lui laisse donc une note de 6,5/10 et j'encourage les dÃ©veloppeurs Ã  l'amÃ©liorer car je pense sincÃ¨rement que ce jeu peut Ãªtre bon avec une meilleure optimisation.

Merci.

- 

In English: Whilst I think this game has a lot of potential and an interesting storyline (I generally prefer video games that have a specific scenario), it seriously needs to be optimized. I'm running the game on a computer with an I7 core processor (so it's quite powerful) and yet the frame rate drops so often, to the point where it just feels absolutely irritating and it ruins the pleasure of playing the game, and I absolutely don't understand how this is even possible considering the computer I'm running it on. Also, the voice acting is kind of unequal: the main character sounds totally alright but some NPCs like the Olive Grove farmer or the Holm Oak Thicket hermit sound just dull and boring, it feels like they're reading their lines and not telling them.

I'm leaving it a 6,5/10 and can only encourage the devs to improve its quality because I genuinely think that this game can be a really good game with a little bit of optimisation. 

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962054695', 'num_games_owned': 2521, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1572940102}
review:
Were you to mix Mirror's Edge with a survival game and hand it off to a AA studio, you'd get something that looks a bit like this.  Overall I found this game oddly compelling, with the main star likely being the baseline feel of movement.  Exploring the world is pretty darn satisfying given the navigation system and the lack of clear direction, and throughout the game you can find various meaningful upgrades that would easily be missable.

There's some misses here for sure - the tone is reasonably inconsistent across the audio and story, and the plot is very much a start and stop affair, but I think it's still a game worth checking out if you are a fan of single player survival games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020270848', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2775, 'last_played': 1574904521}
review:
I hate walking simulators where you aimlessly wander through corridors and boring landscapes under the moniker of "exploration". I hate jumping puzzles where you have to perform pixel perfect jumps on moving platforms. I hate adventure games where you have to solve contrived puzzles in order to open a door. I hate survival games where you grind for hours to finally craft a new nifty tool that breaks shortly after.

Die Young has exploration, jumping puzzles, adventure elements and survival mechanics. And somehow mixes them together in a surprisingly engaging and fun way.

You wake up as Daphne, a sporty party girl on a holiday trip gone wrong. With a dry throat and no clue what going on you start to explore the island and find your friends.

The best part of Die Young is the exploration and the movement system. The running and jumping almost reminded me of the (sadly ill-fated) mobility shooter Dirty Bomb (sans wall jumping). The climbing mechanics are well down and put you in a nice flow. Some parts are challenging and you might fall from time to time, but nothing is infuriating.

The Mediterranean island and the sunny weather are welcome change to all the games on the market that aim at being dark and gritty and just end up being a boring mesh of brown and gray. If you enjoyed the scenery of Far Cry 1 or 3, you should like this too.

The game doesnâ€™t hold your hand. So instead of following yellow markers on your screen you typically find some notes with a rough hint where to go next. Also itâ€™s quite common for parts of a puzzle to be found at locations far from each other. In other games I often got angry about this. In Die Young itâ€™s not an issue because there is always something else to do. And often while you looking for something, you find something else that you need for another task you werenâ€™t even aiming at. I found this open puzzle design really captivating and the second major reason for enjoying the game as much as I did.

While the plot is fairly traditional in its core (find out whatâ€™s going on, deal with the baddies, escape the island), the way the people on the island came to be as they are, what they believe in and how the bad guy actually has a point, makes it different to the stock Hollywood baddies. The speech during the helicopter flight was one the high points in this respect.

While in theory you can solve many situations by sneaking, especially during the later parts of the game I found the violent approach to be more economic. However you still have to pick your battles wisely. You never reach a point where you can just mow down everything, and thatâ€™s a good thing. 

The price is fair, you should get at least 10 hours of game play and more like 20 if you explore everything (which I recommend to do as there are plenty of optional but still interesting places).

Kudos to the developers for how the handled the game and communication during its early access period. Although some supporters got a bit riled during the final months of quality assurance, where naturally it was harder to tell something interesting.

The game was already pretty stable upon release. The few bugs that cropped up during the early days were quickly addressed by the developers and the game is very robust now.

As with every game there are a few things that did not work out as well as intended: You should own semi decent hardware to really enjoy the visuals. Close combat is pretty awful but luckily the AI is quite dumb, and can mostly be bested by kiting around while beating it with sticks or other tools. During resting, cut scenes might show that do not really add much to the characters. Some of the secondary voice actors are downright awful. Especially Daphne's father sounds like heâ€™s on some really hard medication. Thankfully Daphne and the main baddies are performed pretty well. A few NPCâ€™s actually talk to you â€“ but without lip movement. When Daphne encounters mutilated corpses she is either shocked or cracks a joke, which felt inconsistent to me. At one point you have to fight a large dog in a very boring way. And the final boss fight is mostly about abusing the AI instead of being tactically creative.

However none of this effects the overall fun in any significant way. So if the basic mechanics and visuals of the game sound interesting to you, I can wholeheartedly recommend Die Young.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030629896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1572026526}
review: A great action adventure game by an indie developer. If you are familiar with Dying Light and enjoyed it you will feel right at home with this game. The parkour elements and combat are very similar to DL in a good way. Die Young offers a fairly large open map with quite a few optional side quests. Exploring the map is enjoyable and generally rewarding. Haven't come across any major technical issues and the developer is very active in fixing any errors that come along. Definitely recommended and one of the biggest positive surprises for me in 2019.

review: Juego aÃºn el desarrollo por lo que tiene algunos bugs que no permiten completar el juego al 100% sin tener que empezar una partida nueva, aÃºn asÃ­ es un buen juego por su temÃ¡tica, grÃ¡ficamente espectacular y muy divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146610092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1570918509}
review:
It's a nice game.
I enjoyed it.

The graphics are nice.
The island has alot of nice places.

The only thing I missed was a minimap.
I can understand that when you started the game you need to figure out where you are etc.
But when you get a map. I think they should have putted a minimap so the player can see where is. and which direction he should go.

To be honest I had to open Maps every 15 seconds, to be sure I was still running the right path.
So that could be very annoying.
At the second hand, on some quest. U could see a green dot on the map.
So you know where you should go.

But for alot of side quest they didn't do it.
They should have make a optional button where you can also do that for your side quest.

It's worth to play this game.
But I think they should add a minimap, and fix some bugs.
Sometimes when i'm running or climbing it's laggy.
