review:
GroÃŸartiges Indie Spiel!

Ein IT-Girl, dass warum auch immer auf der Insel gelandet ist (stellt sich nach und nach raus) und der Plan diese wieder zu verlassen. Eine interessante Story wird nach und nach enthÃ¼llt und ist in sich schlÃ¼ssig. 

Das Spiel macht SpaÃŸ und nervt manchmal zu gleich. So sind die Kletterpassagen manchmal etwas heftig. HÃ¤ufiges Speichern ist hier also echt empfohlen, damit nicht alles noch mal erklettert werden muss. Gegnern geht man am besten so weit es geht aus dem Weg, denn zum KÃ¤mpfen ist unsere Protagonisten mit Sicherheit nicht geboren. Etwas craften, etwas Survival, etwas Parcour, irgendwie von allem etwas und gut. 

Eine Sache sollte man beachten: Geht den Hauptstrang durch. Einige GegenstÃ¤nde erscheinen an einem Ort erst, wenn man an einem anderen etwas durchgefÃ¼hrt hat. Das ist leider etwas verwirrend. Open World schÃ¶n und gut, aber das passt nicht immer.

FÃ¼r mich eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

+ Spannend gemacht
+ Interessant Story
+ Keybelegung bei Bedarf frei wÃ¤hlbar

+/- Sprungpassagen etwas Wirr und verzeihen selten Fehler
+/- Wird der Hauptstrang nicht durchgegangen kommt hÃ¤ufig ein WTF what's next??? Moment.
+/- Drei mÃ¶gliche Enden...

- "Bosse", wenn man sie so nennen kann, [spoiler] bis auf Cujo[/spoiler], heftig schwer, sind aber optional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089680827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1655471965}
review:
I have finished the game today. Although I can't really call my playthrough "finished", because I didn't complete all the side quests(which doesn't happen to me too often, I usually try to 100% every game possible).. here's why
The game was good, yes. I enjoyed everything about it.. especially the constant updates of the game(at least now, at the end of 2019). 

I'm sure you know about what the game is, so I'm not gonna type anything about that, sorry :(

My feelings overall: Sometimes I got a bit mad about the controls, because it was hard for ME to get used to it.. also I didn't know where to go first most of the time, since there is A LOT to explore(didn't even find anything yet, might get back to it though)
Basically everything was locked from the other side or locked with a key which you had to find.. so either you had to explore more to find another entrance or just hope for the best.
Most of the quests were very well designed, but imho, the developers should add an option to at least reveal locations in ALL the quests(only some have it) for "adventurers" like me(only optional though, so people don't get disappointed about the feeling of them finding something by themselves)
And yes, I had to look for a few guides, because some quests were very hard for me, especially without any minimap or anything(I like it the way it is though, for the realism and stuff).. 
I would also like to point out that you basically don't have to fight anyone(at least I didn't have to too much) which might be both pro and con.
Anyway, thank you for reading my probably pointless review :D Im typing this late at night before I go to sleep, so it might be.. well, useless.

TL;DR- The game is good, but prepare for a lot of exploring and for the struggle of locked doors and many places to go to.

review: It is an interesting game that makes you do everything by not forcing you to do s**t. Of course, as an indie game it has bunch of bugs and such but none of them is gamebreaking. Gameplay is something similar to very low budget Dying Light. Definetly worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065867547', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1570295061}
review:
Nice climbing game with action/survival elements. Pretty big open world with plenty to explore. Nice side quests and interesting main story with 3 different endings. Can be a bit tedious in some parts (I mean high tower climb). Have some minor bugs in current release and some issues with performance. But it seems latter was fixed in last update. 
All in all - good game and worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083293364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1570297745}
review:
It's OK. 20h in, 100% through, would not recommend. Terrible fighting system, below average sneaking system, boring story, very little voice acting to support said story, tons of useless crafting items.

It's a commendable effort, but there are too many actually good games out there to play this. Worth a sneak peek at 5 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001490367', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 2283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2283, 'last_played': 1569514091}
review:
[h1][b]â€A beautiful summer trip with B-Movie feelings that you wonâ€™t forget.â€[/b][/h1]
Die Young is a first-person adventure with survival and exploration aspect. It used to be early access project started in 2017, developed and published by IndieGala. I bought when itâ€™s first available and have a chance to complete full playthrough in final version (2019).

[h1]Beautiful Horror[/h1]
Die Young told the story of teenage group trapped in an unnamed island in the Mediterranean Sea during a private trip. You play as Daphne, a young girl who enjoys extreme sport and risking (which explains how sheâ€™s capable of athletic skills). Daphneâ€™s motive is to escape from island along with her friends. The more Daphne explores, the more she learns the truth of island and rural community that keep her away from freedom. Player also learns a bit of Daphneâ€™s backstory during resting.

Die Young sets in the fictional island during hot Mediterranean summer, covered in beautiful landscape and various landmarks from sunflower field to mysterious ancient ruins. Decent variety of wildlife scatters around the island. Some are harmless, some are not. I enjoy the scenery and setting of Die Young as the contrast between beautiful colorful nature and gruesome horrors.

Thereâ€™s also Die Young Prologue chapter for free that give bit of story and connection to main game, although it focuses on more stealth and action gameplay.

[h1]Instinct, Strength, Movement[/h1]
Die Young gameplay consists of three main aspects; exploration, survival, and combat. Player is free to explore from start. Exploration is optional and not mandatory as your ultimate goal is to escape from the island. However, each landmark you visit may grant you optional task to deeply explore which reward you useful items/supplies or reveal backstory of the island. Some areas might provide key items for survival or main story. I personally like the way the game doesnâ€™t hold player hand, but give hint or graphical design to let players choose if they feel like to.

As you start playing from the beginning, you will realize how the parkour system works as one of highlight feature. Youâ€™ll work around jumping, leaping, and climbing. Itâ€™s more grounded and bit different than other parkour FPS like Mirrorâ€™s Edge, because thereâ€™s stamina bar that indicate how long you can hold on ledge before you fall. Stamina will decrease slowly while holding ledge and deplete faster when leap to grab another. It provides light puzzle to encourage player to carefully learn environment especially some late areas. Even running and jumping across the gap can be challenged as you might need to maintain speed and momentum. The fine mixture of both indoor and outdoor parkour keeps engaging due to more complexity of environment design. Despite of graphical hint that could ruin immersive for some players (I wish it could tone down or disable in option), Die Young provides strong sense of human movement (functional and weighty) and feeling (anxiety and unsettle of height). Conquer The Stone Pillar is one greatest climbing experience for me.

[h1]Tools for Survive[/h1]
Unlike most survival games, Die Young has no hunger mechanic and building shelter, player only look out for thirst and health meter. Luckily, you can easily restore dehydration from fruit tree, food, and fresh water pool scattering around the island. Same as herbs and materials, player can craft tools and medicine to survive or solve some puzzles. Hunting small animals for hide to expand inventory and more. All you need is to obtain prototype item to learn crafting. Player can trade Owl statue (collectable) to trader for some special items.

I found survival mechanic and saving are basic and pretty generous. Even people who donâ€™t like survival aspect can enjoy the game as it provides difficulty slider that player can change anytime in option. Some players might have hard time for inventory management in first few hours, but you will access more key items, and shelter (for item storage, rest in night, and fast travel). My only gripe is lack of sorting option in inventory and incorrect display of some weapon durability.

[h1]A bit wonky, but still punchy[/h1]
Beside of running away and hiding, Die Young features melee combat. Every tools and melee weapon has basic light attack, charged attack that deal more damage, and block. Melee combat feels weighty, but clumsy at the same time due to inconsistent hit registration and disconnect between animations. There is a lot of threat from wildlife animals to armed mercenary, even boss type enemies that can chase you mercilessly. But Iâ€™m bit disappoint on human enemy as you can cheese AI or get them stuck in geometry, They also lack enemy type and tactic AI approach because once player obtain crossbow / molotov. Fighting them is quite a walk in the park.

[h1]Audio / Soundtrack[/h1]
Die Young features high-quality surround sound to create believable environment (animal, Daphne movement and reaction, ambient). Feedback combat sounds delivers quite solid. Soundtrack features few interesting songs from indie Rock bands along with progressive rock and synthwave music. It may not suit perfectly for everyone, but I found it oddly fit to theme and setting. It gives me strong vibes of old B-movie thrillers / horrors. 

[h1]Performance[/h1]
Die Young is powered by Unreal Engine. The graphics was changed and improved drastically during in development (textures, lighting, and tone) which are in good way. Most areas are well-optimized although some are still noticeably strutted and lack of indoor shadow (ambient occlusion doesnâ€™t help in this case).

Overall, the game delivers good performance despite of some technical issues and crashes on my decent PC. I doubt it would relate to some of my outdated software. So, the problem can be different for each user.

[h1]Closing[/h1]
Die Young may suffer from some technical issues and wonky melee combat. But itâ€™s refreshing with setting and well-balanced survival/story-driven campaign. Engaging player with light puzzle and fluid parkour movement. You might not expect full AAA quality, but with price (~$10 in my country) and effort that developers keep improving the game. An experience worth remembering. Highly recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198010736559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2038, 'last_played': 1570258848}
review:
10/10 would fall from the Stone Pillars again.

Glad that combat was often an, albeit challenging, option despite the whole "RUN. HIDE. FIGHT." leaning of the game. I suck at platforming and it took a LOT of tries to get some finicky jumps just right - I got frustrated a few times but timely save points prevented me from rage quiting after pitching myself off of a mountain a dozen times at certain points.

The game has decent graphics, GREAT atmosphere, and a pretty cool story. I would welcome a 2nd instalment of this! Get cracking!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032197570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1578152283}
review:
Ist eigentlich nicht so meins spiele eher Fallout oder Skyrim in VR,
aber grafisch ganz gut, gute Story und im einfachsten Schwierigkeitsgrad auch fÃ¼r mich spielbar.
Manchmal etwas Leerlauf, keine Gegner nix zu finden, dann aber wieder spannende Kletterpartien. 
Ich habe es im Angebot gekauft und kann es empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026767411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1570155135}
review:
Its a good game, beautiful world. Came a hell of a way from early access gameplay.world design wise.  The one issue is difficulty and it may be just the gamer in me but i started on the hardest setting and the only thing to kill me or come close to it [yes i killed the huge "bosses" also completely optional btw] was missed jumps or falling. 

The one thing this game got by far that no other game has gotten right is climbing.. Its so much fun. The most fun is around the area called high tower. Tooooo much to climb and explore and have fun with. 

Only down side is no swimming but its obvious as to why no swimming. Youd skip 99.9% of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165035953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3539, 'last_played': 1617573850}
review: Good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198056164629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2517, 'last_played': 1570120086}
review: This is a good thing. I sort of run a collection of first-person survival games, and it's a fine addition. I'm glad it has been released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295302795', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1570277027}
review: Very refreshing to see a game like this. Mix of survival and story driven game. First few hours of the game is perfect, it leads you trough creepy island with some pretty creepy things happening. Crafting, looting, killing and a lot of running around is very interesting for the first few hours (4-5). After that you are just repeating exactly the same tasks only rushing to finish the story (which is not so bad) but it gets you walk for hours and hours until you finally find an item or a key that will help you to progress. If you are fan of survival games definitely a recommendation anyhow it gets boring after some hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141748420', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1570051293}
review:
Not a AAA title
But great game, interesting story, hard to learn, hard to master.


Parkour is fantastic, game is large and you need to discover everything yourself. Its great game for someone, who does not like to be lead by hand.

IF you have time, patience and if you enjoy good movement in the game. This game is worth it. Its really underrated.

Played it on stream, 25 hours

Das Spiel reizt durch seinen steten Fortschritt und den freien ErkundungsmÃ¶glichkeiten. Man fÃ¤ngt mit nichts in den HÃ¤nden an und freut sich Ã¼ber jeden Gegenstand, den man findet und der einen weiterhilft. Die Kletterpartien machen SpaÃŸ und werden mit der Zeit anspruchsvoller. DIe Gegner sind eher "meh", die ziellos in der Gegend rumlaufen. Erst die groÃŸen BrÃ¼der stellen eine Herausforderung dar. Ich mag es zudem gern mal eine Frau als Hauptcharakter zu spielen. Ein paar Fragezeichen sind Story mÃ¤ÃŸig dennoch geblieben, aber insgesamt hat mir das Spiel groÃŸen SpaÃŸ gemacht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073203998', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1570295426}
review: Non farÃ² una recensione pomposa e lunga da leggere. Vado subito al dunque. Questo gioco Ã¨ bellissimo e non solo merita di essere giocato ma Ã¨ proprio un must have per qualunque videogiocatore che si definisce tale. E' un tipo di esperienza che non potete perdere. L'amore nello svilupparlo trasuda da ogni angolo della sconfinata mappa. Tirate fuori i pochi spiccioli che servono, acquistatelo e giocatevi questo capolavoro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085785534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1676392969}
review:
I love this game. I played since the first Alpha and could see how they implemented new features as new areas or enemies.
And I absolutely love the athmosphere. Especially the music fits the game perfect in most situations so feel even more emerged.

The parkour is great, I had no problems (except a few times when I felt too confident ;) ) but I'm playing with a controller, don't know how it is when using the keyboard.

The game is very much recommended for anyone looking for a game where you don't get everything told completely but have to look for yourself and find a solution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021466054', 'num_games_owned': 1270, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1569853161}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198023312777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1571575891}
review:
Buy this game if you have a lot of time and patient. Large map to discover, slowly improving crafting system, hard fights. You also need good reflexes to climb and jump. 
Success feeling is great because the game is not easy. 
Absolute fun for it's small price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970679643', 'num_games_owned': 1229, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2753, 'last_played': 1697489800}
review:
While on a thrill-seeking vacation somewhere off the coast of Turkey, Daphne and her rich, spoiled friends visit a remote island in the Mediterranean Sea. Soon after, they are kidnapped and separated. Finding herself alone in this beautiful but hostile place, our heroine must try to discover the truth of what has happened. Can she uncover the secrets the island hides and find a way back home or, like so many others who have stumbled upon this place, will she [b][i]Die Young[/i][/b]?

In early access for quite some time, the game received a multitude of updates along the way. I played it occasionally for much of its development and every update brought needed and welcome improvements. The final version added a surprisingly large amount of content and added immense areas to explore. While it shares many elements with other games, [b][i]Die Young[/i][/b] has its own unique style. I enjoyed it from the start, but it must be noted that it has design and gameplay components that not everyone will enjoy. A substantial portion of the game requires the player to free-climb to great heights, including jumping from high ledges and traversing a plethora of cliffs and similar locales while gripping narrow handholds with just your fingertips. While many other games involve climbing mechanics, [b][i]Die Young[/i][/b] is the only one I have played that makes me nervous when these areas must be conquered. Many of these spots proved extremely challenging for me (think sweaty palms and queasy stomach) but the story was compelling enough to push myself past them. If you suffer from vertigo or a fear of heights, this may not be the game for you. If you do enjoy such things, however, you will be in free-climbing, parkour heaven.

At this time, [b][i]Die Young[/i][/b] has been officially released but it continues to receive updates. The developers have listened to the players and implemented a great many improvements and it is encouraging that they continue to polish the game. Having said that, it should be mentioned that [b][i]Die Young[/i][/b] is an ambitious game from a small studio. They deserve praise for what they have produced but do not expect a AAA title. The game is quite beautiful and for the most part, runs well, but it still has a few drawbacks that keep it from earning the highest marks. But, for the price, [b][i]Die Young[/i][/b] is a whole lot of game and a whole lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986297793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2994, 'last_played': 1569622421}
review:
VoilÃ  un jeu que j'ai suivi depuis la bÃ©ta et que j'ai eu le plaisir de voir aboutir. 
Je souligne que l'Ã©quipe a toujours Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s dÃ©vouÃ©e, communiquant avec la communautÃ©, sortant rÃ©guliÃ¨rement des mises Ã  jour et expliquant ses objectifs. Je prÃ©cise aussi que depuis la sortie officielle dÃ©but septembre, l'Ã©quipe ne s'est pas endormie sur ses lauriers et continue de fournir des patchs.

Le jeu en lui mÃªme exploite un bon filon, le survival mÃªlÃ© Ã  une ambiance teintÃ©e d'horreur, un systÃ¨me de parkour, d'escalade et d'infiltration.

Le scÃ©nario est simple : Vous Ãªtes en vacances sur une Ã®le paradisiaque avec quelques potes quand une bande de maboules vous capture et vous abandonne au fond d'un puits. Vous devrez vous sortir de cette situation en explorant, en volant ou craftant vos outils et armes, en essayant de comprendre l'histoire de l'Ã®le et ce qui est arrivÃ© Ã  vos potes.

Au rang des grandes qualitÃ©s de ce jeu, il y a l'ambiance. C'est lÃ  une belle rÃ©ussite. Oui, on a vraiment les chocottes. En particulier au dÃ©part. Parce que vous Ãªtes placÃ© dans une situation de proie. Vous Ãªtes traquÃ© et l'environnement est hostile. Au fil du jeu, le scÃ©nario ponctuÃ© par quelques dÃ©couvertes macabres maintient un sentiment de malaise. C'est dans l'ensemble assez bien rythmÃ©. En outre, la map est assez grande et on prend plaisir Ã  en explorer les diffÃ©rentes parties pour en apprendre plus.

Une partie du jeu est consacrÃ©e Ã  l'escalade et c'est un aspect que j'ai trouvÃ© bien fait et intÃ©ressant. Toutefois, une bonne partie de la map est un vÃ©ritable labyrinthe et cela peut parfois Ãªtre frustrant, surtout quand on sait qu'une mauvaise chute peut vous valoir de revenir assez loin en arriÃ¨re.

Maintenant, disons-le tout net, la rÃ©alisation est trÃ¨s inÃ©gale et on peut trouver autant de qualitÃ©s que de dÃ©fauts Ã  ce jeu.

Tout d'abord, le monde paraÃ®t hostile mais en fait, les ennemis sont scriptÃ©s et une grande partie de l'Ã®le est dÃ©serte. VoilÃ  le problÃ¨me numÃ©ro 1 du jeu. Si les ennemis pouvaient se dÃ©placer librement sur la carte et vous traquer, Die Young prendrait une toute autre dimension.

C'est pas grave me direz-vous, il reste l'aspect infiltration. Alors oui, Ã§a marche assez bien. On peut s'amuser Ã  passer dans le dos des ennemis. Mais il faut reconnaÃ®tre qu'aprÃ¨s avoir bien avancÃ© dans le jeu, par lassitude ou parce que vous passez frÃ©quemment par les mÃªmes lieux, vous finirez par buter tout le monde. 

Concernant le systÃ¨me de craft, c'est pas trop mal fait mais Ã§a reste sommaire. Par ailleurs, la faim et la soif ne sont lÃ  que pour faire beau car elles n'ont pas de rÃ©percussion sur les performances de notre hÃ©roÃ¯ne. Je ne vois donc pas bien l'intÃ©rÃªt.

Donc, au final, il y a pas mal de vernis dans ce jeu et le sentiment que certains aspects auraient pu Ãªtre encore meilleurs.
Mais malgrÃ© ses dÃ©fauts, on ne s'ennuie pas dans Die Young et c'est une expÃ©rience plaisante qui vous tiendra en haleine une bonne vingtaine d'heures. Je vous le recommande.

review: AWESOME GAME, SURPRISINGLY ONE OF THE BEST I'VE PLAYED IN THE LAST COUPLE OF YEARS!!! THANK YOU DEVELOPERS!!! Gameplay: 9-10/10 - Story: 6-7/10  The Storyline could be more convincing, but it does it's job (6/10) and leads you through the Game (7/10). However, the gameplay (Survival, climbing/parcours, archaic fighting, riddle-solving) is just awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970577430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1569519498}
review:
Excellent game!

The story is interesting, with subtle clues about what is going on sprinkled throughout the landscape.
The gameplay works quite well, the parcour movement wonderful and the main character has the right amount of cursing and charm.
Graphics are good, the houses/indoors look a bit dull sometimes but the outdoors (which are the majority) look really lovely and well made.

The level design of the areas is really really good! The way certain areas connect to one another and you come back to areas you've been before is really well done, haven't seen that in quite a while even on tripple A games. A really welcome difference to the usual one-way levels you often have.

Puzzles are not too many but well put together and since the game is open world you actually can go and progress as you see fit.
When I first played through (there's several endings and you have to do different things to get to them) I actually hadn't found all my friends yet, so I strolled back around areas I've already been to and found the last missing one in a place I was quite surprised I haven't seen before because I was always going a different way.

Overall difficulty wasn't high, combat got really easy after a certain point, but it never bothered me at all. Exploration and finding the hidden items made it all up.

Absolutely would recommend this game to anyone who likes a good story, a bit of puzzling and exploration! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197981372997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1947, 'last_played': 1569205138}
review:
It's just a great game with a few simple mechanics. The first mechanic is running around, you run around, a lot, and it's an awesome world to run around in. Sometimes you run towards things. Sometimes you run away from things. The next mechanic is the climbing puzzles. These show up all over the place and they are really fun. Very similar to Tomb Raider challenge tombs. There are a lot of little climbs and then a big one in the middle of the game. Along side the climbing is also some "parkour" but most of that is the same as climbing just sometimes you can do it much faster once you are familiar with an area.

The next mechanic is the "survival" elements. These are not as intense as in some games. You just have to drink water occasionally, and you can also eat or use med kits to heal. It doesn't feel nearly as dire as in some survival games where you have to eat and drink every minute. It's very reasonable in this game. And the game is in real-time, one hour in this game is one hour in real life, so your character, Daphne, is not constantly starving.

Next up there is crafting. Crafting is not like all the base building stuff you do in some games. It's more of the Tomb Raider type crafting where you craft what you need on the fly. Craft some medicine. Cook some food. Build a tool or weapon. Very simple and it doesn't feel like a chore.

The final mechanic is the combat. This comes in two flavors. Sneaking past things, which is pretty fun. You mostly do this in the first half of the game. In the second half of the game you will acquire a crossbow and can craft molotov cocktails. You will want to approach combat with stealth when possible. As with the other mechanics combat never feels like a chore.

There is a story as well, which you mostly get through finding documents around the island. It's interesting to read about the inhabitants of the island.

I guess I should give some complaints, and that would be that living NPCs feel stale. Partly because of animations, partly because they don't have very many interesting things to say. As for the dead people you encounter, they are much  more interesting, often you are on the trail of a person or group of people and eventually you discover the tragic end that they have come to. It's kinda sad and thought provoking, and only serves to motivate you to get off the island so that you don't die young.

This game really does everything to maximize fun and minimize grind. The bottom line is it's just a really fun game to play. I recommend it to anyone that wants a relaxing game to kill some time with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971570576', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1569337877}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031438789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1570278101}
review:
This game gets better ever few minutes.

You start off in what seems like a small area with a small map.  Then (eventually) you discover another way, then another area, then another maze, then another settlement, then another mystery.

The island gets bigger and bigger and the area you run through hold a lot of things you simply don't notice and the "side quests" get more and more and further away.

Some "side quests" are straightforward, other more obscure and a third type requires an item - pretty obvious what item - but haven't not see one - makes you wander which areas did I run through and miss it.

Combat - jeez - run if you can - hit hard if you must and remember - you are not an elite warrior,.  That said - my Wrench is wet with the blood of the mad.

Main quest?  Yes - kinda linear steps - follow the path.  However, there seem to be many paths and many ways of following the paths so in places "go here, get key, unlock door" is linear at other times "found key, tried all known doors, hmmm" does make it less linear.

Just seen the movie and a guy with a crossbow - saw him earlier - ignored him.  Damn - wish I had the crossbow...

author: {'steamid': '76561198044470265', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2458, 'last_played': 1568686995}
review:
First of all, that's another game I feel *really* bad for giving a negative review, but couldn't make it positive and be true to myself... Add the third option, Steam!

I bought this game a long time ago. I played the first part of the game (up to the tower) 2 times, and once more before the tower was even added. Maxed out everything. When Prologue came out, I was really happy. Enjoyed it... but the boss battle was ridiculous. I stoned the poor guy to death, cause I ran out of everything I possibly could.

When the whole game came out, I again played through the first part (speed-ran, really), then slowly explored the other locations and they just felt... more meaningless. But they weren't bad, just that if I didn't go there, I wouldn't lose much. I wouldn't lose the story. Suddenly there was much more fighting and I had to change my playstyle completely. I was definitely bummed out that we couldn't reach the [spoiler]village[/spoiler] and kill [spoiler]Brother #1[/spoiler], but I decided that it didn't matter in the overall picture. 

I didn't feel like ending the game in the "good ending" that I actually view to be the "proper one", but it's all minor (imo) spoilers: [spoiler]Then, I reached the randez-vous and.. Again, an ambush... Great. One big mo-fo and around 20 small ones, +dogs. The guys above in the chopper that came to get me weren't even helping. There was no place to hide this time, if I went up the temple I was just stoned away from there before I could properly climb. Even when I used the immunity pill (also wtf), I still couldn't really kill anything unless my aim was superA (and it's only superB), cause I was being thrown around... It was a late hour at this point so I just quit the game and went to sleep. I knew I had to stock up on a lot of stuff, dress into the heavy suits, craft meatballs for the dogs, craft adrenaline, take more medkits, but it all just felt... Like a struggle that wasn't really worth it. [/spoiler]

In the end, game that I loved and played so much of, didn't feel worth it's ending. Or the second-part locations, really. Everything previously was storyline-connected. You either got a backpack there, maybe utility belt, trade ability, important info about the storyline characters, but the Sunflower Fields? Useless, really. Same with the Farm and the Biofuel... You didn't really have to complete those for anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198560725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1569209016}
review:
This review is just for Die Young, I have not played the prologue that comes with this game yet. In just the first 5 hours of playing Die Young I can say that it is enjoyable and does (as others have mentioned) have a very Lara Croft game feel. You really have to explore around and climb over stuff to get into everything, so take that into consideration when thinking about purchasing this game. I only experienced one crash while playing the game which wasn't too bad because I had saved earlier, for those thinking about playing I would recommend saving before you attempt a particularly hard battle or hard jump. Some of the jumps can be pretty hard. 

As for the combat it's not too bad, but can be really hard in the beginning, I would recommend finding the crowbar in the sunflower field and use that in the beginning. I didn't even know it was over there for a while because I didn't explore much over there seeing as there is a mini-boss patrolling the area. 

In any case, I got the game on sale and for what I got it for I would say it was worth the price. I look forward to seeing where the game goes as it get further developed. 

My Set-up:
Alienware Aurora R7
Windows 10
Intel Core i7-8700
16 GB RAM
GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Graphics Card

Suggestions for the Developers:

1. You should consider making it possible to zoom in and out on the map as it can be really frustrating when trying to visit somewhere you've been before but the map only showing a certain amount. It would even be okay if the parts of the map you hadn't been to before where blacked out and not visible. 

2. Consider making it possible to fast travel to campfires that you have already been to before.

3. Consider adding a leveling system so that the character you play as can level up to get stronger and have more stamina, do more damage, and have more health. 

4. Consider making enemy health bars appear when close and give them a number value. Also give the weapons you find a damage stat in the inventory so you can know without attacking how much damage your weapons will do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055271780', 'num_games_owned': 1091, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1569050350}
review:
[b][i]Info: This is a part of my longer review, that exists on my blog page and as a YouTube Video. It was done in German, but there are translations. I would recommend to read the full review or watch the Video[/i]

â–º opinion and conclusion
Die Young was announced to me as a survival game and then it surprised me a lot with its very own kind of playing style. The strong focus on parkour, free-climbing and above all exploring and discovering little secrets and secret places are much more than a normal survival game. And these areas are the big strengths of this game.

Watch the YouTube Video (many subtitles):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvHaDANN_pg

If you like discovering an unknown, dangerous world and looking into the last corner and exploring their secrets, you will most likely find a lot of entertainment in Die Young. Pure survival fans might be surprised by this game with its otherness and that might possibly deter them. I personally really liked the mix.

Even though I would have liked a slightly better combat mechanics. But this would have shifted the focus of the game away from sneaking and skillful dodging to beating and shooting, presumably this is not exactly what the Devs wanted.

The world is beautiful and interesting, the story exciting. It awakens in me the desire to continue to research and uncover the secrets of the cult on the island.

Full Blog Post:
https://zapzockt.de/die-young-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198990026034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1575573196}
review: Die Young is just the perfect survival game that I've played in a while! It's a parkour-style game, which features a whole lot of climbing, jumping and running in it. You simply can't get enough of it! The island is huge, has  a lot of stuff on it and you can explore it freely, meaning the way you approach it is based on your decisions and creativity. There's a plenty of items that you can choose to craft, that can help you survive, but they unlock in time, so you'll have to figure how to get them by playing the game. It also has in-game cinematics and checkpoints that you have to reach for safe travels and rest. It's truely amazing. I have been playing the game for a couple of hours now and have to say that the price for this game is totally worth it! If you're a hardcore fan of the survival genre games and do enjoy some parkour as gameplay mechanics, than be sure that this game won't disappoint you!

review:
I didn't even know this game existed until recently, because IndieGala have been very active with its publicity. 
I saw it on special at a very decent price so I bought it, and for the price I gotta say its a very good and fun game.
If you are into survival you might like this game. I say might because the game is not enteraly about survival, but exploration, stealth and parkour aswell. 
Nice, simple yet intriguing story that will keep you wanting to explore more.
Overall, for the price is a good game and is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118646488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1568507449}
review:
Die Young - Review and First impressions.

Die Young is  a great puzzle exploration game with survival mechanics tied into it. At no point do any of the survival mechanics become tedious. 

The premise is similar to Far Cry 3 of being Kidnapped on a holiday of a life time. you are thrown into a well and then someone or something opens the roof and allows you to escape. 

The world is stunning and beautiful. The audio is well crafted and helps you to locate enemies.

Yes enemies, some cult i believe from the lore bits found throughout the open map. The main crazies are few and far between and easily handled with some crafted weapons or tools... However there are some i am convinced you cannot kill, like the reaper man in the temple ruins in the video. I could also just be rubbish.

Every zone you arrive at is a labyrinth and puzzle to explore and gather  resources, find friends and clues on how to escape the island.  This rewarding exploration and puzzle solving makes it a delight. i recommend this game highly if into the puzzle solving platformer and exploration survival games.

8/10

https://youtu.be/OzIBRC7t5eY

review:
I had this game on my radar for a long while. I think it needs to "cook" a bit more : loading time are more than 5mn long, which makes the "die&retry" platform puzzles unbearable and immersion breaking (which is sad, since the game is actually quite pretty).

Might give it another go later on if they fix this.
developer_response:

Thank you for your feedback.

Please check new patch released today. It improves a lot loading time and also improves lag / stuttering problem.

Best!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023049455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1647, 'last_played': 1569022858}
review:
Great game design and very fun platforming. Although, I wished climbing was fun, it was more of a nuisance than a challenge and the game keeps introducing more of it. I died a lot because there was lag or an invisible obstacle shifting my character slightly to a different direction. Adding to that the LOOOOOONG LOADING SCREENS! making everything painful.

Despite what said, I still find the game really fun to play because of the crafting, upgrades and the numerous platforming puzzles and I cant wait to see whats coming after the tower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068144725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1568616788}
review:
Das Spiel ist sehr gut und mal ein etwas anderes Survialgame Nur leider hatte ich schon nach 5 Minuten den ersten ab Absturz und danach leider ca alle 40 Minuten wieder einen.
Wartet lieber bis es ein Paar mal gepatcht wurde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059507774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1692662404}
review:
Gives me vibes of Far Cry and a Jason movie (the chase you with axes), The Forest (without base building just in the UI) and a tiny bit of BioShock (area reveals by names, and the self-talk of the junkie enemy type). The jumping puzzles are like Far Cry tower on steriods with better variety.

I am suprised how much immersive and captivating this game thus far. 

I recommend to the Developer a better Graphic for the Title (reminds me of a cheap horror game with the girl face imposed on it) and this more of a chase, survive and attack game. Not just horror.

I would recommend some wooden planks or boards that can be broken (for puzzles)  and a magnifying glass that let you see where enemies patrols or walks are.

Cheers,

TheGameConsulant

developer_response:
Hi.

thank you for your feedback.

We are going to release this week a new patch that will fix:

- frame rate issues / stuttering
- long loading times

Please stay tuned and check the game once new patch is released.

About the controller: there is a known windows bug that sometimes recognizes your controller like controller 2 even if you just have one connected. This prevents you from play and the only way to fix is to restart windows.
We detected this bug only with xbox controller cable.
But it would help us a lot if you can give us more info.

Best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983959035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1569623492}
review:
Frankly, I didn't expect that this game will suck me in. But this happened! I just love this game!
I like the atmosphere and the whole entire gameplay... of course there are some minor bugs, but you can barely notice them.
There are lots of challenges, survival elements, crafting, a huge world to explore, the music... and the story line is awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986482271', 'num_games_owned': 931, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8085, 'last_played': 1646074312}
review: Just finished Die Young V1.0 after 10+ hours, totally enjoyed it and the game looks beautiful on my RTX2080 in 4K, finding the fast travel points is a must unless you want to do a lot of running around. and i did find a bug where if you close the blue doors behind you at the radio tower, then use the radio, after the sequence finishes you cannot open the doors again to get back outside which soft-locks the game. however that being said i definitely recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198193531031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2605, 'last_played': 1594761803}
review: had the game since it was first released on steam idk how many years ago played it a few times after each major update glad  to finally see the ending. the parkour prob the most intense part of the game if you miscalculate you die  10/10 great game

Die Young est un excellent survival (moi qui ne suit pas trÃ¨s fan du genre, lÃ  je tire mon chapeau). Dans ce jeu vous incarnez la jeune Daphne, adepte du parkour et de l'escalade (comme par hasard !). Ce n'est pas une Lara Croft (mÃªme si elle gÃ©mit comme elle au moindre effort ! Va falloir m'expliquer pourquoi...) mais elle Ã  du punch et de la ressource cette petite Daphne. Vous l'avez compris, vous pouvez crafter des trucs ! Anti-venin, couteau, bandage... le crafting n'est pas aussi poussÃ© qu'un project zomboid mais c'est amplement suffisant pour ce qu'on demande.

 Alors, c'est une Ã®le se localisant dans la MÃ©diterranÃ©e mais franchement vu l'hostilitÃ© de la faune, Ã§a ressemble plutÃ´t Ã  l'Australie ! Les serpents veulent vous tuer, les chiens veulent vous tuer, les rats veulent vous tuer, les faucons veulent vous tuer... bon vous avez compris. Les combats sont assez modÃ©rÃ©s en terme de difficultÃ© (Je rÃ©pÃ¨te, on joue par Lara Croft, si vous jouer en mode survie, la pauvre Daphne va prendre trÃ¨s cher !) mais faisables (le boss de fin c'est quelque chose... perso je l'ai lapidÃ© pendant 15 mins !). Enfin la gestion santÃ©/hydratation qui n'est pas abusÃ© du tout (pas besoin de boire tous les 5 mins et peut rÃ©cupÃ©rÃ© un peu de santÃ© assez facilement). 

EnormÃ©ment de quÃªtes Ã  accomplir malgrÃ© la premiÃ¨re, dÃ©jÃ  bien longue et rÃ©ussir sans les soluces va vous demander Ã©normÃ©ment de temps Ã©galement. Alors ce ne sont pas des quÃªtes extraordinaires, plus des Ã©nigmes mais je prÃ©fÃ¨re garder le mot Ã©nigme pour la faÃ§on dont vous aller progresser (chercher une clÃ©, trouver un journal, trouver le bon chemin d'escalade...) Vous disposez de deux modes de jeux et en plus vous pouvez custom la difficultÃ©. Cela va vous redonner quelques heures de jeux en plus. L'histoire est assez prenante, on est loin d'un Far Cry 1, un Half-Life ou un Dragon Age: Origins mais franchement, Ã§a passe bien. Daphne est attachante malgrÃ© les dialogues assez limitÃ©s... bref, c'est un plaisir d'y jouer. 

Surtout qu'un prologue est Ã  disposition avec un autre personnage pour augmenter un peu la durÃ©e du plaisir :) 

Amusez-vous bien ! Je vous le recommande grandement !

author: {'steamid': '76561198034637335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1568634137}
review:
Really enjoyed this game, exploring and uncovering the mystery of the island was very satisfying and rewarding.

You can tell a lot of thought and effort was put into the story, wasn't shoe horned in to give an open world some direction.

It's refreshing playing a game that's not super hand holdy, it tells you what you need, while letting you explore and figure out where to go and what to do.

Taking your time and exploring gives some nice surprises and loot.

It's an indie game so there are a few things that need some polishing but I didn't come across anything game breaking

author: {'steamid': '76561198175623130', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1568610280}
review:
Das Game startet wie Far Cry 3 ungefÃ¤hr, nur das man seinen "Peiniger" nicht sieht, man wird in einen Brunnen geworfen mit einer Handgemalten Karte, zack, los gehts. Das Crafting ist wirklich enorm leicht, gibt auch nicht zu viele GegenstÃ¤nde, Speer, Messer, Rohrzange, Bandage usw.
Essen muss man nicht, nur trinken, dafÃ¼r stehen in der Welt Ã¼berall Brunnen rum oder man findet auch GefÃ¤ÃŸe mit Wasser, die Brunnen werden auch auf der Karte markiert. 
SchÃ¶ne Grafik, schÃ¶ne Insel, schÃ¶ne Landschaft, schÃ¶ne Fauna, muss man einfach mal klar sagen, finde ich angenehmer als die Insel von The Forest.
Was mich eher stÃ¶rt, und weshalb ich am Ã¼berlegen bin was ich nun fÃ¼r einen Daumen gebe, ist der Parkour.
Klar Parkour ist schÃ¶n, macht SpaÃŸ, gibt Adrenalin.
Ich habe bis jetzt das Spiel nur mal eine Stunde gespielt, werde es spÃ¤ter noch weiterspielen aber von der Stunde Spielzeit bisher waren davon 55 Minuten Parkour. Bisschen zu viel fÃ¼r meinen persÃ¶nlichen Geschmack, wem es natÃ¼rlich gefÃ¤llt oder an Spielen wie Mirrors Edge SpaÃŸ hatte, der ist hier genau richtig, ich vergleiche das mal bisher mit Far Cry 3 + Mirrors Edge.

Ich gebe dem Spiel dennoch einen Daumen nach oben, weil mit auÃŸnahme von dem Parkour fÃ¼r mich alles Stimmig ist. Ich mag ja sowieso so verschollen auf einer Insel Szenarien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986406741', 'num_games_owned': 3234, 'num_reviews': 913, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1568592349}
review:
+ not bad graphics but not up to the best you can do in UE4..
+ not bad voice acting , tho is not so often present..
+ not bad menus, crafting and looting, tho sometimes you cannot skin proper..
+ not bad stealth mechanics, tho sometimes you get spotted without the time to react..
- horrible parkour mechanics, imprecise and very badly copied from Dying Light.
- the game IS NOT open-world - you will be always funneled by the map design to certain paths that are pretty distant from one to another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075331333', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1647, 'last_played': 1678890298}
review:
I can just highly recommend this game: 
Die Young offers survival, parkour, exploration, puzzle, horror, strategy and even more elements. All in one game.

It also  has a beautiful game world with a great scenery and atmosphere.

Even the story is easy to understand, yet very exciting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131745175', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1568579946}
review:
I played the prologue and it was cool and all but the ending of it left me unsatisfyed. Then I get to the main story and I die once because I slipped off a flat surface I jumped on and the loading took around 20 minutes and still hadn't loaded yet, and my computer isn't bad at all.

The climbing is basic and literally the same thing from every other parkour game. It's fun, but when the game mechanics are more deadly than the enemies there tend to be problems.
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for your feedback!

We are working on loading times so please expect a patch speeding up them soon ;-)
About difficulty:
May we suggest you to start the first playthrough in adventure mode if you didn't do it already?

Thank you again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019816374', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 1685, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1568466596}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981137890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1569379554}
review: More important than the positive things that they do with the game is the mistakes they don't make: they don't ruin it super-accurate destination indicators that destroy the experience of exploration and they didn't make fast travel over accessible.  By doing this, the player has a sensation of the space of the island and how much work it takes to cover it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066603643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1568490533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064452744', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1568595137}
review:
[h1] Good points: [/h1]
[list]
 [*] Game is challenging, making you think a lot about what you how to progress, and with really tricky stuff you must figure out.
 [*] Many secondary objectives with big rewards.
 [*] Cool climbing system.
[/list]

[h1] Bad points: [/h1]
[list]
[*] Combat is horrible, and feels buggy with hits you dodge doing damage anyways, some NPC's will just have no reach to you at all with their hit animations if you just hold S and spam mouse click.
[*] Bosses figthing is the most dumb thing I ever seen, you fight a [spoiler] dog which has God Mode, even if you shoot arrows to his head,or stab him with your spear, he ignores damage, only way to kill him, is to make him charge on you, you dodge, and he hits eletrificated fence, you must do that like 10 times to beat him [/spoiler], which is really tedious and boring.
 [*] Traveling around the world is so boring, as you must run long distances of terrain just by running, most of the map is empty with nothing to do, and most buildings you encounter have locked doors in which you must find the key somewhere god knows where to open it.
[/list]

To be honest this game been more annoying than enjoyable in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013599597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 3024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1682516580}
review:
Inzwischen hat sich dieses Projekt zu einem grossartigen Spielerlebnis gemausert. Eine phantastische Arbeit fÃ¼r ein kleines Entwicklerteam. Die Grafik ist nun hervorragend und die Soundkulisse passt perfekt. Mittlerweile hat das Spiel zudem auch eine deutschsprachige Ãœbersetzung aller Texte, so dass man die Geschichte gut verfolgen kann. Grandios finde ich auch, dass eine frei konfigurierbare Steuerung eingebaut wurde. Danke dafÃ¼r!!! So sieht Barrierefreiheit in einem Computerspiel aus.

Das Spiel ist nicht gerade leicht zu meistern, da es einen so gar nicht an die Hand nimmt. Man muss wirklich alles, dem realen Leben gleich, selbst herausfinden, aber gerade motiviert mit jedem Fortschritt immer mehr . Das Klettern und AufrÃ¼sten seiner Waffen macht verdammt viel Spass und wurde hervorragend umgesetzt und man kann sogar den Schmerz unserer Protagonistin fÃ¶rmlich mitempfinden (Aua!). Das Spiel ist eines der besten in meiner Steam-Bibliothek!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997879986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1673477155}
review: Had been looking forward to the full game for awhile and have not been disappointed. Considering this is from a small Indie team it has good graphics, cohesive gameplay and a good atmosphere. I don't think it's wise to go in expecting Far Cry even though there are superficial similarities. If you can wrap your head around the fact that it is not combat focused you will have a much better time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989483885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1568403927}
review:
I would rather buy a polished non-klunky triple A title from 2012 like Far Cry 3, seven years later, for $7, than a brand new released 2019 game that is a non-polished, poorly optimized, klunky Indie game for $7.

Go buy an old triple A game on discount rather than buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032347348', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1568329603}
review: So far this is the most engaging survival game that I have played (not that I have tried that many) because you have an actual goal that is getting out of the island. There are some graphical glitches and the parkour/movement can be clunky at times but overall is a pretty good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996615599', 'num_games_owned': 1011, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1571581197}
review:
I have been playing this game since it was available and have seen it mold into the game we have right now in front of our eyes. From gameplay mechanics to graphic improvement this game has fulfilled all my expectations, for me the game in the alpha version already looked stunning and amazing (Remember this is an indie game) and I could consider it to be an AAA game.

I still have many hours to play even though I nearly beat the game in the alpha version (after the unlock of the bull door zone) but i feel like i really needed to learn the mechanics and the map again since they added more mobs, quests, items, npc's... The game shifted into a bigger and more complete form of it and it did well.

About the story, well, you are Daphne a girl that loves to live on the edge and always try new things on life when one day you decide to go on a trip to a turquish island with some of your friends. At first it may look like a paradisiac island but the horrors and nightmares that lay within it are countless. Your aim is to escape the island at any cost. What happened to your friends? Who are the people living on the island? That's something you need to figure out by yourself.

I recommend buying it, they have put so much love and effort on this game over the past few years and they even released a Prologue for FREE so we could get to try how the game mechanics work and what type of game genre are we in front of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091398808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1700423682}
review: Amazing parkour game set in an open-world island with heavy inspiration in Far Cry 3 and Dying Light.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970695641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1566565077}
review:
A rather dull concept which I feel lends the majority of its storyline to Far Cry 3 minus capturing strongholds but the basic storyline is the same (young adults go to an island for adventure, the locals dislike them and they end up getting captured) so nothing new and quite a boring way to introduce a game.

Due to the fact that the story is not very in depth the game does get boring rather easy I found and more of a running and jumping simulator more than anything.
The graphics are stunning but that's about it... 
Since this is not really a hardcore survival game (which in my opinion it could be and would be rather nice) the crafting seems rather too vacant where all of a sudden the character can make knives and wrenches instantly by only a few resources so realism is not really a thing here.
A lot of things could have been added to this game to make it more realistic, in depth weather systems, locals that actually look Mediterranean and not hillbillys or Rednecks from America, a more diverse character walking system where the locals actually do things instead of walking around in circles for hours on end, making a shelter like a simple lean to, marking the surrounding environment (a breadcrumb) technique to make you aware of your directional route, animal tracking... NONE of this is in the game which really doesn't back up the synopsis of the game as "Armed with only her wits, agility, and the will to stay alive" 

For a game that has been over 2 years in early access with a planned release now set within a few weeks of me writing this I feel nothing interesting and exciting will be added to make the whole experience of survival more believable.
A game you will most likely play once and forget about really quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082238117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1840, 'last_played': 1683403909}
review:
Ich spiele das Game seit Release. Mich hat es ab der ersten Stunde gefesselt. Bin jetzt schon im zweiten Durchgang weil immer wieder neue Updates kamen und ich einfach nicht verpassen wollte was die Entwickler neu rein gebracht haben.

Freue mich wahnsinnig auf die Vollversion die jetzt bald erscheint. Habe nur noch eine Quest offen und ich denke das mit dieser dann auch das Spiel zu beenden ist.

PRO:

- schÃ¶ne Grafik und Landschaften
- FlÃ¼ssige Steuerung
- sehr schÃ¶ne GerÃ¤uschkulisse
- taffe Protagonistin
- Arten- und Fauna Vielfalt in Form von Fuchs, Hase und Co. sowie diversen Pflanzen
- Tiere die einen angreifen, wie zb. Adler, Hund, Wildschwein, arme irre Personen aber auch Banditen
- ausgeklÃ¼geltes Jump & Runningsystem
- teils bahnbrechende und schwindelerregende Jumps die sitzen mÃ¼ssen
- Ã¼bersichtliches und einfaches Craftsystem
- nÃ¼tzliche Items die man im laufe des Spieles findet unter anderem Kletterhandschuh, Knieschoner, Cape ...
- viele Infos zu Story 
- faire und immer lÃ¶sbare Nebenquests
- faire Checkpoints in Form von Autosaves oder eigenen Speicherpunkten die man setzen kann zb. durch Lagerfeuer

CONTRA:

- ab und an etwas hakelig an manchen Positionen, aber nicht der Rede wert
- Ruckler in Form von kurzen FrameinbrÃ¼chen- ist aber bedeutend besser geworden als zur Anfangszeit, kann man aber darÃ¼ber hinweg sehen


Zusammenfassung:

Die Entwickler haben hier ein wunderschÃ¶nes Spiel geschaffen in mitten rauer Natur auf einer Insel, bombigem Wetter und einer taffen Daphne die man spielen darf. Wer auf Crafting, Abenteuer und Jump&Run steht ist hier mit diesem Spiel genau richtig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010443359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 2981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1658041585}
review:
Before update evaluation.

Nice game, can't wait for the update.

---------------------------------------------------------

After update evaluation

Just finished the game.
I think it is a pretty good exploration/parkour game but it definetely has flaws.
The stealth is pretty meh, the enemys don't see far enough and they can be really retard** sometimes, for example, I had grunts notice, chase then loose me just because I crouched in the grass even if I was right in there faces.
You can't instantly kill someone silently any other way than with a crossbow headshot.
The combat is pretty basic, it do the job but honestly I wish they would've uptaded it to be more skillfull, it really is easy once you know the bot patterns and I played on the hardest difficulty start to finish because the game was too easy for my taste before the update.
The survival aspect is ok in my book, it's just a bit weird that they merged hunger and health but it doesn't bother me.
I met 2 bugs on my way, but they weren't game breaking.
The corpses you will see on a cleaned area will alway get up then fall every times you will visit them, sometimes they will even just stay frozen staying up, pretty sure it wasn't like that before the update.
The other bug concern a spiked hole, if you fall in that hole you are suposed to die instantly, but you can actualy stay alive in it and see things you shouldn't (I was able to clip my head and see trough walls...) and parts of the hole didn't even have floor also.
The last boss fight really suc*** as* design wise, it was not only really boring (way too easy and uninteresting for a last encounter) but on top there was constant fps drops only on that part of the game (I supose because they rushed it...).
Sometimes searching things will be a pain in the as* and you will have to search with google to make youre life easier without spending 30 years looking around, but in that kind of games with object hunting, it is expected.

In short, I really enjoyed the game, but be aware of its flaws, if you don't like having a bit of jank in youre game and what I just described revulse you, then don't buy it.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198410169156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1576042675}
review:
The game looks fun and the concept was the reason I wanted to play this game, something like far cry 3 but with survival aspects of the forest. It's still in early access but there are somethings that worth mentioning like the animations that sometimes are weird like climbing, and when you hit your melee weapon to a wall or rock or anything solid it just pass through it without any sound or effect. The visuals and graphics are great but still need optimizing for less frame drops. 
Grab it on sale .

author: {'steamid': '76561198159699576', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2370, 'last_played': 1585057527}
review: Cosi si creano giochi....con il cuore..la passione...e un infinita abilita nel programmare bravi i ragazzi di indiegala se questa e solo un alpha ho paura di cosa diverra alla fine....girare su quest isola e un mix di emozioni dallo bellezza dei suoi paesaggi agli orrori che la abitano...e un alpha solo negli aspetti da limare (grafica dei personaggi e fisica nel mondo di gioco) perche  per il resto ragazzi(end game e cazzattine a parte)questo capolavoro e gia completo....a gia da offrirti ore di divertimento e terrore io allo stato attuale ho fatto tutte le quest presenti nell alpha 0.8.1 e ci ho giocato per 32 ore..ora non miresta che aspettare nuovi contenuti....e non vedo l ora.per 16 euro questi ragazzi vi stanno regalando un esperienza unica che vi stupira e vi fara dire ...QUESTO E UN GIOCO CAZZO.....neanche un tripla A capace di dare cio che da questo gioco....un altra perla indie...e questa volta finalmente MADE IN ITALY....forza INDIEGALA

author: {'steamid': '76561197970439559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1561587305}
review: My only concern with this game is it seems like there's been very little activity from the community lately. The Developers are continuing to work on it, the game continues to be updated regularly and it doesn't feel like an Alpha except in a couple spots with missing voice acting. However, the guides and gameplay videos all seem to be almost two years old. Where's the Love!? This is an awesome fusion of a Survival game with Tomb Raider style elements which is something I've been wanting for a long time. It deserves more love!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969719613', 'num_games_owned': 1573, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 4071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1667363175}
review:
This game pleasantly surprised me, being full of things to do and an interesting yet slightly disturbing story line, and somehow scratched the System Shock 2 itch with the exploration, looting and puzzle-solving.  Sneaking around when you've got nothing in the way of weapons is a really scary experience!  

I thoroughly enjoyed replaying the final release and can see it'll be something I'll play again.  Big thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198292131675', 'num_games_owned': 2407, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1558991501}
review:
4/10. - Beautiful/incredible scenery but the quest/story-line makes little to no sense.

The first hour I was amazed at how beautiful this game was and how I was excited to find out the lore/story of the game. I then continued to spend the next three hours running around almost clueless the entire time wondering where to go, what to do. It seems like there is no actual path or assistance other than "go to here. Go to there. Get this." It seems rushed and really poorly designed. 

Rare that I dislike a game but this game was most definitely NOT worthy of a recommendation.
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for your feedback.

If you look for a more linear experience may i suggest to try the prologue first, before starting a new game in Die Young?
You can simply right click on game name on steam library and hit 'Play Prologue'.

Die Young: Prologue is a story with a different protagonist ( Nehir ) that happens approximately 24 hours before the beginning of Die Young.
It is shorter than Die Young and is a complete ( not early access ) game on its own with a beginning and an end. It is more linear experience ( both for the level design and for the story ) and, other than telling you infos about the background of the island, it acts also like a sort of 'mini tutorial' to familiarize with Die Young mechanics.

Die Young, instead, is intended more like an experience with a certain degree of freedom on what to explore, where to go and which quests to make and in which order. 

Thank you for playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198808998951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1559393910}
review:
A DOG/HILLBILLY CHASE  SIMULATOR

Nice  idea for an Early  Access title  and it looks quite professionally done.   However, I  do not know  if this game will be  any good when it  will launch. 

 - Parkour? The climbing system is quite clunky. 
-  Everything is chasing you
-  I do  not know if updates have been made, but  it  is a mediterranean  island and the enemies  seem  like american  redneck  hillbillies  who call their mothers.  Why the enemies are not mediterranean?  Its like they would have smashed enemies from  another  game into Die Young's Mediterranean world.  It looks random  and out of place. 
- Earlier it  was  very hard to defend yourself  and  the  game play was pretty much about being chased constantly
- The lore is about finding these pieces of paper and dead fellows  so far. 
- the  island  is not huge and when there is  no base-building or crafting... then what is game really  is all about? It does  not  really feel like a survival  game, because you do not have to seriously craft/hunt food  or to find shelter from the elements. It's more like a  dog/hillbilly chase simulator  since  all resources are very  easily  attainable and obtaining them does not really  require "survival". 
- at least  earlier could only save at designated points, because creating a save point required crafting.  
- some Menu/inventory player interfaces  could be updated as they do not look as good as the rest of the graphics. 
-  there is not much to explore inside  built  structures. 
- Idea of the story is very good, but character design and story-line falls short. 


Positive
- Pretty nice graphics
- Interesting main character

I guess, this game could have potential,  but  I am  not too excited about it yet.  I think,  it needs   further updates to introduce new mechanisms. I know that developers  did not want to make a  base-building game,  but  I wish this title would have more sense of progression. Now it's more like "I  am just running around  this island with my weapon or stick".

I think, I would like this more if it  had more actual crafting and survival... or  if you would  have to be  stealthy and to steal food/resources from  the enemy camps. Well,  there is  actually a  stealth feature in this game since an icon indicates when you are hidden,  but the enemies  can spot you really easily.  It's like they have a wall hack. I am not completely happy with the AI, because  the enemies just usually  follow you  for a while  after you run out of the  range. 

I know developers wrote that the point of this game is  not about collecting resources and the description also makes a point that "fighting your way out is hopeless", but what we  currently have just seems quite "thin".

The  story would have a lot of potential, but  at the moment the game falls short at story telling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135799973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1597040591}
review:
i have not played this game for very long but in short on what it is and how it plays - its good
the combat feels good and i guess it use to be clunky but doesnt feel that way now idk if it ever did
the animations are still a tad clunky but nothing to make you go ugh forget this game..... like the dogs they have better animation then the humans
bad part of combat... sometimes the humans wont shut up, now is that game breaking or immersion breaking, I say no your on a island with crazies so i guess it helps it feel that way but still is obnoxious

now for the parkour part.. it runs great but it can be iffy on the grab points in other words sometimes and i mean sometimes so not alot the character wont grab even when it shows the grab marks or dust on the edges i wont say thats bad because I have played assassins creed since AC 1  and that one had some terrible moments where i was like really guy you could of made that

the world is pretty and detailed a little empty but not too bad now i haven't gotten far so it may get crazier later so i maybe still in a tutorial part of the world

if you watch a youtuber play it... make sure they are good because i watched a guy and was like uhhhh but then found someone else play it and say ohhh so that guy was trash not the game

I guess that wasnt' short but it was most deffinately a good buy

ohh and there is alot of parkour so be ready for jumping and climbing walls which if you like platformers this would be a perfect game for ya
and hit the rats with a wrench or bat.... trust me you will laugh

author: {'steamid': '76561198027905805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1648610113}
review:
A wonderful (psychological) survival horror experience with a heavy emphasis on parkour elements (and towering heights), lite combat and stealth, lite crafting, and exploration.

I strongly recommend to try out the parkour elements before keeping Die Young, as it can be a very divisive gameplay element for players, as it's not as well-polished as Dying Light, but works well enough and takes a good couple of hours getting used to. You'll need to have a fairly strong familiarization with how it works since most of the game will require you to have mastered it to an extent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008387361', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 3803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1833, 'last_played': 1679842016}
review:
I would describe this as a casual horror. Open world (or island), explore, get chased, fight if you can, survive.

When the game first game out early access, it was brutal and unforgiving a little hard to play. But the spooky environment ambiance kept me coming back.

Now with the extensive crafting, ability to craft camp fires (save points) it's much more enjoyable. The game does a great job of sucking you in, identifying with the main character. At the same time, the use of music, sound FX and such to make you feel uneasy, especially just before discovering something gruesome or just a bad situation to be in. :)

The story starts off simple, but gets deeper as you complete quests and explore. Every time I think I know whats going on, a new twist. 

My only complaint is 2 things.

1) The jumping, I think if you choose a easier difficulty there should be helper triggers, to help you jump. There is a lot of jumps were you need to be precise. I switch between keyboard/mouse and xbox controller all the time. You can compensate with crafting camp fires before dangerous jumping adventures :)

2) Would be nice to scroll around the map and be able to mark points on it, instead of just remembering were everything is. How ever having to remember how to get to places is also fun, so either way. But definitely scrolling around the map would be useful.

Really love this game, love horror. Can't wait to uncover the rest of the story..

Update
2020-04-23: Finally finished it, both endings. I was avoiding finishing it, like not wanting to finish a good book. I love the good ending the best, ESPECIALLY after the credits. Beautiful.
We live in some trying times right now and this game has helped me to get through. Love it! Thank you. Looking forward to your next projects :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198366158958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1587408621}
review:
Well, on Youtube this game seems interesting, but I'm strugling with it since 2 days. It simply cannot be launched on a branded Asus ROG PC. This is my very first such experience that a game crash upon start. 

I read all forums about it, it seem that there is some problem with Unreal Engine. 
The support is also not the fastest, no response from them yet, and also I didn't find any way to solve the problem. 
I even installed Unreal Engine, refreshed the files, validated, cleared the binaries, etc, nothing helps. 

So this game needs a lot of improvement still, before it could be played. I'm going to try fix it for the next week, if nothing happens then I redeem it.

Ok, so more than a year later I restarted my relationship with this game. I played for the past 2 days, so far it runs soomth, not a glitch or anything. So I didn't find technical issues.
After two days playing I found it the same like super-mario. You have to run up and down a lott. And I mean A LOT. Enormuos amount of jumping from platform-to platform in different mazes. Its hard to explore a certain area, because you run in circles for hours (hello Pinewood). Survial part is basically non-existant, you can find strawberry bushes everywhere, and despite I'm play on the hardest difficulty, the biggest challenge is to miss a jump and fall. I just died only from fall damage so far.
Map is useless, and the clues are just not straight enogh. Still I can progress, but it means I have to look behind every pixel. Because f this I found this boring too early...

author: {'steamid': '76561198009085623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1550103819}
review: Really wish I had got a refund on this game while I had the chance.  The graphics are nice but there is just too much I don't like about this game for me to really enjoy it.  For starters, all the platforming in it (jumping from platform to platform,)  is just way way too difficult.  I didn't buy this game because I wanted a platformer.   Next, almost everything you come across attacks you and is nearly impossible to defend yourself or get away from.   My last issue probably would not bother everyone, but I find it very annoying that no one can say a sentence without dropping an f-bomb.  I wish there was a filter or that it at least was cut back some.  I do see potential here and will periodically check on it, as it is still early access and could yet blossom into something special.  But as it stands now, I have a hard time recommending it.
